title: Press "hold" then up or down; let the temp flash on LED, up r down, then it's "held"
author: BILLY AND ALLEY
info_3: Update-stopped working properly a few months after my review but just getting a chance to change this to one star rating. I would set it on 75 degrees then an hour later it would be set to 71 even after turning off the programming. First one worked 10 years!Old Review- Mine worked great after setting a few programmable times. I usually set it to hold anyway during the summer. Despite the neg reviews some gave, mine worked great and is still doing what I programmed it to do. If you want to hold at a center temp; as some were having problems; just make sure you press "Hold" (you can see the hold change on the led) then press the up or down button until the temp flashes on the LED, then it's on the temp you want it held at. I use this programmable one during the winter. 2nd one I have owned. First one lasted 10 years; practically identical to this one, same brand/buttons; just a newer version I guess.

title: Good quality product, easy install for inexperienced user... go for it
author: hendysuz
info_3: Installation complete!  I am not an electrician and I don't have a man around to do these things for me (not worth it when I am pretty capable).  This was really easy, and I normally shy away from electrical work, but the instructions seemed clear on the exterior package.  The book inside was well written and concise. Had the tools, turned off the breakers and about 30 minutes later I had a functioning thermostat.  It's running now and things seem to be working well.  I'll update again if it doesn't seem to doing the job or fails.Gave it five stars, o my negative I can find is that it was so inexpensive so in the back of my head I'm anticipating failure... but everything seems to be working. Looks really nice on my wall, and quality of product is nice.  5 stars

title: Worth the money
author: Mark J Daniels
info_3: The thermostats work great. I bought them for the Parrish Hall for the Church. There were 8 zones so I needed 8 units. The programing of the thermostats is very easy. The instructions are printed inside the cover. One unit did come with a bad LCD display and needed to be replaced. Amazon, as always, made sure the exchange was quick and painless.  I would have only deducted half a star but I am not allowed to. The reason for the 4 stars is as follows. 1. There is a sticker that covers the LCD screen that is really tough to remove. You really need to pull hard to get it off. I wonder if this is the reason one LCD display was not working.  2.  Included in the package are stickers that you can mark the wires going to the thermostat. The stickers had really poor adhesive on them and would not stick together at all. I had to use scotch tape to hold the stickers on. The stickers would not be a problem for a 2 wire connection but 3 of the thermostats have 5 wire connections.  3. Batteries not included.  4. There is only 2 mounting screws in the package. There should be a minimum of 3.  Overall the units are doing what I need them to do.

title: Does what it wants to
author: Haawwkeye
info_3: I bought this one as a replacement for my other Hunter Thermostat, and finally installed it today and wouldn't you know it, it doesn't work and my Return window closed on Jul 17, 2017.  What a bummer.  It will not stay at a set temp, it basically does what it wants to, so I put my old one back up till I can find one that will work......I don't know if we got a defective one, but this thermostat does not stick to the settings we programmed into it.

title: Doesn't work correctly
author: Astrid
info_3: We received this thermostat and within an hour or so it was clear it didn't measure the temperature correctly and it kept resetting itself. We would have it programmed to stay at 75 and after three hours it would decide to just switch to 85. After 2 days of this and setting all kinds of programs, we decided it was time to exchange it. I asked for an exchange rather than a return thinking it was just one bad unit and because it was an exact replica of our old, broken thermostat, just a different brand. The replacement arrived and this time it took about 10 hours before that unit too was defective. We call the manufacturers, thinking maybe this was operator error but they told us "you'll need to buy a new one"Needless to say we won't be buying a new one.This is one terrible product. I'm currently processing my refund through amazon and we've since bought a completely different thermostat that works just fine.

title: We like to keep our heat on 65
author: User
info_3: I don't know if we got a defective one, but this thermostat does not stick to the settings we programmed into it.  We like to keep our heat on 65, and lower it when we're not home.  A couple of times we've heard the burner constantly on and checked it, and it was set to 69 degrees.  Other times it has been off altogether.  We will be returning this for a different thermostat.

title: Perfect for RV!
author: LogicalOne
info_3: Utilizing this in my fifth wheel camper, this is one of very few with an adjustable span setting. Using this to keep the furnace from cycling excessively. With the span setting at three the furnace is operating as it should and does not cycle mor than once an hour! This is exactly what I needed!

title: Wonderful!!
author: H.Howard
info_3: Easy to hook up, Easy to program, Easy to use, and never fails us.  The filter indicator as well as the battery indicator are great.  I love this little box!!

title: Great item!
author: RC
info_3: This unit replaced the same unit that I purchased 10 years ago.  Any glitches in the 10-year old unit have been remedied.  Worth every penny!

title: Worked fine, except it only functions properly with a HVAC ...
author: Manvessel
info_3: Worked fine, except it only functions properly with a HVAC that has a heat pump, otherwise it won't allow separate control of heat and AC. Should have warning on label.

title: One Star
author: Bill
info_3: Do not buy a Hunter Thermostat-Tried 4 all defective.

title: great thermostat for the money
author: Jeffrey J. Smith
info_3: Just bought a house, and needed a new thermostat. After looking and reading some reviews I decided on this one.  Easy to install, and easy to program.  nice to have the weekday programmed out for when im at work and home, and the weekend being separate is nice.  Worth the money, worked with my hot water heater furnace system, (two wire, white and black). Here's hoping to a more energy efficient bill.

title: Good product for a fair price

info_3: Reasonable inexpensive thermostat. I've had one of these in my house for almost ten years, still works flawlessly.

author: Amanda Mitchell
info_3: After months of thinking my spouse had changed the thermostat and he thinking that I had, we experimented to figure out this problem. We have come to the conclusion that this is not a programmable thermostat and doesn't even work as a manual thermostat. It daily changes temperatures even when every program is set to 70 degrees. Wish I could return it. We believe that this may be a knock off since we have owned great Hunter brand thermostats in the past.

title: It was easy to program and easy to adjust the programming

info_3: It was easy to program and easy to adjust the programming. Installation was a breeze. So happy with my purchase.

Sent it back got another one same thing I already have two in use and they work fine do not think it is me, but decided before I sent it back to call Hunter tech support have been on hold for 1 hour and 10 minuets.  So I would not buy this product unless you want to just manually control the heat or ac.

info_3: Defective, won?™t hold the set temperature.  We have two older versions of this same model and they are fine.  QC is bad on the new ones or they are counterfeit.  We got 2/2 bad ones from Amazon in late September 2017.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: excellent

title: Easy to install and use
author: Jey
info_3: Easy to install, program and use. It's had a few minor glitches but works well for the price. It's convenient and economical to have the temperature automatically adjust at certain times of the day. Instructions are easy to follow and the typical non-electrician can install it.

title: Termporary override does not work
author: Rich
info_3: When I try to temporarily override the set program, it permanently changes the program.  When I press up or down to change the temperature, it will change the program for the entire time slot to the new temperature.  So if I change a 12-5 program from say 60 to 70 with just using the up button, tomorrow from 12-5 it will be programmed to 70.  It's almost like having a manual thermostat.

title: Avoid the headache
author: Truth
info_3: I followed the instructions to the letter and my thermostat still wont work properly. First nite I installed it I set it at 78, and yes it qas on the hold override my ac ran all night and in the morning it was at 66 degrees! Would not shut off no matter how high the temp was. SMH

title: heater won t warm up. 72
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Perfect for heating and air. Before house would not warm up past 72. Now it gets to 80+. All this time thermostat was bad.Worth every penny.

info_3: The thermostat did not work. I have this same thermostat for another zone, but after reading other reviews it appears that they changed how its made. I did not purchase a replacement.

info_3: Works great and good value for the price. I installed it in my 5th wheel and couldn't be happier. Love the backlight and dwelll settings. Has to install a micro switch to control my fan speed but otherwise perfect.

author: melvin a tahir
info_3: Lacks many features, about average, nothing special.

title: Five Stars
author: T Lady
info_3: Very easy to install, great price, and easy to program!

title: Poor Quality Control
author: GReviews
info_3: We ordered two Hunter 44157 for our rental properties to replace some older manual thermostats. We intentionally looked for this brand because we've owned the Hunter 44110 (no backlight) for six+ years and have had a good experience with them. The backlight in the 44157 model seemed appealing and the advertised feature set (per the user manual) was all the same as our older ones, so we felt good about giving them a try. Below is a brief description of our experience.Ease of Installation and UseThe included installation/user manual is adequate for most skill levels, and for most normal (single stage) natural gas furnace installations the process is straightforward. We also preferred these over the ones in stock at the local hardware stores because the batteries are very easy to replace right on the front of the unit. Most models sold now a days require you to remove the unit from its wall plate to replace the batteries located inside of the thermostat; which is intimidating for most tenants.The Temperature HOLD FeatureThe printed documentation as well as the instructions on the unit itself describe the HOLD feature as a way to permanently override all programming settings, leaving the unit in "manual' operation or vacation mode. In other words, while the HOLD icon displays on the screen, the programming will not run; the temperature you set it to will be held until you manually change it. For our needs, this feature is not only desirable but required when one of our rentals is vacant as it makes it simple to override the programming. Our older 44110 units work this way and they have been reliable so far. Not so for these 44157 model. The HOLD feature on these is erratic and cannot be trusted. As you read the different reviews and their comments for this on Amazon, you'll find people having totally opposing opinions and experiences with it even after carefully following the printed instructions.The Night-Light FeatureWe installed both of them according to the product's instructions and proceeded to setup a custom programming for the week/weekend days. The backlight comes on when any of the buttons is pressed and goes off on its own after a few seconds. Sadly, the backlight in one of them failed within the first few minutes of use. It started working fine but then it flickered a couple of times and just would not light up anymore. The other one was installed in a unit that was vacant at the time, so we setup a very specific programming for it. The backlight on this second unit would light up, but it also had a little flicker issue, and while the light was was on, you could hear a faint beep sound from inside the unit.The ProgrammingAfter about four days, we stopped at the vacant unit and inspected the programming only to find that it had very different set of times and temperatures from what we had originally set it to. Re-programmed it the way we needed it, and then ran the furnace a couple of cycles while we did some cleaning. It turns out the thermostat unit was sort of resetting itself to random temperatures ranging from 48F to 69F, all within a couple of hours time.It seems the manufacturer has lowered their quality control standards and so their products are no longer as solid as they used to be. We returned both units and replaced them with a different brand.

title: Not a good Thermostat
author: Riptide110
info_3: Display is easy to read and functions are easy to use.  As stated by other, when heat is turn on, thermostat will NOT kick off.  Heat will not turn off until thermostat is turned off.

title: Really like this thermostat
author: T-n-T Handywork
info_3: Really like this thermostat. Easy to read and use. Been using for 3 months with both AC and Heat. Reliable performance.

title: ... thermostat that can be programmed while setting in your easy chair and it is very inexpensive with up to ...
author: Roger Irving
info_3: This very reliable programmable thermostat that can be programmed while setting in your easy chair and it is very inexpensive with up to 4 separate programs for each day..

title: Next time I am going to purchase a better one.
author: Bad Mackrel
info_3: these only seem to last a few years. Next time I am going to purchase a better one.

title: Hold setting for vacation does not work!
author: Middle-aged dad
info_3: This could be a fine thermostat, but the "Hold" function does not work.  I push the "hold" button until the "hold" icon appears. then I adjust the temperature. Mine does not act as a permanent hold OR a temporary hold. It simply changes the temp I had previously set for the current time period in the "program" menu. I can take the "hold" off, and my program remains changed until I go back in and fix it. really annoying and not very helpful for setting for vacation. I got this to replace another Hunter model, and I liked it because it is large and covers the hole in the wall well.  But, this flaw really ruins the thermostat.  I actually ordered a 2nd one thinking the 1st one I bought was a "dud", but the 2nd one I purchased has the same flaw.  DO NOT BUY!

title: Love this. Able to program temperatures for different times ...
author: Nick
info_3: Love this. Able to program temperatures for different times of day which has helped lower the electric bill. Also looks nice.

title: Five Stars
author: ohg
info_3: Works perfectly

title: Five Stars
author: Cathy Herman
info_3: Works great now that I am in the winter season.  Would definitely buy again.

title: I've had one of these and never had a problem ...
author: Savannah Martin
info_3: I've had one of these and never had a problem out of it. So when we bought a new house, I decided to buy one to install there.

title: Good product
author: buzz66boy
info_3: I have used these thermostats for several years in many different locations and they work great.  I have never had any issue.

title: Not for those that want to temporarily override the programming
author: Blofeld's Cat
info_3: This was a rather disappointing experience.  I had installed an older model at my last place and was very happy with it, never having any problems.  So despite what some others reported, I purchased this model.  Unfortunately I encountered the same problems.  If I deviated from the programmed temperatures by manually adjusting the thermostat, it affected the permanent program for that time period.  So the next day, when the program for that time period activated, the temporary setting was the one used.  It did not matter if I used the permanent override or not, the changes always affected the programming even though I was not in programming mode.  I ended up sending it back and purchasing a Honeywell.  For those that want to simply program and never change anything on a temporary basis, the Hunter would be fine.  It's too bad because in all other respects, it worked just the way it should.

title: Great thermostat
author: David Briggs
info_3: I really like the fully programmable features.  Easy to program,  and once you've set it up, you'll never have to touch it again!

title: Four Stars
author: barry zwicker
info_3: Works fine.

title: Five Stars
author: Royal Palm Bch Mom

title: my electricity bill shot up by like $70. I programmed this thermostat to about 78 ...
author: Natasha A.
info_3: After owning this thermostat for all of a few weeks, my electricity bill shot up by like $70. I programmed this thermostat to about 78 degrees while I was at work, however, instead of it cooling the house if the temperature went over 78 degrees, it would heat the house to 78 degrees (while in cool mode)!!!! I'd set it to about 72 at night, and wake up in the middle of the night sweating because the thermostat was on like 80. I had to completely just turn off my AC and sleep in front of a fan, and I live in South Florida!!! THIS THERMOSTAT SUCKS!!! IT'S THE WORST. AVOID AT ALL COST!!! DO NOT BUY UNLESS YOU WANT AN AT HOME SAUNA!!!

title: Terrible
author: movie collector
info_3: The heater will not stop running.  I had the Heat set for 70 degrees, it never shut off!  I manually turned it off when it reached 80 degrees.  Called my electrician and told him the brand i purchased, he said that this particular brand has a low success rate of working properly.  He suggested a Honeywell brand.  I installed the honey well and now everything works perfectly.

title: Bad Product!
author: vegasgal
info_3: I purchased this thermostat because simply because of the blue backlight.  It was identical to the one I already had except mine did not have a backlight and it was not programmable.  I tried it for a few days but no matter how we set it, it kept doing its own thing and changing the temperature.  My son is very mechanically inclined, so when he couldn't get it to work properly, I knew it was either defective or a really bad product.  I ended up returning this thermostat and ordering PRO1 IAQ T701 (non-programmable) instead.  The PRO model is excellent!  It works perfectly, and I now have the blue backlight that I wanted.

title: Two Stars

info_3: Not work to good turn on and after 10 second turn off

title: HUNT for a different thermostat.
author: ken van de north
info_3: Directions were very complicated and not user friendly. When I called Hunter support, I was told that they do not make thermostats any more and could not help.

title: No good. Dont buy.
author: Clev Family
info_3: This was my second one. It also failed. Finally replaced with better brand Honeywell.

title: Poor quality
author: PAUL R. KING
info_3: Actual temp off by as much as 5 degrees

title: Solid feature set, good price
author: whit
info_3: This is full-featured at a good price. Not only does it have 4 time periods per day, and separate settings for weekends, but it has a settable "span," to determine how many degrees to go below and above the set temperature before switching on or off. A wider span can avoid cycling your furnace or pellet stove too fast. Other thermostats this price lack that feature. It also can be set to ramp between settings, rather than suddenly change them at the set times.Definitely requires reading the manual. The controls will not make sense without it. Several switches on the back which have to be set right for your system before putting it on the wall.

title: Mine could have been a lemon, but I wasn't interested in going through another especially cold night to figure it out!
author: jfdavis27822
info_3: I was replacing an older version of this same exact thermostat.  I'm not sure if the quality itself has diminished since my original was manufactured, but I had to return this new one for a refund.  I programmed this thermostat exactly as I had programmed the original and the first problem that I had was that the new unit would intermittently jump away from the program.  It was programmed to keep the heat temp set at 66F during the overnight hours and three times in two weeks we woke up to temps of 55F and 58F???  That alone was enough for me, but that wasn't the end of it.  My old unit worked great for 10+ years, but the temp up/down buttons began to not work and that was the reason for the replacement.  I ordered a LUXPRO unit to try.  The first thing I noticed was the my original Hunter and the new LUX registered the same temp, while the new Hunter that I have since returned, was registering 3F higher than both of the others.  Obviously, I was happy with the service of the first Hunter unit, but for some reason, the new unit did not meet the high operating standards that I had enjoyed for the last ten years.

title: Disappointed with Hunter's customer support.
author: W.B.
info_3: I have been using Hunter thermostats for many years. However, my recent purchase was very disappointing; the thermostat consistently shows the temperature 3 to 4 degree lower. I contacted Hunter support and asked if they could mail me a new control board. They recommended to do a hard reset, which did not help. I told them, I would rather avoid giving a bad review and all the hassle with a return. They offered no help. The seller offered to refund the product, upon return. I decided to set everything down by 4 degrees, and it works fine, unless a family member changes it back to standard setpoint. I can't believe that Hunter would not send me a working board that costs them some 2 to 3 dollars. Bad customer support. Sad.

title: Certified Engineer
author: Jesse B
info_3: This item is not good at all. I have this in a vacant unit we are remodeling. My HVAC system was short cycling and i thought it was the thermostat. It wasnt my return vent is not a long enough run and i corrected this. This thermostat was set and programmed to 55 degrees. I came to this unit after the holidays and its 83 degrees. The set point still showed 55 degrees. I turned it off and will use it like this until i get a wifi enabled thermostat. Do not buy this if you want it to work. I am lucky to have the skills to install and uninstall for nothing but my time. Some people are not that lucky.

title: Great gift for someone you don't like
author: Vince Weaver
info_3: Garbage.  Run the other way.  As others have posted, this unit has a mind of it's own.  The first year, it was pretty intermittent.  I thought someone in the house was screwing with the settings.  Eventually, it started doing it so regularly, I knew it was the unit- but of course by then, it was out of warranty. What it does for me is it changes the temp setting to a default 60 degrees.  We would go to bed with the setting and temperature at 70, and wake up at 4 in the morning with the setting at 60, and the house temp dropped to 63 or lower.  Could happen any time of day or night at random.At the time of purchase, it was a mid-priced unit.  I wouldn't install another one if it were free after seeing so many reviews with the same or similar issue.

title: They were both used moderately at best as we will in a temperate climate and rarely ...
author: Gafar
info_3: I purchased two of these about 2 years ago and had them professionally installed.  They were both used moderately at best as we will in a temperate climate and rarely need heat or air con (maybe 90 days per year).  Both units failed within that time from faulty buttons. Hunter would not help as 1 year warranty had expired. I would expect 5-10 years of use out of a home thermostat not 13 and 18 months.

title: Don't bother
author: Britcanuck
info_3: Waste of time, Hunter used to make great thermostats but now they should stick with making blinds

title: great themostat at a great price

info_3: great themostat at a great price,, not the best quality,, but if you dont abuse it ,, it works fine..

title: JUNK
author: Knight
info_3: Lasted about 3 years before the temp set buttons had to be pushed in with a pen or pencil and held to get the temp to change. ABSOULUTE JUNK, VERY CHEAP PRODUCT DOES NOT LAST.

title: Easy to install, but it's got the DEVIL IN IT!
author: Ravenous
info_3: Bought this from Wal-Mart. Easy to install, read the instructions and all, but this thermostat has a mind of its own.Every once and a while I notice it feels to hot inside, and I find that it's set to 68, or even 75. It's random. I'm frequently having to go through the whole program to make sure the two different times during the weekdays and weekends are set back to where I want it. Frustrating.

title: don't waste your money
author: Brooke douglass
info_3: Constantly resets itself. Won't reach desired temps. I'll do a permanent hold on 70 yet 10 minutes later its set on 60 . Horrible thermostat.

title: Batteries are good of course because I've tested them
author: John Hashimoto
info_3: I've been getting low battery messages now for a couple of months even after I install new batteries! Batteries are good of course because I've tested them.  Today was freezing and the furnace would not start at all. Installed new batteries and went through all the resets listed in the manual. No Go! I tried to call the tech support line and they couldn't take my call because their system was down.Drove to Home Depot, bought a Honeywell unit and got it going in about 15 minutes.Thumbs DOWN.

title: After doing a great deal of research so that I fully understood how ...
author: Jeff D
info_3: Replaced my old Baystat240 with the TX500Uc on a Trane heat pump. I compared quite a few thermostats and the LUX had the features I desired.  After doing a great deal of research so that I fully understood how each of the 8 wires on the old system worked, I was quite comfortable making the change.  Took about 20 minutes and so far after a week the LUX has worked perfectly.  We are using this in a second home, so we keep it on manual.  In addition the adjustable settings for swing temperature and when the AUX heat kicks in should save plenty of money and wear and tear over the years.  I've seen a couple of reviews that say there is a high pitch hum when the light is on, but I can't hear anything.  My only criticism is that the back light is a little dim, otherwise the unit has been great.

title: Easy to setup and noticed a small decrease in our utility bills
author: dnome123
info_3: Easy to setup and noticed a small decrease in our utility bills - nothing major, but we are only decreasing the heat/air when we are at work only by 3 degrees. Obviously, we could save more by going to the recommended 8 degrees for heat and 4 degrees for air, but the product works great and easy to use.

title: ... large (don't need reading glasses) The programming options are great including "the deadband" factor such that the pellet st
author: Rob06
info_3: I purchased 2- one for pellet stove and one for heat pumpI stagger their operation ---- use pellet stove when outside temperatures are below 38FDisplay is large (don't need reading glasses)The programming options are great including "the deadband" factor such that the pellet stove or heat pump don't keep turning on and off when the house temperature drops just one degree below set point-- should make the heating units last longer( much less cycling on/off)

title: Works as intended at a reasonable price.
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Pros:* Works as intended at a reasonable price.* Saves energy because I would very often forget to turn the dial down on my old one when I left for work.* Independent Morning, day, evening, and night time slotsCons:* The printed manual omits several useful features.  Download a better one from LUX's website.  In particular there is a copy feature which would have saved me time setting it up.

title: Replacement for really old gas heating unit
author: JL
info_3: Works as advertised. For some reason I'm unable to set the time. Following instructions and the thermostat does not respond as it's supposed to for changing time. Tried their customer support line, but they have very restricted hours of operation. Regardless, unit works itself other than that.

title: Simple, user friendly. Couldn't ask for more.
author: Farid B.
info_3: This is by far the best thermostat I have purchased. It is incredibly simple and all that you could ask for. I also love how there is only a "2 period" programming, unlike most thermostats that make it hard for you to program by using "4 periods" of scheduling temp. changes in one day. Who needs that?

title: Great buy for the price and functionality.
author: Vince_A
info_3: This worked out very well. Installation was a breeze, about 20 minutes for given a few issues with the installer. Set-up and programming wasn't much of a issue either. The thermostat is working out perfectly, it runs as programmed and is very accurate.

title: not bad. The item was shipped as stated in posting ...
author: Earl Smolen
info_3: Saved a few bucks here by ordering from amazon warehouse deals; just over $37; not bad. The item was shipped as stated in posting that there may be no packaging (like a sealed clamshell with insert and manual). So just a bubble wrapped thermostat is is what I received. Believe that these are tested before they ship. It was easy to install (replaced a round honeywell) and seems to function very good. The Lux website provided me with a programming manual so that was not a problem. I'm giving it a four star because the hinge on cover plate needs to be redesigned (alignment problem), makes it tricky to close unless you have the hinge in the right position. Plus the face plate itself is difficult to remove if you have to change the battery and that's coming from somebody that is mechanically inclined. Lux should fix that problem. This thing may require some special handling but not bad for the money...

title: Installed quickly, generally easy to program, maintains even temp
author: Bruce H
info_3: This thermostat installed quickly and was generally easy to program. The anticipation feature seems to work well as the room is much closer to the daytime set point in the morning now than with the prior thermostat that did not have that feature. I am testing to see if the thermostat is smart enough to start pre-heating the room earlier after colder nights than on warmer nights (if not, then it's just like setting the temperature to switch from night to day earlier, something you could do by yourself).Minor nit is that the illuminated display is pretty dim.

title: This is the thermostat for pellet stoves.
author: Jeff
info_3: After reading up on some forums about adding a thermostat to my pellet stove it seemed the Lux TX1500a was the one to get.That one seemed to be discontinued so I took a chance and went for this.Install was easy, though the included instructions are sort of a cheat sheet version of the manual, but got the job done.  If you need more in depth instructions you can download the whole manual at LUXs website which made it easy.So pellet stoves need to run a cycle, they shouldn't be kicking on and off all the time or you'll put wear on your ingniter and other parts.  I called LUX about this and got a very helpful answer and was quickly told what to set it to make it work better for my application.  I read some complaints about LUXs customer service namely the call back thing.  Well I missed the call back and called back the number given, pressed 7 (per their instructions) and got a tech guy right away.All in all a nice modern looking and simple to operate thermostat.  I'd buy another.

title: Works well on my wood pellet stove.
author: Alan
info_3: Excellent product. Works really well to control my Quadrafire Bay 1200 wood pellrt stove. Highly recommend.***** PS- excellent product backup as well. After approx 1.5 years, the electronics controlling battery life went on the blink. I contacted Lux assistance line and they replaced at no charge - received replacement in 2 days! When was the last time you received customer service like that?

title: Simple, value priced thermostat
author: Russ Wyborski
info_3: The installation instructions could have been clearer. Took me awhile to figure out the correct wiring. The fact that my old thermostat didn't have any wiring indications on it didn't help. Programming was very easy. I'm fine with the Weekday/Weekend program settings. Much cheaper than the $140 thermostat that the local heating guys wanted to put in (plus labor).

title: Good thermostat, not so good customer support
author: BobK
info_3: i just bought a Lux TX9100U thermostat to replace a failing one. I submitted a ticket to Lux customer support to ask about my problem and did not receive a reply. Just saying... My customer support experience does not seem to match that of others.I like the thermostat. It has all the features I need, easy to install, easy to program. After 2 years one unit decided to run through new batteries and declare them low. Others seem to have this problem.

title: Nice now, hoping this LUX will last longer.
author: E. Santandrea
info_3: Its OK.  I replace a previous LUX unit with this one because I could no longer update the settings because the buttons were non responsive (really had to press HARD).  I hope this lasts longer than the previous model.  I hate replacing stuff every 7 years or so.  Old thermo's lasted decades...

title: Does a great job!
author: John Barber
info_3: Very easy to install and program. You need to understand that the program can not be different for each day except for Saturday and Sunday. Basically, you define the divisions for the day, either 2 or 4 divisions, and program the start and end time as well as the temperature for each division. You only do this once and all the weekdays are done. Saturday and Sunday are done the same except that you can program each day independently. The one I received took some effort to separate the front and back halves but I took a really sharp knife and gradually removed a tiny amount of plastic from the catches until it opened and closed smoothly. I saw that a couple of people commented on it being 'wobbly'. I don't know what that's about - use the anchors and it is rock solid. Good unit.

title: Excellent
author: Ian
info_3: I really like it. It is simple and inexpensive, even easy to install following the removal of the one it is replacing. I only wish I would have considered the 5-1-1 version because my Saturdays and Sundays are used differently. Just something to consider. Other than that, and excellent investment for the money.

title: Lux Tech Support very helpful!  Good product
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: I had a Lux thermostat in my previous home which I loved, so when I purchased a condo I replaced the thermostat with a Lux.  I had some problems with it short cycling.  After speaking with the tech support person (Joel) at Lux Products, he suggested some adjustments for me and it didn't help.  I have a 16 year old air conditioner.  So he sent me out a different model to replace this and it works great!  The tech support people at Lux are great !  I am very satisfied with the purchase and I'm glad I stuck with the Lux brand!The only down side is the cover on the thermostat seems a bit flimsy and difficult to open, so I would suggest that they change that feature.

title: Looks good and I can actually use it in the dark ...
author: Like Life
info_3: Works perfectly with my central air and heating. Looks good and I can actually use it in the dark when I've shut all the lights off for bed. Does what competitors units do and does so at half the price. Took one star off for the flimsy door, but in functionality and price it deserves 5.

title: It's getting hot in here
author: TJ
info_3: Low cost option for those who want to upgrade to a programmable thermostat. I was able to install the thermostat in under 10 minutes. This was my first thermostat installation and the instructions were easy follow. This product is highly rated on other consumer review sites.

title: Installed 3 no problem, they've been installed for months ...
author: DeAnda Fam 3
info_3: Installed 3 no problem, they've been installed for months and we are saving money with having programmable ones in AZ! Win, Win!

title: They were very easy to install and I like the screen layout
author: AJT - NC
info_3: They were very easy to install and I like the screen layout. I would recommend to anybody who needs a new thermostat. I installed within 15 minutes.

title: Great product
author: eddy
info_3: Quick setup, lots of functions to support various systems and user setting as well as lockout control for the kids and wife!

title: I am happy with this one
author: Arthur David Digby
info_3: I followed the instructions carefully and it worked just the way it promised the first time. It has continued to do just what it is supposed to ever since. Even my sister-in-law has learned to change the settings (which may not be a good thing) so the programing is easily understood.

title: It's nice and appears to work and comes at a decent ...
author: Anubis
info_3: I've been wanting my own programmable thermostat for years now, but apartment living has been a damper to that ... so this is the first unit I've owned.  It's nice and appears to work and comes at a decent price, but it's not that user friendly.Installation was fairly easy.  As a new home owner, my opinion on this may be somewhat tainted in that I haven't done a lot of around-the-house labor to have a good scale of difficulty built up, but then again, if I can do it, it's probably pretty simple.  I have VERY limited electrical wiring experience, but the instructions are clear enough in this regard to walk you through it.  And they include 6 diagrams for the 6 most common home HVAC wiring schemes, with each of those including possible variations on wire labels.  My biggest complaint here is that the included paper instruction manual is basically a single large sheet of paper that is somewhat confusing and extremely simplistic.  The included manual does make it clear that the full manual is available online as a PDF, but the problem is that they tried to include both the installation and the operation instructions on the one sheet of paper ... if you're going to omit material and tell someone to go to the website to read the whole thing, at least include all of the INSTALLATION instructions.  Along with that, there wasn't much help in trying to sort out what type of system your house might have (if say, you've only lived there a month).Operation is a little more wonky.  My complaints here are not about functionality ... in fact, this programmable thermostat has quite a few features for something so reasonably priced.  I actually didn't expect things like "smart recovery" (where it learns how long it takes the HVAC to reach the desire temperature, then starts it up BEFORE the desired time so that the desired temperature is reached ahead of time) or filter reminders.  The problem is that the actual user interface and the methods by which you interact with the thermostat are not intuitive or friendly.  The basics are obvious enough, but for things like accessing display features or system running customization, it becomes something of a chore that will require you to check the manual.  For example, just to change something like temperature display (Fahrenheit or Celcius), you have to set the HEAT / COOL switch to off, then hold NEXT for 5 seconds, which pops up a series of VERY simply worded phrases that amount to a number and a short-hand, and you have to scroll through these from beginning to end, with no jumping forward or backward option.  This is the case for most of the program features.  One lucky break: the thermostat includes a COPY feature, which lets you copy an entire day's worth of programed temperatures and times to another day.  Without this, it would take you a good 10 minutes or more just to program the 4 periods of the 7 days.So while I highly recommend this thermostat for the reasonable price and various programmable features, along with the 7 day format, be aware that it is not easy to interact with, and you'll probably need to consult the manual anytime you need to change something other than the current temperature.-- EDIT: As a quick pointer, I notice that this thermostat, or maybe it's just thermostats in general, does not like rechargeable batteries.  It seems there is some kind of voltage problem, as it shows as full for about a week or so, then suddenly the battery is dead.  However, when I use standard one-use AA batteries, it works fine ... and in fact, I haven't replaced the batteries for well over a month now. --

title: Does the job very, very well.
author: M. Booth
info_3: Does the job very, very well.  Is easy to use and the display is easy on old eyes.Installation was easy.  Instructions were confusing because it is compatible with many different types of systems. Very easy to follow once you determine what you have.

title: very nice.
author: olddice
info_3: As promised, very nice.

title: Easy instalation and programming.
author: Comodoro1978
info_3: I installed this in just a couple of minutes and had it up and running in another few!Product appearance and quality is good enough. As in other reviews, I question to fragility of the lid, it looks like it is quite possible to break and so I am handling it with great care, though I've had no problems so far.

title: Finer control of "Setback" would be nice
author: Daniel
info_3: My single biggest complaint is the hourly resolution of the "Setback" function?”often I know I'll be out for about <something>-and-a-half hours and would like the heat to come back on then. A better set of steps would be something like every 15 minutes for 2 hours, then every half hour up to 12 hours, then hourly for the next 12, then daily.Other than that, this is a solid thermostat. Programming is as easy as it gets without a touch screen, filter warning is nice (and configurable), display is large and crisp, backlight is bright but not outrageously so and makes only a nearly-inaudible whine.

title: Get you one, and save.
author: A2theJackson
info_3: ***Update 1/2/18Lowered rating from 5 to 3 stars. Unit has now started flashing "low battery" yet batteries have been replaced with known good units. Resets and adjustments have no effect. It still functions, but how am I supposed to trust it when batteries actually need replacing again? Also there is now an electronic "ringing" when the backight is on.*** Original review October 2016Wonderful product. Been using it now for 7 months in a rental home. Previous Honeywell standard digital non-programmable would not trigger the system, and replaced with this Lux TX1500U. Apparently the Honeywell was also off by 3 degrees!! I have noticed a good $20-$30 drop in my electric bills based on the past. I have it programmed to change temperature after I leave for work, and right before I get home, and also to cool off overnight. The weekend has a different schedule as well. It is really nice to not have to deal with the temperature settings for vacation as well. It will hold a set temperature for several days while I am away, and click back on before I arrive; nice. The filter and battery monitor is nice as well.I have not noticed any problems with this thermostat. It was really easy to set up as well.

title: Easy to install and straight forward programming
author: A. Bailey
info_3: Easy to install and straight forward programming. Large display with logical layout. Annoying buzzing sound emanates from display when backlight is on but it stops once the backlight turns off. I would give 5 stars except for the "buzzing" which doesn't belong in any consumer electronic device. For the price paid, this is a great value.

title: Work well but have minor annoyances
author: Stephen
info_3: I replaced all the thermostats in my house with these.  They work well and I don't know of another product that would be better.  It is especially good that: - They work with a variety of heating systems.  I have some zones with air conditioning and some without.  The same thermostat can be used with either. - They have settings for four time periods or just two time periods.  I have a zone where nobody sleeps where I have just a day and night schedule.  Other zones have the full wake, leave, return, sleep schedules. - There are separate schedules for each day of the week. - There is a copy feature to program the same schedule onto multiple days so that you don't have to press so many buttons programmingI'm not giving it five stars because there are some annoyances: - The back light makes a high pitched hum noise while it is on - I wish the only buttons on the front were temperature up and down.  The hold, and "set back" buttons should be hidden under the cover. - The "set back" feature is very hard to use.  You have to hold down the button, adjust the set back temperature, and choose a duration.  It is difficult enough to use that I wish it were not even included. - There are multiple hidden menus.  The hidden menu for calibration is different than the hidden menu for turning on and off features.  The manual says which button combinations you have to hold down to get to the different hidden menus.  It would be nice to have a single hidden menu. - I had to calibrate mine.  When they came they were not well calibrated.  I put multiple of them next to each other gave them an hour.  After that time they disagreed by three degrees.

title: Very good product so far.
author: bossless
info_3: Excellent features.  Good price.  Easy to install compared to other brands.

title: Great for Pellet Stove
author: R. Reed
info_3: Purchased this for use with my Ecco Choice CAB50 Pellet stove.  Perfect t-stat for this stove since it has the variable swing and low voltage input necessary to work properly.  Super simple installation and function.  Highly recommend.

title: Easy to install and easy to use
author: CodingChris
info_3: Straight forward installation information and - if it's not in the documentation they sent - you can find additional info on their web site.

title: 99% Perfect!
author: Whisper
info_3: TX9100Ua and TX9100Uc (This First review was in Early 2015 I think)This economical unit is Excellent and a Real Bargain to boot. It has every feature we needed- is inexpensive, easy to program, easy to use, has a good downloadable instruction manual, first rate build quality and has a responsive US based technical  help line that really does help!We are refitting our old Church steam heating system with Programmable thermostats and wanted units without the "Hold" feature. For a home the Hold is very desirable, but for a multi-building institution  which is used by many different people we didn't want someone to set the Temperature up to 74- press Hold and forget to reset it- thus heating the unoccupied space for days or weeks. We couldnt find one- but we were able to modify this unit to suit our needs.The 4 front buttons are a resilient semisoft plastic that push through to the membrane switches mounted on the circuit board. You can remove the 8 small screws holding the circuit board to access this strip of soft buttons.  Then a neat razor trim of the Hold and Setback buttons can set them back below their front panel openings. Scraping off the Front label leaves no trace. But the hold and setback features are still  available if needed  by pressing the newly indented buttons from the front with a small screwdriver.We bought 3 of these from Lowes and 1 from Amazon- same model number but they were not the same.The Lowes units had a number ending with "a" and the Amazon unit ended with "c" but the packages didnt show that difference- and it is significant. The "a" unit has a "Duration" setting (60, 30, 20, 10 etc) which sets the time in minutes between the cycles. One unexpected behavior with the duration type is that the unit comes on at the preset duration time even if the thermostat is satisfied- then it turns off after a brief "ON" period. For most applications this would  be OK but it wasn't ideal for our system which uses large motor valves which dont like to be turned on and off quickly.  The "c" unit uses a "Swing" number from 1 to 9. The Swing is the +or - temperature between on and off- and each numeral is equal to one quarter degree F. So if you want your heating to come on at 69 and go off at 71 then set the Swing to 4- setting it to 8 would give 68 to 72.  Both "a" and "c" units have a maximum load rating of 1.5amps per terminal and 3.0amps total Maximum load.For us, this meant using a control relay to supply the 1.8amps our motor valves need. (this relay is not needed for normal home use - and it is certainly not a defect in the Thermostat)There are 4 temperature changes per day allowed- LUX labels them Morn, Day, Evening and Night but they canbe any time but must be at least 15 minutes apart. Thus 4 to 4:15AM , 4:45 to 5:15AM and  8 to 8:45PM and 9 to 11PM would work.Things we like-Presettable max or min temperature that limits the Temp the front Arrow buttons can reach (we set ours to 74)Special program feature- which you can set for your system to go to another daily program for 1 to 30 days-IE Vacation.Lockable settings to prevent anyone changing the program or settings unless they know the 4 digit code.Something we wish- that there was a way to lock the program (as well as the Hold and Reset buttons) but  leave the UP/ DOWN arrows available for temporary temperature adjustments by the occupants . Having that change would make this unit 100% PERFECT!PS: We can hear no "buzz" with any of our 4 units.Update-  October 2017- we now have 8 of these T'Stats and still are happy with them overall- but have just encountered a problem where one of the first installed units lost its time and day setting. We ordered a replacement .for it and found that the battery holder which previously depended on spring tension to maintain contact is now soldered to the circuit board. Experimenting with another early unit found we could make it lose its time and day setting by slightly twisting the circuit board. We believe that LUX discovered this weakness sometime back and made the appropriate design change to correct it. Our fix was to make the same easy repair to each of our old units (you have to clip off the small white plastic bridge on each end of the battery holder and then carefully solder the silver contact down to the circuit board using rosin core solder of course).Units purchased currently probably do not need this fix.  Hope this helps someone with misbehaving older units.I still give them 5 stars for all the reasons mentioned above- plus this new evidence of ongoing attention to a quality problem. Good job LUX!

title: Great product!
author: New York Mom
info_3: Purchased this for my new home and I am very happy with it. Easy to use. Easy to install. Many features. Quick set up instructions are useful and cut through those long wordy 50 page brochures. Any detailed information I needed was easily downloaded from the website. Any additional questions I had were kindly and quickly answered by a professional technician on the company phone line. Would definitely purchase from again. I can see why this company gets such high reviews from Consumer Reports. Great product!!

title: This thermostat has a mind of its own.
author: JS
info_3: This thermostat has a mind of its own.  My a/c comes on when the room temperature is well below the set temperature, it comes on sometimes for just a few seconds, and other times it doesn't come on at all.  There is something called the system cycle duration which supposedly limits the number of times per hour the a/c will turn on.  I have it set to 20, which means 3x hour.  So the a/c turns on 3x hour even when it the room temp is below the set temp, e.g. room temp is 75 and set temp is 78.  It should not cycle on at that point, but it does.I am very dissatisfied with this unit.  There is no swing setting either which seems like such a basic feature, i.e. it lets you set how many degrees below and above the set temp you want which is great because it prevents the a/c from constantly turning on to maintain a single setting.A small thing, but the cover which you must open to change the program is very flimsy and difficult to remove.The install went very well.I'm in the process of working with tech support, but so far their advice has not been helpful.

title: Easy to install
author: Hanna B
info_3: Easy to install, easy to program - after patiently reading the instructions. It took us about 30 minutes total to remove our old manual thermostat and install this one - and that was with a toddler running around our feet. Works great for 2 weeks now - the high pitched sound when the backlight is on that others have mentioned is not loud enough to annoy us. This is a great thermostat for the price.

title: Save Some Money on Heating!
author: Book Glutton
info_3: I used this thermostat extensively in another assignment. It just fit the bill: Easy to install--just use prior wiring, four settings each day, easy to program, and a great feature: lockable, for those who cannot keep there hands off things. When I needed a programmable thermostat months ago, there was only one place to turn. Even with the prices of heating oil down, it's nice to be able to set back the temperature when heating is not required.

title: Works great!
author: Betty Key
info_3: This thermostat is easy to install and easy to use.

title: Was fairly easy to install for someone who is pretty handy around ...
author: rebecca E.
info_3: Was fairly easy to install for someone who is pretty handy around the house.  I love how big the screen is and how easy it is to set.  I work Tuesday-Saturday and I like this this has each day different instead of doing both weekend days the same.  It is hard to delete a time frame if you accidently set one though.  It looks nice and is a good value!

title: This is the newer version TX500Ub
author: Online Consumer
info_3: TX500Ub doesn't allow you to adjust the swing temperatures. The swing is important for systems like mine to prevent short cycling. Short cycling kicks the HVAC unit on/off every five minutes, and this is not energy efficient or safe on the HVAC system. TX500b's swing is programmed for a 1.4 swing, which is +/- 0.7 degrees from the set-point. Traditionally a swing is +/- 1 or 2 degrees. Don't order this if you don't like your unit cycling. I want the TX500U, but it seems like it has been phased out.

title: great unit!
author: BW
info_3: this was easy to install and program, well worth the money.

title: Five Stars
author: SteveL
info_3: Easy to install & program; works well so far.

title: Very Pleased!
author: SubDeb
info_3: So far so good. Really pleased with this purchase. Love the digital readout. So much better than a manual. Can't beat the price either.Seems to be very accurate. Thank you Lux.

title: Four Stars
author: steve77265
info_3: hard to read (for a old guy!)

title: Five Stars
author: KyKz
info_3: Good product.  Operates well.

title: This product has been great. It's easy to program
author: JerZyTattoos
info_3: This product has been great. It's easy to program, easy to install. It keeps the temp perfect and had helped bring down our power bill. The only issue was the directions were a little hard to understand and in order to get clearer ones (about setting the cycles)---it advises you to go online. But would I buy it again? Yep.

title: Excellent thermostat
author: C. Wilson
info_3: Great upgrade from our old thermostat! Easy to install, easy to use, and I love the full 7 day programming! Big numbers make it easy to read from across the room and the blue back light is nice for when I decide stumble down to change it in the middle of the night half asleep. This was also $20 less here than it was at the big box home improvement store.

title: Five Stars
author: MariViews
info_3: work on my wall heater

title: Works as expected
author: Igor
info_3: Works as expected.  Great product!

title: LOYAL LUX CUSTOMER
author: New York Mom
info_3: I have always had a positive experience when purchasing a Lux product. This time was no different. I received my item quickly and very professionally packaged. I am not very tech inclined, so I called the tech number. My call answered right away by an actual live person! He patiently walked me through the installation process, and my new unit was properly installed in no time.  Works perfectly. I  can even read the display with having to put on my glasses. Very satisfied with my purchase.

title: Easy to install and use and pays for itself!
author: Grad student, Nerd, & Book Lover
info_3: It works just as described!  It was easy to install and programming was quick!.  The only thing that would make it better is there was a menu to select a specific day to program instead of cycling through all the days.  I am sure this exists on more luxurious thermostats.  For the price, I am getting everything I want and it has already paid for itself in the two months that I have had it!

title: Five Stars
author: Libby
info_3: I'm so happy with the thermostat. Has helps my utility bill dramatically. Super easy to install.

title: Great thermostat!!
author: somthin'fishy
info_3: Easy to install and is still working

title: fit great
author: Jerry
info_3: works great

title: Works great
author: Steve Anderson
info_3: Works great as a replacement for the 50's style thermostat that came with our camper.  Love having the swing setting adjustment.

title: I mis that the newer Lux thermostats don't display both ...
author: kevin grady
info_3: I mis that the newer Lux thermostats don't display both the set temperature and the temperature in the room. Having the Hold button visible is convenient.

title: Lux thermostat
author: Eric Anderson
info_3: Delivery was right on time, and this is a great thermostat for the money. I purchased this to replace the thermostat that failed at my rental property. The tenants love it, it is easy to program and works great. I also have a Lux Products unit in my home. After seeing this one, I might just replace mine as well.

title: Battery low indicator reset... I had to ...
author: william e donges
info_3: Battery low indicator reset...I had to disconnect it from wall power and remove the batteries for 3 hours to get it reset! tried the 1 1/4 hours didn't do it! my experience...

title: Five Stars
author: Shane Weidle
info_3: LOOKS AND WORKS GRATE ON MY TWO STAGE COOLING AC

title: Works great!!
author: Trey
info_3: Needed tech support for wiring info. They were very helpful and gave me the correct wiring information for my older system. Works great!!

title: Great value for the price
author: Strausy
info_3: I was looking to replace a Honeywell thermostat because it had no adjustable swing or cycle rate. Lux's website does a great job of telling which of their models include swing or cycle rate settings. A call to their technical support revealed that all future models should have a swing setting if it currently lists a cycle setting.The copy program from each day and filter monitor is a nice plus.

title: Decent, wont buy again.
author: Tiffany Vampola
info_3: Pro'sInstallation simple (I am an electrician though)Presets are easy to set up and work very well every timeEasy to readFriendly interfaceCon'sBattery constantly gets knocked out, so the time and presets have to be reset (almost daily)Looks sort of cheap on the wall

title: Great thermostat.
author: Sknydip
info_3: I installed this on a gas furnace in my garage. I chose this because LUX thermostats have an adjustable temperature differential. I set mine for a 3 degree spread at 60 degrees. The furnace will run up to 63 degrees, shut off and will come back on when it goes back down to 60 degrees. This adjustability is important because with air leaks in the garage, a thermostat with a 1/2 or 1 degree non-adjustable sensitivity will cycle the furnace on too often. Great thermostat.

title: Great Support
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Had some installation issues. My old thermostat had 10 wire and was ancient. Tried to research and figure it out on my own. Gave up and installed the old one. Months later (yesterday) I called tech support and they walked me through everything within a few min. and now works perfectly.Thank you Joel from LUX Tech Support!

title: Good bang for the buck.
author: Tobashadow
info_3: Fully featured easy to install and worked good. Only wish it would run by temperature difference and not by time cycle but those are hard to find now a days anyways. I do love the night light but it buzzes when it's on but only when your near enough to it and it's only on when you press something. Be sure to download the full instructions off their website to use all the extra functions.

title: Filter replacement reminder a nice feature.
author: Billy D
info_3: Works well with both heating and cooling.  Filter replacement reminder a nice feature.  Doesn't really have a true vacation override (i.e. an override you can set for a certain # of days) but has either temporary or indefinite override feature. Good basic programmable thermostate and the rebate from my utility company made this almost free.

title: Five Stars
author: mauriceÂ Cohen
info_3: Worked as expected

title: Installing and setting up went easy and quickly

title: The Uc model is the one you want.
author: HBP
info_3: There are at least 4 different editions of this thermostat.  The TX1500U, Ua, Ub, and Uc.  I have owned a Ua and Ub.  These two variations do not use the classic temperature swing control method but rather provide a "cycles per hour" technique.  I considered the Ua model very wasteful and hard on the compressor as it cycles the unit in both heat and cool mode the specified number of times an hour whether the temperature is out of range or not.  Sometimes the compressor would cut on and run less than a minute.  The Ub was better as it at least ran the compressor a few minutes each time but still the starts and stops were ridiculous.  In its latest rendition, the Uc, Lux appears to have come to their senses and gone back to the tried and true temperature swing method.  The user can set the swing as desired (I like +- 0.5 degrees) and the thermostat only operates the compressor when it is needed.  The TX1500Uc is a great thermostat.  I like it much better than any of the "cycle rate" models from Lux or Honeywell.  Hopefully Amazon is only shipping the Uc models of these Lux thermostats.  In my opinion they are definitely the one you want.---I must add that Lux customer support has been excellent.  Within my 3 year warranty period they shipped me a Ub unit to replace the Ua.  They have now replaced the Ub unit with a Uc model.  In both cases it cost me nothing as a prepaid return envelope was included.  In today's world that kind of product support is rare.

info_3: Its a great easy product to use and installand Lux has a great customer service.You'll notice 1 degree difference here and therebut besides that its awesomeMust change batteries once it runs outTech told me its lasts a year or soRuns on 2 AA batteries

title: Race car sound?!
author: Kevin Mazzone
info_3: Bought this as a replacement for my old thermostat that was missing buttons. Bought this one based on the good decent reviews and good looks. I really should have researched this more. If you dismiss my review, because of all the other good ones on here, really consider buying the backplate accessory. This was quite a bit smaller than my old one and now I have ugly holes in my wall that I need to patch and paint over.I've replaced thermostats on the past and have never had this much trouble with initial setup. First the hookup was a pain and the instructions weren't really clear. This was somewhat understandable since my old one was from a different manufacturer and it made sense that not everything would match. Programming it was a pain. Some of the steps and codes were clear and others still baffle me. I wasn't 100% sure what all of the different options are but maybe they're for a different type of unit. Programming was such a chore, that I still have it in manual set mode to this day.That would be OK and I'd keep it. But I'm having one problem ever since I set it up. My AC sounds like a revving race car when it turns on. Seems to work fine after that but it worries me. Thank God I have a home warranty in-case it dies.This alone would make me return it but my return period on Amazon ended last weekend so I guess it will go back in the box until I find someone on Craigslist to resell this to.

info_3: I've had this a couple  weeks (replacing an antique TX500) and it works fine so far, does what it is supposed to. I subtracted one star for a few convenience issues:1. It seems to take a lot of force to detach the front panel; I was afraid I would break the tabs. Of course, it isn't necessary to do this very often, but it should not be difficult.2. The printed instructions in the package are adequate to get started, but why not just provide the full printed guide instead of making the user access the 32 page pdf online?3. I would prefer to be able to specify the temp swing in degrees and I thought the "500Uc" model that I received had this feature, but it is still the 1-9 scale others have noted. Again, not a huge deal (the "4" setting seems to work for me), but I wish Lux and/or Amazon would clear up the labeling.

title: Highly recommend.
author: John Sorber
info_3: Purchased this product prior to the heating season last fall, have seen 20% reduction in heating and cooling bills.  First programmable thermostat I have owned and wish I had purchased one years ago.  You are foolish if you don't have one, particularly this Lux model.  Could not be easier to install and program.  Did it myself in under 30 minutes.  5 different heating settings during the week and 3 for the weekend.  Never have to touch your thermostat again.  Controls and display well designed.  Have had for 9 months and barely has made a dent on the battery life.  Highly recommend.

info_3: It will turn on for 1 minute then turn off.  Will start running the AC at 71 when it is set at 76.  Now that the heat is on it will cycle on and of three or four times before finally pushing any air out yet I hear the furnace roaring.  The cover is a pain to get open to change the programming and the whole thing is likely to come off the wall instead of opening.  I am not even sure the thing saves me any money.  I will not order another LUX product.

info_3: TX9100U was OK but has a cheaper feel than most of their other models due to the cover. We (myself and  Lux support) were never able to get the swing temperature adjustment to work. Returned excepted and refund promptly credited therefore 3 stars.

title: Most features didn't seem to work
author: KevinF
info_3: I purchased this to replace a manual model thinking that programmable was the way to go.  It installed in a few minutes, but immediately I noticed it didn't work as I expected.  I could not get the override function or the hold function to work correctly.  Perhaps I just got a lemon.  I called Lux support but had to leave a message for a call back.  They did call back (about 8 hours later) but by that time I had given up on this and put my old thermostat back on.  I ended up sending this unit back and got an exact replacement for my existing thermostat (the one I had would was acting up, hence the need to replace it).Other thoughts on the Lux thermostat: the door is pretty flimsy and I thought that it might not last very long before a hinge let go.  Programming is fairly easy and overall this may have been a good unit if the other features worked as described.  It was strange that it would call for heat, turn on the furnace, then after about 45 seconds shut the furnace back down - particularly when trying to use the override feature (temp was set to 65, wanted to override to 68, furnace would run for 45 seconds and then everything went back to program settings).  I never did talk to Lux, but I suspect they would have replace the unit.  The manual thermostat I exchanged this for works perfectly - and I don't mind having to set the temp myself (It's an Honeywell Digital Dial thermostat).Based on my experience with this particular thermostat I cannot recommend it.UPDATE June 30, 2014.  Lux sent me a replacement unit that is reported to fix the quick cycle issue.  The installation of the replacement thermostat was a snap (took less than five minutes) and programming is quite simple.  I am currently only using the standard run cycle for cooling with a "hold" setting for the A/C.  It appears to be cycling the A/C normally and it has been doing a good job of holding the temp at the set value.  Since the thermostat is in the hallway, I'm not surprised that the temperature is showing slightly higher in other rooms (with many windows), so I've set the temp accordingly to compensate for that.The revised unit looks just like the other one, and still has the somewhat questionable (flimsy) front panel door.  The hinge on the door makes be a bit nervous - and I think that it could be easily damaged.  Knowing that, I'm careful when opening it.  Of course if the program cycles work as expected, there would be little reason to even open the front panel door.The real test will come in the winter when I run it using a heating cycle.  I will update my review then once I've had a chance to see how it works, particularly the override and the hold functions - along with the cycling times.For now, I'm going to keep this at two stars.

title: misleading description and very wasteful on cycling & electricity
author: Josh
info_3: Electricity bill has gone up 40% with same AC settings as old thermostat.Also the "4 periods per day" function is a huge bit of word play. Basically you can have it go up & down in temperature just twice per day. I was hoping for four independent cycles (eg turn AC down before return home from work, turn up temp overnight, turn AC down again in morning, then up during day ... it will only do half of these cycles.

title: Seems like a well-designed system overall
author: Mr. V
info_3: No, I wasn't able to install this in 15 minutes -- but 20 isn't bad considering that drywall anchors always make me crazy.Coolest things so far:(1) The relay doesn't wake up the cats. I haven't had the chance to see if it wakes me up, but I doubt it. The Honeywell it is replacing woke both cats and me.(2) Customer service answered my questions clearly before I purchased the unit, and has a good reputation for after the purchase.(3) Programming options are clear, and the manual makes sense.So far the main negative I can see is that the casing material don't seem as sturdy as other units I've owned. This is a concern, but my hope is that my gentle touch on tools and hardware (I rarely break things) will be valuable.

title: Avoid TX1500-Ua ... Maybe TX1500-Ub also. Just rely on the older TX1500-E
author: Guillermo B. Fierro
info_3: As I already had a TX1500-E , I bought this on Jan 8th, 2014, because it was advertised as a newer version. It worked well until 2015, when it started showing the "LO" message on the display. I read the instructions and it said you can ONLY use Duracell batteries on it. That is what I used. No matter how fresh the Duracell batteries I put, it kept the "LO" message on the display, but it would also display the set temperature and other info. However about 3 days ago it stopped showing them, it just shows a solid "LO". As the instructions say that it may damage my AC equipment when this happens, I was forced to buy another one, but this time I bought the TX1500-E, the older model, as I have one of those on my 2nd floor and it has been working fine for over 4 years now.I have been working in the computer industry since 1971, and cannot fathom why a thermostat would require a specific brand of batteries, and why it would go bananas like this one ...

title: False Advertising
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: It states that it is for both single and multi stage heat pumps, but it's not. It didn't work with my 2 stage heat pump. The literature that came with the thermostat goes against what the ad states. I'm returning it tomorrow.

title: good looking from far, far from working...
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Looks Great from far, and far away from working as promised!Yes it is Easy to install, and is NOT working at all,NOT worth the suffering, I bought the Touch screen unit from Lows and that works!

title: Unsatisfactory furnace air filter use monitor
author: George Cleveland
info_3: I find the change to counting days instead of measuring hours of run time use to calculate when the furnace air filter needs to be replaced to be unsatisfactory and nearly useless.

title: I ordered the tx500u because I wanted temp swing but ...
author: John P. Bush II
info_3: I ordered the tx500u because I wanted temp swing but got the tx500uc which is based on run time. Appears to be working but not as precise control.

title: Worst puchase I have eve made through Amazon
author: Sam Ray
info_3: Purchased early March, installed mid March, mid May screen went blank and not returnable.

title: good product
author: Brian
info_3: would give 5 stars if Saturday and Sunday programming were separated. not every has a set weekend schedule

title: Piece of crap
author: Jay Roye
info_3: Piece of crap... Don't bother badly made, No light button so you can adjust it in the dark... TX500e has more features go with that...

title: Led thermostat questionable
author: RANDY
info_3: Order two one was okay but one did not work properly! If both would have worked would have rated 5

title: Five Stars
author: TR
info_3: Easy to install. Took around 20 minutes including removing the old unit.

title: Ok
author: Yachky
info_3: I wish it were better, but I think it is more my house than the thermostat.....

title: We hooked this thermostat up to our pellet stove and ...
author: mythreesons
info_3: We hooked this thermostat up to our pellet stove and wanted to program it to have a 2 degree swing (which the description said it did).  However, it did not.  Our pellet stove continues to run after the thermostat has clicked it off because it has to finish burning the rest of the pellets and then it takes another 20 minutes or more to push all the hot air out of the stove and into the room.  Because of this feature, we program the thermostat to shut off at 70 degrees, knowing that by the time the pellet stove actually "completely" shuts down if will be 72 degrees in the home.  Likewise, we want it to not turn on again until its at 68 degrees.  We explained this all to AMazon who did let us return the thermostat but we were charged a heavy price for shipping (even though it was prime) to return the item.  Booh to both the item description and AMazon.  I was surprised!

title: Failed after 2 years
author: AndyH
info_3: Failed after 2 years

title: Easy and economical
author: Miles
info_3: I wanted a Lux thermostat since I've had very good experience with them in the past, particularly in value and reliability.  This thermostat is no different.  For the features, the price is right, and after an extremely easy installation, a few tests have shown this model can do its job.  An easy recommendation.

title: Bought 2 and they worked well for the first 2 years - then both died the same way.
author: Weaver
info_3: I purchased and installed 2 of these.  Approximately 2 years later the units began flashing low battery. I changed the batteries and the unit continued to flash low battery. I checked the batteries and they were in fact new with a full charge. I continued to use the unit and ignored the low battery warning. Yesterday the unit stopped working completely.  I expected more than a 2.5 year lifespan on this piece of equipment.

title: Fortunately, I had read other reviews
author: Raj
info_3: I ordered this thermostat to update an old mercury-filled thermostat on a heat pump.I opened the package, unfolded the instruction manual, turned off the power to my unit, and was ready to go. I quickly began to remove the old unit, and followed the advise from the manual to label each wire prior to disconnecting it from the thermostat (not necessary, but I wanted to avoid confusion if I had an issue).And then it happened. I scanned the wiring diagrams, and none of them lined up to the 8 wire setup on my thermostat. Fortunately, I had read other reviews, and used that wisdom to go to the Lux website to download a more complete set of wiring schematics. Hooray for good online support! In minutes, I learned that the T (tan) and B (blue) wires are not used for this thermostat, clipped them and taped them off, and finished the installation.Now I'm a happy guy! The new thermostat kicked in right away, and the temperature reading is actually accurate. I tested that the heat, a/c, and emergency heat all worked as needed. Then I used the feature loaded box to adjust the cycle times, temperature variation, emergency heat threshold, and temperature settings for my personal preferences. And, it is attractive, too!!!**Update** Still working flawlessly. Because the new thermostats keep the temperature regulated better, we are far more comfortable.

title: Lux removed swing feature
author: Michael Cook
info_3: I purchased this thermostat for use with my pellet insert, with the intention of using the swing feature to have finer control of when the stove goes on and off. The Lux website clearly states that the TX9100U supports the swing feature.The order and packaging clearly states that I ordered and received the TX9100U, however after opening the thermostat I noticed the directions and model number printed on the thermostat are clearly the TX9100Ua. The problem is that Lux removed the swing feature from this model. Without it my stove goes on and off constantly.This thermostat might be fine for a furnace, but do not purchase this thinking that you can use it to program your pellet stove. I'd recommend staying away from all Lux thermostats until they can resolve their packaging.

title: did not work with our system had to wait for ...
author: Donna
info_3: did not work with our system had to wait for an electrician to come and install still not right not compatable with our system and now I went past the return date to return it so I am stuck with a thermastat that I can not use.

title: Two Stars
author: Ernesto Guedes
info_3: poor quality

title: Waste of money
author: C Bush
info_3: The thermostat never worked correctly. Even after I contacted their tech support to make sure it was connected correctly, it did did not work.

title: https: //www. amazon.
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F19KW0S/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0

title: Two Stars
author: bill buselmeier
