title: Great Basic Programmable Thermostat for those who have the same schedule every day of the week
author: TechGuy
info_3: This is a 1 week thermostat meaning that programming it will set every day of the week the same, Su, Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fi, and Sa will all be the same.  This is different than a 7-Day thermostat which allows you to program each day of the week differently.  A 5-2 Day thermostat allows you to program the five week days all the same and the two weekend days differently than the weekdays but the same as each other.  The 5-2 would be good for someone who works the five ?œweekdays??and is home on the weekend.  There is also a 5-1-1 Day thermostat that allows you to program the 5 weekdays the same but Saturday differently and Sunday differently than the weekdays and differently than Saturday.This thermostat, the Honeywell RTH221B, is a ?? Week??thermostat.  It will work to control heating AND cooling systems EXCEPT electric baseboard heat, heat pump system WITH backup heat, and multi-stage heating/cooling.  We have a two zone heat pump system without backup heat.  Zone 1 includes rooms where we spend most of the day.  Zone 2 includes areas of the house where we sleep.  I put this thermostat in zone 2 because we like it cooler at night but don?™t want to keep it cool all day in the summer.  While researching this thermostat I discovered that we don?™t need special thermostats for zone systems which have a zone control box.  In our case it is a Carrier Weather Maker Two Zone box which is located in the garage.This thermostat has an internal manual switch which is set to either ?œGAS OR OIL??or ?œELECTRIC OR HEAT PUMP??  It is a one time setting based on your system.  It has two external manual switches. One controls Heat-Off-Cool while the other is used to set Fan-On or Fan-Auto.  The operation of the first one is logical.  The second one, Fan, let?™s you have the fan run all the time or have it come on automatically only when the system is heating or cooling.I diverged form the programming directions by pre-programming BEFORE I installed the thermostat.  This allowed me to sit comfortably in a well lighted location and to run through the programming several times without having it connected to the wiring.  I highly recommend this especially if the thermostat will be located someplace with low light which would make it difficult to see the small lettering. There is no backlighting with this thermometer.To pre-program you will need to first install two AAA batteries (not included).Once that is done the time will appear but it will likely be wrong so you?™ll need to fix that and also set the four times you want the temperature settings to change each day.  You will have to do this twice, once for heating and once for cooling.  Here is the step by step procedure (I do cooling first but you could start with heating if you prefer as it is the same procedure):  This is for the RTH221 only.1 -  Set the left switch at the bottom to ?œcool??and the Fan switch to ?œAuto?? ??Press the ?œSet??button and the time display will flash3 ??Use the up arrow or down arrow to change the time to the correct present time including the AM and PM settings.  If you pass the correct time use the other arrow to go back.4 ??Press the ?œSet??button and the present time will be set.5 ??Press ?œSet??again and the time will start flashing again but this not to set the present time.  The word ?œWake??will appear below the time.  ?œWake??is the name of the first time period you want to set the temperature for.  If you get up at 7:00 AM you will want the set the ?œWake??time a little earlier than that so that the temperature will have time to adjust before you get up.  For example, you may want to set the ?œWake??time to 6:30 AM (using the up and down arrows) to give your system a little time to adjust to the desired temperature.6 ??Press ?œSet??  This will set the time. The temperature will start flashing.  Using the up and down arrows change the temperature to change the temperature to the desired ?œWake??temperature.7 ??Press ?œSet??  This will set the ?œWake??temperature and move you to the second time period which is ?œLeave??  The word ?œLeave??will appear below the time.  Set the ?œLeave??time (as you did before with up and down arrows) to set the start time of the ?œLeave??period (the time from when you leave the house until you get back).8 ??Press ?œSet??again.  The ?œLeave??time will be set and the temperature will start flashing.  Adjust the temperature you want it to be while you are away.9 ??Press ?œSet??to lock in the ?œLeave??period temperature.10 ??Follow the same procedure for the next two time periods: ?œReturn??and ?œSleep??2 ??After you set the ?œSleep??time and press ?œSet??you are finished with the ?œCool??settings.13 ??Press the ?œRun??and you are ready to start the ?œHeat??settings but before you do that I recommend that you run through the ?œCool??settings again to make sure all your settings are correct.  Just start with step 1 above and make sure everything is set where you want. Pay special attention to the AM and PM settings.  (I messed up one of these and it caused big problems.)14 ??If you find a mistake, now is the time to fix it using the up and down arrows.15 ??When you get through the whole cycle again and you are sure everything is OK, press ?œRun??16 ??Slide the ?œHeat-Off-Cool??switch to ?œHeat??  You should now be familiar enough with the process to zip through the settings but if not just start at step 2.17 ??When finished I recommend doing a review as before.18 ??Turn the ?œHeat-Off-Cool??switch to ?œOff??and you are now ready to follow the included directions connect the wiring.Once everything is connected move the ?œHeat-Off-Cool??switch to the desired position.  There is a five minute delay to protect the system in the event someone switches back and forth between settings too quickly so don?™t be alarmed if your system doesn?™t turn on immediately.There are other options such as temporarily overriding programmed settings but the Operating Manual does a job explaining those features so I won?™t go into that here.This is a low end programmable thermostat but it does a nice job and will pay for itself in energy savings in a very short time.  The display does not have back-lighting and some of the display numbers and letters are very small and hard to see especially in low light.  Nonetheless this is a good thermometer that will significantly reduce your energy bills if programmed properly.

title: VERY EASY TO INSTALL
author: Mark Vinette
info_3: Very easy to install with just a screwdriver. Just match up the wires and it works. It is an excellent way to save money on A/C costs as you can set it to shut off the A/C or at least turn it up after you fall asleep. It has four settings for each day.

title: Three Stars
author: DysPhule
info_3: no weekend setting, only the same for each day.

title: Ditched the Nest
author: JRob
info_3: Worth the money

title: Three Stars
author: Robert S.
info_3: Print is a bit small

title: Two Stars
author: GERALD  WEEKS
info_3: sent it back

title: Five Stars
author: griffo
info_3: Nice

title: Work just like advertised
author: Jamie Miller
info_3: The thermostat work exactly like it is supposed to work. This thermostat has 4 settings per day with a 1 week program so you can not set it to be different temps on different days just like advertised.

title: NOT A 1 WEEK THERMOSTAT!!!
author: lh
info_3: Easy to install/program and works well. but it is most definitely not a 1 week thermostat. You can program several set point changes for a single day. That's it. Its works for me so I will not be returning it. But Honeywell is doing a disservice to its customers by calling this a 1 week programmable thermostat.

title: Mine didn't work right.
author: Ashley Schubert
info_3: This thermostat was fairly easy to install and worked like it should with the programming and all, but the LED light did not work. I thought at first it would be no big deal, but when I had to get up in the middle of the night to turn up the ac flipping on a light in the living room was the last thing I wanted to do, but he'd to because I couldn't see the thermostat screen...So we uninstalled it with easy and sent it back. If the LED light had worked it would have been perfect. Was very easy to program.

title: The dog stays cool though,
author: Larry Mann
info_3: The dog ate it before I got to install it. The dog stays cool though,,, so??

title: Honeywell RTH221B1021/A thermostat: simple, accurate, effective... and inexpensive.
author: Mike Powers
info_3: We purchased two Honeywell RTH221B1021/A thermostats ??one for each of the two heating zones in our house. We bought them to replace old-fashioned analog-style thermostats that were hard to read and adjust accurately.We are very pleased with our new thermostats. They were very easy to install; it took about twenty minutes to hook each one up. The digital display is easy to read, although it doesn?™t have a back-light for viewing in hours of darkness. Programming the thermostat was a reasonably straightforward and painless procedure.These Honeywell RTH221B1021/A thermostats seem to do a much better job of regulating the heat in our house than the ones they replaced. It is too early to tell if we will see any savings on our heating oil budget. I would bet, however, that we will.There are certainly more advanced and sophisticated thermostats on the market, but they cost a lot more. For our needs, these simple and inexpensive Honeywell RTH221B1021/A thermostats are perfect. Highly recommended.

title: You'll need a jeweler's screwdriver to install, and weekends run the same as the week
author: Mark Thomas
info_3: You'll need a jeweler's screwdriver to attach the wires. In the photograph, I added a penny for scale.As other reviewers have noted, you can only program one day that's repeated each day of the week. Calling this a 7 day timer is a lie.

title: Simple Enough but Lacks Backlight
author: Len
info_3: Being retired, and having an old failed Honeywell 5/2 day thermostat, we replaced it with this 7-day model for heating only. It was simple enough to replace. The twin wiring was identical and so were the wall mounting hole centers. The directions for set-up were fairly clear. My one beef is that the new thermostat lacks back lighting which the old one had. The letters are small enough where one needs a flashlight during setup, requiring three hands at times, and is awkward for those  of us with just two hands. Omitting the back light is inexcusable since the 5/2 twin RTH2300 DOES have back lighting. Another caution is that you need a tiny screwdriver to turn the wire set screws.  I happen to have one but I would guess few people do.

title: A fidgety annoyance that died
author: T. M. Smith
info_3: Consider this - I am annoyed enough at a thermostat to leave a review. All I really expect from a thermostat is that it make the air conditioner turn on or off. This failed at that simple task. I came home one night to find the display completely blank. Experts "well, you need to check the circuits, run this test, that test..." Me - dudes, I think the problem here is that the cheap thermostat has actually DIED.  Change the thermostat. So they did, but they replace it with another one of these. Which fixed the problem but I'm having it replaced because I'm not dealing with the fidgety program.NOT EASY TO PROGRAM - as I stand on tiptoe and stare at the tiny display that I have to press in exactly the right sequence to program WAKE LEAVE RETURN SLEEP.... yeah, you can't skip any of those. Which wouldn't be bad if you could READ the display and if they programming buttons weren't something from 1980. And it doesn't tell you what temp it's programmed for at any time. Just what the temp is. They put a new one in yesterday. I manually put the temp at 76 for bedtime because it was late. Woke up this morning and was fine. They noticed it was up to 80. The display on this doesn't say WHAT it's programmed to be at. Apparently installed it was programmed above 80 for daytime run. The manual override is temporary so you MUST go through all the programming steps to prevent set it.Spend a few more bucks and get something that works. Or if you want cheap and simple, get something cheap and simple not cheap and complicated.Oh, and if it doesn't display - tell the air guy - no, dude, really it's just that the thermostat is dead. Please replace it and run this one over with your truck. Thank you.

title: RV Upgrade!
author: Alaskan RV Traveler
info_3: After suffering through almost 2 years of our manual heater thermostat in our travel trailer I upgraded to this digital programmable unit. The install was quick and the included instructions (along with some youtube research) made the upgrade a breeze. I love being able to set and run a program for our trailer while we are away for the day, or asleep at night. It's so nice waking up to a warm home, instead of waking up and having to walk across the room to get the heater started. I'm looking to add a couple of these to our new sticks-n-bricks home as well for the same reasons.UPDATE: I loved this thing so much in my camper I purchased two more to put into my house to replace the old mercury dials. Works great, and saves me money.

title: Easily Replaces Dometic RV Thermostat.
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Replaced this RV Dometic thermostatÂ Dometic 3106995.032 Heat/Cool Analog ThermostatÂ with the Honeywell. Did a better job of controlling the temperature. (I don't think the Dometic thermostat has a heat anticipator.)Bonus: The mounting holes even lined up.The YouTube tutorials helped, and indeed, the power wire that went to the Dometic is not used.The lack of a High/Low switch for the air conditioner is not a problem for us. I connected both fan wires to the same terminal so the A/C fan runs on high. May experiment with whether to change to Low only when we go back next summer.Nice to finally have a thermometer in the RV. It's accurate to within a degree or two.

title: Don't like the new design that needs batteries
author: Jan
info_3: Thermostat works ok.  Not happy with the design change that requires two AAA batteries just to keep the clock time, but if they should go dead, the furnace quits!!!!  The extra wire that used to supply power is now taped off and just stuffed inside.  Our power went off almost every year; no big deal to reset the time.  The batteries are located in the top of the face of the thermostat and the entire face must be removed to replace them, and getting it open is not easy.  Not a thermostat for someone who is not handy or inclined to watch for the battery low symbol.  Looking for something better.

title: Easy to install, easy to program. Works well in our RV.
author: Kynsie
info_3: We bought several of these thermostats to install in our apartment building a few years back and they have performed beautifully! This time we purchased the thermostat to install in our RV. The installation required a bit of a Google search as the wiring in our previous RV thermostat was a bit different. Otherwise, we put the thermostat in place without a hitch. It comes with a small screw driver for tightening the screws that hold the various wires in place. This tool was actually too wide to screw the bolts all the way into place. Luckily, we have a rather large tool collection and were able to use our own tiny flat head to complete the job.The programming offer 4 different settings which we have found rather convenient. The temperature preference can be entered for the morning, when you leave the house for the day, when you arrive home, and then when you go to bed. It is rather simple to set up the program and easy to turn it off temporarily for vacations or weekends away if you are like us and set the house to a single temperature when you are away. The unit does require AAA batteries which were not included with the thermostat

title: One day thermostat, not one week
author: Stephen Wang
info_3: Like a few others noted below, I was shipped a thermostat that runs the "Same program for every day" as the box says right on the front.  I only noticed this after I installed it!  How annoying.  (Installation is easy, at least.)  It's even the same model number as the Honeywell 1-week thermostat (according to Honeywell's web site) but simply has no day on the display.  That's very poor on Honeywell's part to have two distinct thermostats with the same model number, if so.  Buy this from a brick-and-mortar store so you know for sure that the package doesn't say "Same program for every day".

title: Heat and Go
author: OBG
info_3: Just installed this in my motor-home and installation was a piece of cake.  Just code the old wires and insert and tighten down the screws.  Easy to program and set up time of day and temperature.  It is a simpler model with just a day and night setting and no weekend settings. My wife and I like sleeping in cooler temperatures so we like the night setting, saves on propane and battery as well. You can't see the display at night so you'll need a flashlight to check the temperature.  You can set and hold a temperature which is nice if your going to be gone for a day or so and don't need to heat an unoccupied space.  I also got this because I can see the actual temperature where the original thermostat just had a small red mercury gauge which was hard to see and read.  This one has a nice digital readout.  Great product for the money.

title: I have put in quite a few of these easy to use programmable thermostats
author: lisa paulson
info_3: I have put in quite a few of these easy to use programmable thermostats. They work great despite the fact that they are super inexpensive. For a renter, like me, the ability to set my thermostat saves me big time on my utility bill. And at this price-I don?™t feel bad about just leaving it in when I move. Yes-you can thank me if you are the renter after me!Unfortunately, this one is as sort of a dud. The tiny screw in which you I sent your ?œhot??wire under would not budge and appeared to be stripped or defective. I wasn?™t able to get the wire under it and inserted. Luckily I have an electrician friend who helped me get it in there. I would have just sent it back but the temp is dropping and I am stubborn about that kind of thing.All-in-all, great little thermostat. Woukd hsve tated a 5 bit i just happened to get one that was less than the awesome products I usually get from Honeywell.By the way-check with your utilities company. My offered a rebate since I was putting in a programmable unit.

title: How does a product like this even exist?
author: nee
info_3: How does a product like this even exist?How can i be programmable if you cannot set the day of the week?As per the instruction, you press set, you use the up/down arrows to change the time. Fine good cool.The instructions are THE EXACT SAME for setting the day of the week, but that is not what happens.Instead of going to a DAY display it goes to the programming display. nuff said

title: Get a better thermostat than this one.
author: Bernie
info_3: Poor performance followed by malfunctions. The thermostat has only been run on the two double A batteries. For the first while it seemed to perform OK. It then started going through batteries quite frequently. Most recently it will turn the system on but then never reset. The system will run on heat or cool until you physically shut it off. You then have to take the batteries out of the thermostat as if to reboot the thermostat. It will then work properly for a few cycles until it goes back to where it turns the system back on and never off again. Under one year until failure.

title: Couldn't be Easier.. a great value.
author: G. Kramer
info_3: This product was really simple to install, came with good, clear, instructions and works just as stated.  The wiring diagrams were easy to understand the post/socket connections were pretty solid and easy to move over.  They even send you little stickers to keep the various lines going where they should go.  I very much appreciated the pre-programmed stock on/off temperatures and times for wake/leave/return and sleep, which made setup a breeze and were essentially identical to what I've have programmed anyway.  After using this thermostat my only complaint is that I rather wished I paid a little more for one that had an illuminated panel, but for the cost you really can't beat this one.  I would have given it five stars if Honeywell had sprung for a little LED diode so you could read it at night.

title: Save Money - Easy Install
author: I_Love_America
info_3: Easy to program, works perfectly. Save money without studying computer programming.  Connecting is easy and programming is a snap. I programmed it before installing so it was done in minutes on the comfort of the sofa. You will need a small very fine screw driver to tighten the wire terminals, if you don't have any, ask a neighbor or get a set for a few dollars. The other tool is a screwdriver if you are replacing an older thermostat; you may have to do more if you are replacing a radically differently configured unit. I needed a small needle nose pliers to insert the wires into the terminal as my hands are large and clutzy.  A great basic unit.  We have Zone Heating and bought another for upstairs. What a convenience !

title: I had bought a pretty expensive thermostat that was recessed into the wall
author: E.Wright
info_3: I had bought a pretty expensive thermostat that was recessed into the wall, with a touch screen and all sorts of programmable details on it, 6 years ago.  It was a nightmare to program and it didn't always respond to touch.  I dealt with it, because it was pretty.  It died this spring and I was determined to just get something that worked this time.  I've had this for a few weeks, and setting it up was a breeze.  Getting it off/on the wall to install the batteries, sooo easy.  It's not the most technologically advanced thermostat, but it does the job and doesn't make me crazy with simple maintenance.

title: peace of junk - as my A/C guys refers to it
author: PrimeTheStig
info_3: a week after purchasing and installing, my AC started to blow warm air from the vents. I called my A/C guys thinking that there was a problem with the unit or freyon maybe, but all was good when they checked. then they've noticed this unit on the wall and told me this was a peace of junk, Honeywell products are not worth 5 cents (I thought Honeywell was a good brand, well not acoording to the pros apparently). They just uninstalled it, setup their own digital thermostat and baim, all was good. The temperature this one was showing was wrong, and my A/C was on for longer peroids with this one but the new one (which is less sophisticated than this, no programming or anything) works perfectly.don't buy it. I'm returning it as I'm writing this. just saying.

title: This is NOT a 7-Day Thermostat. The setting applies to the entire week.
author: Amazon user
info_3: The setting you input will remain in effect all 7 days of the week. This wasn't very clear to me, and apparently if you want a thermostat that will adjust on the weekends, it needs to be a "7-day" or a "5-2 day" thermostat. Install was easy, going from an old analog mercury thermostat to this one. The "green" wire was actually blue, and "red" was a very faded pink, but my old thermostat's circuit had the appropriate letters on it, making identification easier. I took pictures of the dismantle each step of the way to help me backtrack if needed. As a thermostat, it functions well. However, the description, and even the packaging, confused me into believing it was a 7-day device.Update: increased rating to 5 starts (from my original 3). The thermostat works well and overriding the program on weekends is as easy as adjusting the temp one time each day, so it's really not a hassle.

title: Reining in my heating bill
author: Michelle
info_3: A doable DIY that didn't require me to ask my boyfriend for installation help! The thermostat allows me to control my heat like the neurotic freak I am.  The programmable feature lets me set times in 15 minute intervals.  During the weekdays, I set "Wake" temperature, "Leave" temperature, "Return" temperature, and "Sleep" temperature.  If I am home all day, I hit the "Hold" button to keep the temperature set.  Very affordable way to rein in the heating costs.

title: Price is right..but at that price point, don't expect all the bells and whistles
author: ewayne
info_3: Price was right.  As previous reviews have pointed out, no back-light and only one week programming vs week days and week ends.  This actually is fine for us since we're retired and every day is a weekend.  Issues I had with the design included it was difficult to easily separate the back and front plate, without also separating the circuit board from the back plate.  If no-one else had this issue, perhaps it was just this particular unit.  We have moved a lot, so this is one of many Honeywell digital programmable thermostats that I have installed with this issue.  The batteries also had the tendency to 'pop out'...had to clear tape them into complete installation.  That said...price and base functionality was what I was looking for, and that's exactly what I got.Ps  also like the much smaller 'footprint' this model takes up on the wall vs some other company equivalent versions.

title: Extremely easy installation and simple directions
author: Camaro2011
info_3: 10 minute easy installation, directions are very easy and simple. 10 minutes and this thermostat was up and running perfectly. Do not fear installing this yourself, just remember to shut your furnace power off. Needed a programmable thermostat for the main floor of our house, this one does the trick. Note that this particular model does not have separate programming for the weekend. Once you program it, that's your program for the entire week, weekends included.

title: good unit for the dollars.
author: Randall Ray
info_3: I already had a Honeywell single use thermostat, but wanted a programmable one.  It was easy to install even with my very old round style type I had before this.  If you need help, just call the help line and they will walk you through it.  The lcd viewer is small and therefore so is the numbers. The one drawback I see as was with the other one, is that its hard to read at night, unless you have it mounted in a lighted area.  I just wish I had done this 20 years ago, with the digital versions.  It really did seem to make a difference in the way my furnace runs.  It does take two triple a sized battery's.  I didn't see anywhere in the manual that stated it would show on screen when to change the filters. The old one I had did do that.  Nice reminder.  It won't work with baseboard heat, heat pump systems or multi stage heating/cooling.  It will work with millivolt, pellet stoves and fireplaces

title: Good Thermostat
author: Kalaab M. Pickering
info_3: My house was built in 1974, and the thermostat we had was original.  It was hard to get an accurate temperature reading from it and I wanted something cheap and programmable, so I bought this Honeywell unit.  I'm mostly satisfied with it - the install was a breeze, the instructions were clear, and the unit functions perfectly.  The only gripes I have with it are that the screen is not backlit and there was no option to hardwire it, meaning you have to use batteries for it.  However, at this price, I can live with those complaints.

title: Title
author: Stefen von Horten II
info_3: Here the deal:We had one of those Commercial grade Honeywell touchscreen thermostats that usually do a great job, but we noticed the temperature in the house never seemed to keep, and would hear the unit, whether heater or ac, kick on quite a bit.  We decided to do some research, and with a deal from our energy provider, we ended up with one of those $249 Nest thermostats.  I was STOKED, like a fat kid with some apple pie.  We got the Nest in, and I went to work.  Like a Dad in bad joke bookstore.  I've replaced many thermostats over the years and the Nest was a piece of cake.  BUT, we discovered it had a malfunction, so after talking with tech support, it was getting replaced.  SOOOO, back to the Honeywell.  I went out to the garage and grabbed the oldie off the shelf, and as I was walking in, my Dollar Store flip flop got caught on the door jam.  It popped the rubber thing out of the foam bottom and made me nearly fall over forwards onto the hard tiled floor.  There i was, Rambo faced, screaming in slo motion, feeling the pain of my big toe hit the metal, when all of a sudden the Honeywell touch screen goes flying out of my hands, and flips, and turns, and swings, and screams, to the floor.  BAM!!!  Cracked screen.  Out of Commission.  No Goodie No More.  Mad me.  I dropped the ball, but it wasn't the ball man, it was my $150 Honeywell touch screen I had plans to put back onto the wall when we sold the house years from now.  So there I was, at a cross roads, like Willow, but without Mad Mardigan there to take the baby.  I broke my working thermostat, and was left with TWO broken thermostats.  It was humid, then cold, then hot, then cold, then humid, the windows were open, they were closed, they were damned like Conan the Barbarian was.I decided to order THIS thermostat from Amazon.  I got in two days, and the hookup was easy.  Easy yo.  I'm talking so easy, I thought about taking it for a drink and a meal.  The thermostat works like a champ!  However I now rec'd the replacement Nest thrmostat and this one is taken down, boxed up, and awaits its new homeowner in severla years whoever and whenever that may be.Pros:1.  Easy to install (C wire is Common and NOT used)2.  Basic use makes ti fun for all ages!3.  Basic programming is available, but nothing that is 3 pointer at the buzzer wow4.  Small, and easy to useCons:1.  None.  It works great and is easy to install

title: get this at best price, a lot of returns due to honeywell ...
author: Bobert
info_3: honeywell mis-advertised this product, it is not 1 week programmable, it is one day, 4 periods per day. the next, (more expensive) one up is one week. however i do not need or want 5/2 days program. this has significantly reduced heating costs on a williams gravity room gas furnace. the thermostat they include is junk.so if you do not need sat sun programing, get this at best price, a lot of returns due to honeywell mis-advertising. they should fire exec in charge of advertising.

title: Good value for the functionality.
author: Pragmatic in CT
info_3: I have been using Honeywell thermostats for some time, all with good results.I purchased this one to replace a non-programmable version and it is performing as expected.The only negative that I found with this model was the labeling of the terminals inside: the red wire label is shifted such that the unused terminal can be mistaken with the one intended for the red wire, especially since the correct one has a wire bridge to the adjacent terminal; two wires go into the red terminal: the red itself and the factory equipped bridge.Other than the above, it is a good product and simple to use.

title: which is really hard to read if you have less than perfect eyesight. When you have to squint when you ...
author: J. A. Brown
info_3: It works. However, the display has REALLY small text, which is really hard to read if you have less than perfect eyesight. When you have to squint when you already have good glasses is not a good sign.  But if you need a cheap thermostat, it works.  I don't get the "1 week programmable" though -- it has four time periods for a day, not seven days.

title: Honeywell RTH221B1021/A 1 Week Programmable Thermostat
author: trdrvr2
info_3: The honeywell RTH221 1 DAY programmable thermostat works as intended. It is programmable for 1 DAY only and does what it is asked to do IE cool down at a certain time warm up at a different time etc, however, thisÂ Honeywell RTH221B1021/A 1 Week Programmable ThermostatÂ is being sold as a 1 WEEK programmable thermostat and it is a 1 DAY programmable thermostat.

title: If it could be read, it might be fine.
author: unlisted
info_3: Regardless of whether or not it works, and how versatile it is, if the print is so blasted small that it cannot even be read with my glasses on, then it can't be programmed.  In the middle of the day, I couldn't tell whether it was am or pm or whatever else was printed under the numbers. Try it in the middle of the night!

title: Great product. Make sure to read the manual on ...
author: kxsl
info_3: Great product. Make sure to read the manual on how to use this product correctly. Took me less than 5 minutes to install with the help of youtube. I only use the "hold" program by pressing hold and setting the temp you desire. i didn't mess with the 1 week program because i find it a little over the top and can be confusing for some.

title: Why didn't I think of this sooner?
author: JShackleford
info_3: We had an old mercury theromostat in the house that was off by about 15 degrees and would trip every time you walked past it.Summer is on the way and I wanted to cool the house better and was thinking of buying a floor fan.Looking at pricing, it made more sense to go with a new thermostat.It took about 10 minutes total to remove the old thermostat and install the new one.I left in on the pre-programmed weekly cooling schedule and it has done wonders already.The true test will be when the next utility bill comes in!

title: Buy a different brand/ product.. anything else
author: Dashman05
info_3: Called their customer service line to ask them how to adjust the temperature it showed ( my house was 5 degrees colder then what the thermostat said) customer service said sorry you can?™t adjust and you?™re better off buying a different product. Also the cover snapped when putting in batteries.. POS

title: Can not program for different days.
author: Gary
info_3: I guess I should of read the details before ordering.  It is very easy to install and took me about 10 minutes to hook up.  It works as described but you are only allowed to set 4 temperature/times and they will be the same for every day of the week.  We have the temp up when getting ready for work then down when we leave, back on when we come home and down again when in bed.  The device works fine if this is all you need to have it be the same every day.For most of us who are off two days a week it should be known that you can not add different times for those days.  You need a 5/2 thermostat to make adjustments for weekends.

title: Great programmable thermostat
author: N. Mitchener
info_3: This thermostat works great for my needs. Since there are people in and out of the house all day long, I just wanted something that would simply turn the heat down at night, and turn it back up again in the morning without anyone having to think about it. It doesn't have any major features or frills, but it works as it's supposed to. You can actually set it to come on in the morning and heat the house before you get out of bed, then you can set it for a different temp when you leave for work, and then have it kick back on again before you get home from work, and then finally low again for nighttime (if you like to save energy). It will repeat the programming you set for 7 days a week. It does not allow for separate settings on different days or weekends. You can manually change the temperature and it can retain it temporarily (it'll go back to the temp settings at the next time setting) or you can press the hold button and it'll hold that temperature until you change it or press the run button.Very easy install. If you're like me and have been lazy about upgrading (I know I'm way behind...) then just do it already.

title: Works without a hitch! I actually swapped this unit ...
author: Ploon
info_3: Works without a hitch!  I actually swapped this unit, replacing the Honewell RTH111B1016 without needing to replace the back/mounting plate.  Has 4 time 'zones' to program and will follow that for every day.  Simple to program and runs on AA batteries.  If you need a cost effective and simple solution, this is it.

title: Very poor. Works some of the time and not some ...
author: Ms C
info_3: Very poor.  Works some of the time and not some of the time. Sometimes when it come on it forgets to turn off and your freezing.  So you have to turn the thermostat up and next your hot.  Not good

title: Very good but be aware!,
author: Kendrick Rivera
info_3: I bought this one to replace a standard none-programmable thermostat. It works great and it is easy to install however; you need to be aware that it doesn't have backlight and it does not have a two angle installation meaning that your base box needs to be on a horizontal position on the wall only. It would not fit on a vertical box so you would have to either move the box on the wall or drill through the plastic base of the unit like I did and that is a lot more work as you would have to cover the rest of the hole on the wall.Overall a very good unit and for the price you cannot go wrong.

title: Connecting pins very poor quality, easily bent
author: Josquin DesPrez
info_3: The metal pins that connect the thermostat to the electric current are really soft and very easily bent. The features are fine and it works but when you change the battery you have to remove the unit from the wall and you get another chance to bend any one of the pins. If they used quality metal it wouldn't be so easy to bend them. It's too bad there's no thermostat that lets you change the battery without removing the whole unit.

title: Buy something nicer like an Emerson Sensei. This thing will disappoint you.
author: Mark
info_3: This thing broke about 2 months after I got it. Any time the heat came on it blew a fuse in the AC requiring the removal of a panel to find and figure out. This cost me a repairman visit to figure out. Of course it happened while I was out of town and a cold front hit. The wife and kids went without heat for several days.

title: Photo is not accurate for this model
author: Steve
info_3: You can not program this with different settings for different days. Although the photo shows a day setting, it is a photo of a different model. This is a very basic, weekly programmable thermostat. It is not backlit. It does not display the current room temperature and the heating or cooling temperature at the same time. If your looking for inexpensive, basic, easy to install, then this is for you.

title: Keep a check on battery level-thermostat won't work without them
author: Kay
info_3: Great thermostat, but lacks back lighting. You need to keep a check on the batteries. If they die, your furnace will not work. Our regular alkaline lasted three years (5 month heating seasons). I've replaced them with lithium.  I wish this thermostat used the batteries as back up and powered the thermostat electrically like my old one did.

title: Poor Documentation
author: alder
info_3: Installed this unit and my furnace quit working. Turns out there was a burned out fuse in the air handler. Apparently this unit shorts the power supply to ground when the blue (ground) wire is connected, which is just absurd.The documentation does not specify the function of the individual wires, which would have been helpful. Fortunately the service manual for my air handler did, which allowed me to resolve the problem and get everything working, no thanks to Honeywell.

title: It's Not Fancy, But It Works. And You Don't Need To Sell A Kidney To Afford It.
author: C. B. Manges
info_3: It works. It didn't take me long to figure out, and I'm kind of a moron when it comes to stuff that require me to read instructions, because I don't like to read instructions. Simple and straightforward to install. Takes about 7 minutes. Why spend more?

title: Make sure this has a light--certain models don't and it is unreadable without one.
author: William E. Cripe
info_3: I bought two and I do not know which this is. I thought I was buying the same two. One is not lighted and it is difficult to read with out! Beware.

title: Easy to install and she loves the convenience and simplicity ...
author: PhotoMemere
info_3: Purchased for my mother in law so that she doesn't have to worry about not being able to see the thermostat.  Easy to install and she loves the convenience and simplicity of preset temps throughout the day.

title: Adequate with a couple of small flaws
author: rich1896
info_3: Had to replace my thermostat because the batteries leaked and ruined it--these batteries are above the electronics also, so the same thing could happen with this one. Poor design. Also, my last one had a lighted display, triggered when you press any button, but this doesn't. That is a needed feature if you want to change the setting at night without disturbing others, and I do that often. Too bad. Those are two flaws, but this was easy to install, simple to program, and it does the job. Price was MUCH less than the big box home de... Enough said.

title: Do not buy this!
author: Shelly
info_3: I set this on 68 degrees.  Doesnt turn off until it hits 73.  Worthless. I would give it zero stars if I could.

title: I miss this thermostat!
author: M. Green
info_3: We had this thermostat for many years, and it did everything we needed. Then my computer-savvy husband replaced it with an incredibly expensive Nest. Now the house is never comfortable (because the Nest constantly reverts to the nighttime temperature if no one walks past it for a few minutes), and we are using more oil heat (because the Nest does not interface as well with our solar heating system with oil heat back-up). I really miss this thermostat.

title: Worked really well for over a year after a pretty easy installation (I did myself with little previous electronic ...
author: Z. WANG
info_3: Worked really well for over a year after a pretty easy installation (I did myself with little previous electronic experience). But then last summer (1.5 years in use), it broke and stopped controlling the temperature correctly (was setting it to 72F last summer and it keeps cooling it to 67F which was so cold! Had to switch to another one.. I know this one was cheap but was hoping it will last more than years.. Oh,well, I guess I got what I paid for...

title: If you are like me, and you are replacing an old old ...
author: JLD
info_3: This thermostat gets me hot, but never cools me down.  I suppose If I had central air, then things might be different.  If you are like me, and you are replacing an old old vertical thermostat with this horizontal one, be warned, it won't cover the same spot as the old one.  Chances are, the wall behind the old one was never painted, or is a different color than your current paint.  SO, this cheap little thermostat is a great deal if you don't include the cost of repainting the walls.  I am sure many other more expensive thermostats may have the same issue, so get out your rulers.

title: Easily-installed digital thermostat
author: Andrew and Michelle
info_3: I really like this Honeywell programmable thermostat.  I got this to replace one of those very old ones that has the lever on the side of the thermostat to control the temperature.  It was really hard to get precise control with that thermostat as the exact temperature was difficult to discern.  Needless to say, it was in need of an update!Removing the old thermostat and replacing it with this one was a cinch.  The included instructions were super clear and easy to understand.  I have replaced thermostats before, but even if I hadn't, I believe the instructions are simple enough for anyone to follow.Make sure that when you replace your thermostat that you mark the wires correctly.  The original thermostat should have letters engraved next to where the wires are connected.  Take note of those and the color of the wire (most of the time the letter corresponds to the first letter of the color (for example, "white" - "W"), however, this is not always true.After everything is disconnected, you just need to attach all of the wires to the new terminals in the Honeywell thermostat.  Tighten a few screws (they are small screws, so you will need a small screwdriver!) and you are ready to go!I am very satisfied with this purchase.  I have installed two Honeywells now.  One is this model, and the other is the 5/2 day model.  Both are great and easy to use.No regrets with this purchase!

title: Do Not Buy This !!!!!!!
author: Delburt D
info_3: I have to put on very close up glasses and use a bright flashlight to even see the display. It has a very wide differential temp range, so you are comfortable half of the time and get cold at the low end and roast at the high end. Have had this about four months and I am going to replace it with a much better unit.

title: Works nicely, surprisingly good tech-support
author: Chief Brody
info_3: Cheap, works just right, easy to install (easier if I read the instructions). Actually, I had it all hooked in in 5 or 6 minutes (take a picture of what wires went where from your previous thermo. if you're not accustomed to this type of thing - and have a small screwdriver ready - actually, the little twist-out file on most nail clippers will work). It worked through one cycle and pooped out.I thought, oh well, what do I expect for 20 bucks? Called Honeywell with what I though was a hail-mary pass in terms of even getting support, let alone solving it. The tech. said "electric or gas?" I response "Electric." She said, oh, push this button and hold it, the using the up/down buttons, get it to "5." Done. Bingo. Works. Happy.Wish it lit up, but it didn't advertise as such, so no penalty.

title: Easy to program
author: J. Garrett
info_3: I used these to upgrade my simple 2 wire (red & white) for my gas burner, not central cooling. Easy to program, and the temp is accurate.  Install was easy

title: Great value!
author: Regina
info_3: I have had this for over a year, it has saved me countless amounts of money as I turn the heat up while getting ready for work then usually forget to turn it down. Also, I hate it cold when I go to bed, but I hate it hot while I'm sleeping. This little guy does the trick. It was easy for me to install, anyone could do it.

title: No thought for replacing batteries.
author: Mick Hansen
info_3: Two stars only because of the way this unit mounts.  For how hard it is to open I'd probably pull it off the wall trying to open it!!!  A bit more detail:  I live in a '70's era single-wide trailer with the wood paneling on the walls.  This unit mounts to the wall with two screws.  When you go to open it, you're not just pulling off the faceplate, you're pulling the entire guts off the wall, leaving behind a flimsy plastic baseplate.  Whoever desinged this thing put in some pin/socket connector to allow the unit to be removed without disconnecting the wires every time.  This pin connector is WAY to tight.  The last unit (cant remember the name) had the batteries behind a cover where you also had the programming instructions.  It just flipped down.  I know this one isn't programmable and maybe thats why they designed it.  One set of batteries MAY last five years or something.  But, when they do finally croak, and they will, I'll probably destroy this thing forcing me to buy yet ANOTHER thermostat.  So, instead of $2 in batteries, another $15 for a new thermostat.  Nope.I never did install it, so i honesly cannot attest to is functionality, ease of use, ect, ect.

title: No background light
author: turkeylady 3
info_3: Haven't had any problems in the several years we've had this but there's no background light which as far as I'm concerned makes this a cheap thermostat  never heard of a thermostat in this day and age not having background app  Very inconvenient to have to light up this area to adjust thermostat

title: Works perfectly for my needs.
author: kbrown
info_3: I like to sleep with it being really, really cold and I am on a electricity plan to where my electricity is free from 9 PM to 6 AM. I bought this for my apartment so that it will automatically come on and off at that time and I don't have to worry about turning it off when I want to sleep in on the weekends. It is easy to use and set up. The time options are in increments of 15 minutes and gives you 4 times (wake, leave, home, and sleep) to set the temp during the 24 hour period. It does not give you the option to set it for each day of the week, every day is the same. The maintenance had no trouble installing it, that I know of. In fact, I just moved and bought it again for my new place.

title: Perfect replacements for our motorhome thermostats.
author: EdMcK
info_3: I ordered this simple thermostat to replace one of the two Duo-Therm unit in our 33'  motorhome. A YouTube video explained the correct wiring and installation was simple and quick. After seeing how easy it was, I ordered a second unit for the rear AC unit. Very pleased.

title: REPLACED A 50 YEAR OLD 2 WIRE
author: BILLY
info_3: THIS REPLACED A 50 YEAR OLD GAS FURNACE THERMOSTAT 2 WIRE ONE WHITE AND ONE BLACK ,WHITE ON "W" BLACK ON "R" WORKS GREAT

title: I was terribly disappointed as I have used Honeywell Stats for over ...
author: Pstrjl
info_3: The thing came apart on me while trying to open it to install batteries. Then the unit did not work at all. I returned it and went to town and bought a LUX off the shelf that works perfectly. I was terribly disappointed as I have used Honeywell Stats for over 35 years. Just not the same.UPDATE: I have never received any communication from Honeywell about this product....

title: Will not turn on furnace when temp in room is below 32 degrees F
author: Jason Hinds
info_3: Do not use this thermostat in areas that get below 32 degrees F.  The thermostat will not turn on your furnace when below the 32 degree temperature.  I was using this in an unheated garage in Michigan where the temps drop to 0 degrees F and the thermostat would not call for heat.  I spoke with Honeywell customer service and they confirmed that the thermostat will not turn on heat when the temperature is below 32 degrees.

title: It is what I wanted
author: dude128
info_3: Easy to install, and program.  I set the get up time/temp, leave time/temp, arrive home time/temp and go to bed time/temp.  I set it once and it works every day!

title: No backlight
author: Anastasja
info_3: Works great but doesn't have a backlight. Makes it hard to adjust the temp in the middle of the night. Other than that it works perfect.

title: works good
author: Gene M.
info_3: This was easy to install.  I did have a wire left over which the directions said to cap off and everything seems to work well.  I don't like the high speed temperature change when you hold the button.  If you hold the temp up or down for just a split second it jumps 15 degrees.

title: Malfunctions
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: This was super easy to install and came with easy step-by-step instructions. We have had it in for two-months now with no issues to report.Edit: Now that it has warmed up, we tried to start our a/c and it did not work. We called out a technician who checked everything and determined that this thermostat was faulty. He replaced it with one of their and it works great now. So it worked great in the winter but not in the summer. 50%

title: Well made and eady to use.
author: John K
info_3: Easy to use. Easy to install. Easy to program. Easy to override when desired.  Accurate.  Does the heater as well as the A.C. unit.

title: Good and Basic
author: Anthony J.
info_3: The picture shows you what you are buying but also check the size, because with the Trane I replaced, it didn't cover the edges which now need paint.The description is....confusing. This is just a basic thermostat that includes daily time periods that are programmable and I know many won't read it that way. Think of the price and how much you think it should do and it makes sense. Since a daytime/night time temperature change suits most, this unit will too. Although, because this has no back-lighting, you won't want it at all if you'll be needing a flashlight to see it.Install for me...could have been a breeze, but it wasn't. Trane has there own wiring and then the installer also had his own system and almost nothing was standard.Here's what I'd suggest, the Honeywell site has the manual for download. You should do that and pull yours away from the wall and do a mock install...before ordering. Yours could honestly be extremely simple or you could be without for 24 hours because of blowing an air exchanger fuse like I did.I hope that this helps someone with this online purchase.

title: Very good alternative to the box stores
author: Riktar
info_3: Very good alternative to the box stores. Has all the basic functions and comes with everything to make it a plug and play application.

title: Five Stars
author: Skip
info_3: Works just as advertised.  Delivered on time.  Was not difficult to install.  Failed after 3 months.

title: And wanted to thank everyone for making the installation super easy.
author: Undecidedly
info_3: When I first received the package that was a little confused. I only had two wires and this thing had a lot of points. Then I went into the question and answer section where I bought the thermostat. And wanted to thank everyone for making the installation super easy.

title: No frills, no fuss
author: Andrew S. Reed
info_3: It was cheap, easy to set up, and it works as it should. It's a no frills digital thermostat that won't let you down.

title: Not for all RV's AC units. Does not have a High/Low fan switch!
author: B. Langhans
info_3: Had to send it back as it does not have a fan high/low switch for typical RV AC's. Had to send it back.

title: Good job
author: Grandad Mark
info_3: Meeting our needs for a rental condo. Great price. If it lasts for years it will be great.

title: Good Little Thermostat.
author: Steve Coakley
info_3: These can be installed and programmed in less than 5 minutes then it holds the temp. to within 1 deg. of the setpoint.  That's amazing when you consider it's even cheaper than the old dumb round ones.  The only problems with it is that the text on the LCD screen is really tiny and can be hard to read, there is no backlight like on other models, the Heat/Off/Cool switch is hard to switch and I'm not crazy about using penlight cells to power it that can leak and damage the insides.

title: Needs a backlight, might have missed that.
author: M. Good
info_3: It had good instructions and made for an easy swap. I don't recall seeing if it specified it doesn't have a backlit screen, but I don't know why you'd make it without.

title: Easy
author: Melissa
info_3: Easy to install and easy to use. Dislike it doesn?™t have a back light.

title: The screen is incredibly small and no option to set/see ...
author: VBF
info_3: The screen is incredibly small and no option to set/see day.  This is not what I ordered but I also paid for installation so I have no choice but to keep it

title: ... expected and is smaller than I expected but is nice.
author: Inquiring minds want to know
info_3: Works as expected and is smaller than I expected but is nice.

title: wont hold program after a week
author: justsaying
info_3: worked out of the box for about a week,, now it doesnt want to work in the afternoons,, we have to reprogram it every day after work.  looking for a new one this weekend that is NOT a honeywell........they have tapped this well dry of its honey.  i bought it at Walmart,, but you can't take it back to Walmart and no way am i going to hang on the phone with some 'rep' at honeywell asking me about wiring and set up/programming.

title: So Easy to install and works great !
author: PNYC
info_3: I bought two thermostats that would be easy to read and set. I was afraid I would not know how to install it, as I'm not mechanically inclined - more of a bookworm. You can understand my hesitation. In any event, I received this thermostat and I installed the first one at my parents' house. They have an old mercury thermostat that was no longer working properly. Most important thing is to cut the power to the furnace, then label the wires in the old thermostat.I just finished installing the new Honeywell and it was SOOO EASY and it works like a charm. Their connections only had two wires, white and red. It couldn't have been simpler. My parents' don't want to have it set daily or weekly, just manually, adjusting the temp to fit their comfort. The numbers are clearly legible and best of all, the thermostat tells them when the furnace is on (when nothing is stated it means it's off). This saves them a trip to the basement to check if it's working - other than feeling/hearing the steam come up.The next step is replacing the thermostat at my (newer) condo. Given this practice, it should go well. In any event, there's a service number to call for help. I trust these guys can be of support, if needed. So far so good. I installed the thermostat at my condo. I thought I needed the super to cut the power to the furnace - since I don't have access to it, directly - but I didn't need to do that. My apartment is finally heated at the best temp for me. All I needed to do is reset the temperatures pre-set by honeywell on their schedule. I came home last night and the apt was a comfortable 68 degrees. It doesn't go on in the middle of the night, waking me up, b/c it's preset at 62. Anyway, I am very happy with the thermostat and can't imagine spending over $200 for ones you can control with your smartphone.There is no doubt that this product can make anyone as happy as I am.

title: Simple to install - Simple to program
author: Brent Konieczny
info_3: It has an intuitive design for programming. Anyone could program it without having to read a manual. Just take note of or label the wires going to your old thermostat before installing.

title: It's okay.
author: Misudfr
info_3: Pretty easy to install but to replace the batteries every year, that will be a hassle (poor design).  The switches are very stiff and am not sure how long those switches will last.

title: I ordered 3 RTH221B units but was disappointed that all 3 units shipped were different models
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: I ordered 3 RTH221B units but was disappointed that all 3 units shipped were different models.  They all work pretty well but instruction documents did not match the product.  Had to guess how to wire up one of them.  The programming procedure is different on each of them as well.  One unit was clearly was not new.

title: A deal
author: carson powers lr
info_3: Great being able to program temps when your away from home

title: works great. Comes with mounting screws and drywall mollies
author: Schmitz
info_3: Replaced an old Hunter (non programmable) that is still selling on Amazon for 40 dollars.  Saw this one for less than half that.  I had never replaced one of these before but with the instructions It was Installed in a few minutes, works great.  Comes with mounting screws and drywall mollies.One thing that should be mentioned, the screws for the wires are so tiny you need one of those eyeglass screwdrivers (not phillips) to install this.  Minor inconvenience but I had to shut off the A/C to install this and then had to run to the drug store to buy an eyeglass repair kit for the tiny screwdriver.  By the time I got back and installed it was 86f in my house.  Not sure what they were thinking when they designed this, as I have an extensive screwdriver set with just about every bit you could imagine but not one even close to small enough for this.

title: Spend the extra  $5.00 to get a illuminated screen.
author: Caesar Ramos Amaral
info_3: This product work but REALLY needs a light to illuminate the screen.

title: Four Stars
author: Jose Mor
info_3: Works great. i love it. would buy again.

title: Don't worry when you can't set day of the week.
author: tubesguy
info_3: Easy install and works fine. One note: The included "Operation Manual" is not specific to this model. It indicates that you must set time _and day of the week_ in order for the thermostat to work. As you will discover, perhaps after a period of head-scratching and swearing,  you can't set the day of the week, because ... the day of the week doesn't matter. This is a 1 week programmable, with the same program for every day of the week. Duh.

title: Wish I could set separate schedules for weekday and weekend ...
author: Joe B.
info_3: Wish I could set separate schedules for weekday and weekend. The picture even shows a "Th" for Thursday on the display - this isn't even a function of this model. I misunderstood the description and thought I was purchasing the same model I had before. Doesn't really help at all unless you have the same schedule on weekdays and weekends.

title: Easy
author: Scottomatic
info_3: Easy to install, easy to program and really affordable. I'm using it to run my forced air heat only system. Huge upgrade from basic.

title: good upgrade from the old mercury style
author: Mike Honcho
info_3: worked as it should. good upgrade from the old mercury style.

title: One Star
author: Selle E
info_3: Stopped working properly after about a month.

title: making the programmability useless on the weekend if we are home (as the ...
author: Zach
info_3: item does not work properly, does not click off sometimes when it should (going above the desired temperature more than a degree or two and must be manually turned off). I didnt realize this was only programmable for the whole week (meaning you cannot make saturday or sunday different that the work week, making the programmability useless on the weekend if we are home (as the thermostat would be turned down).

title: No light
author: greg
info_3: So far so good but when you come out at night to change the temp level it has no light so you have too turn on a light to see what your doing

title: Picture on product shows programmable by day but it doesn't ...
author: Zach
info_3: Picture on product shows programmable by day but it doesn't come with that capability. I have been con'd out my money with a product I wish I could return but is too late.

title: Four Stars
author: Elijah
info_3: Great price. Great install instruction. One complaint: The display does not light up!

title: Very basic will not work on some standard HVAC
author: Fredy
info_3: It works, it has very limited settings you can change. If you want one very basic this is for you.

title: The installation was very easy, and programming the unit was very easy and ...
author: Chuck H.
info_3: I bought this because I am on a tight budget, and I have come to trust the Honeywell brand over the years. The installation was very easy, and programming the unit was very easy and straight forward.Here is the problem: The unit doesn't kick on/off as it reaches the target temperature. For instance, last night I had the unit set to 68 degrees, and the furnace was still running after it reached 77 degrees. Other times the house will be 60 degrees when the unit is set to 68.

title: One Star
author: kabar77
info_3: This does not turn on automatically when it reaches the temperature I set. When our handyman put back the old one, it worked fine. I called the honeywell but they keep saying I need to have contractor look at the wiring.. do not buy this

title: Hook up and setup are easy, clear instructions
author: Mike
info_3: Hook up and setup are easy, clear instructions. The help line is easily accessable.When ever you want to re-program the heat or cooling modes, the settings for the other are wiped out. In other words, when you switch from heat to cooling mode and you change the temp settings for say the cooling, you are also changing the temp settings for the heating mode. The memory for each should be seperate.

title: Well it works but there is no backlit light,
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Well it works but there is no backlit light, so install it where you have light to see it to use it

title: Fragile
author: Dov
info_3: Extremely fragile. Breaks when you touch it. Almost impossible to remove cover in order to change batteries.

title: does not work
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: This thermostat has settings throughout the day to auto set the temperature, so you can coordinate usage of cheap time electricity vs exensive time, when you are not home. It seems to have a mind of its own, however. Does not work according to time settings. Didn't notice until too late to return.

title: Turns itself off but leaves the heat on
author: KorganRivera
info_3: Got one of these a few days ago.  Easy to install.  But here's the problem.It runs on two AAA batteries.  If the batteries die, the unit won't turn the heat off.  I put in two fresh batteries when I installed it, but here I am at 7 am awake because I'm being cooked to death.  I check the thermostat and it had shut itself off and left the heat on.  If I press on the cover, it turns itself back on.  So it's not that the batteries are bad, it's where they connect.If you get one that works, great.  Everything else about it is fine.  But they are cheaply made and you might get one like mine.

title: Cheap all the way around
author: Alyssa Hill
info_3: Piece of crap. This thermostat is a bad representation  of Honeywell and we are not impressed. Refused to communicate with heating elements, did not initiate heater after following  instructions specifically. It is a cheaply made product that broke in half instantaneously  when attempting to remove from the wall in order to double check wiring.

title: Did they manufacture the display under a microscope?
author: twoemjay
info_3: The time, especially the "AM" and "PM" displays are microscopic.  This is no lie.  I could not believe they manufacture something like this.  It works well and we wanted the thermostat with just the one day setting for the entire week since my mother is retired and everyday is a weekend for her but the readout display is abysmal!!!  It doesn't matter if you have the best vision in the world, you will NOT be able to tell if it's AM or PM.

title: Four Stars
author: Nev
info_3: Great product!

title: It's good.
author: jeneric
info_3: Straight-forward thermostat with standard 4-wire systems.  It's good.

title: Not Happy!
author: DAVID E. SIMPSON
info_3: Received this order promptly (day early) and following the installation instructions was done in less than the 15 minutes they said it would take.  Next came the programming - would not program per the instructions so called the toll free number and waited 40 minutes only to be cut off.  Called again and waited 15 minutes and still no answer so gave up and called later.  Call was immediately answered and the tech asked what the product number was off the inside of the thermostat.  Still would not program and the back light was not working.  Sent back for a refund and went to Lowes and bought what I needed.

title: owned, has worked ok for few years
author: andy
info_3: Cheap, works.But must use batteries and no 'Auto" option for temperature.  So during days right around ideal temperature you will probably have to manually switch it from heat to cold or end up with a very hot or cold house if the temperature shifts in the wrong direction..

title: Cheap garbage!
author: Vincent Giardini
info_3: They say "you get what you pay for"! I paid cheap ... I got cheap. This is an absolute piece of garbage. I followed the instructions to separate the mounting plate from the body. The whole thermostat fell apart! Buttons fell off, the zebra strip (which connects the circuit board to the LCD) came off. Very poor design. (I happen to be an EE, so I know a bit about these things.) No way to put it back together. It went straight into the garbage. I'll go to HD to get one that is better designed.

title: a big money saver.

title: Stupid thing is so cheap fell apart

info_3: I couldn't tell you whether it works or not!  On the back it says pull here to remove the wall mount oh yeah insert the batteries and connect wires to the wall.  Push pulled, go ahead, doesn't work.  Pushed and pulled.  It 's not happening.  Resorted to carefully prying at the suggested entry point.  Stupid thing is so cheap fell apart.  Finally saw where to put the batteries, but the buttons, the screen, and the unit was in pieces.  After several attempts at putting it all back together threw it in the trash.  Not even worth the hassle for a refund.  There is no battery cover, and the wall plate/connection cover is not easily accessible. More likely like my experience to leave you with a worthless pile of parts.

It was super easy to install as the installation guide was very easy to follow, and Honeywell even includes little stickers to label your wires with.  Programming it for power saver was very, very easy as well (it took about 3 minutes).  Overall, happy with the purchase, just wish the unit had a backlight.

It's located in a dark hallway and I have to turn a light on to set the temp, otherwise it does what it's supposed to do and was easy to install although you do need batteries for it to work. Some do, some don't but this one def does. Hoping it lasts longer than a year but at this price you really can't beat it.

title: Very Misleading Amazon Post
author: Ben Keith
info_3: Yes, I realize now by reading the product description that it does not have the ability to differentiate between the days of the week, but calling it a "1 Week Programmable Thermostat" is extremely misleading.  They could just as well have called it a "1 Month" or a "1 Year Programmable Thermostat" thermostat because there is nothing about the operation of this unit that relates specifically to a one week duration; it can only distinguish between different times of the day.  What was even more confusing was the fact that the instruction manual I received with the unit talks about setting the day of the week without any hint that some models don't support it -- and the display on this unit even has the day abbreviations etched into it (you can see them if you look at it under the right light).  Additionally, as you can see in the main product image at the top of the page, there is clearly a "Th" visible implying that the unit is capable of distinguishing between the days of the week.Otherwise, the unit was pretty easy to install and program and seems to work as it's supposed to.  However, misleading product promotion is inexcusable and is enough to outweigh any good qualities as far as I'm concerned.

title: One Star
author: H. M.
info_3: The back plate is very difficult to separate this must be a design issue.

title: One Star
author: ToniRae
info_3: This is absolute junk. Replaced 1st one & it's malfunctioning now.

title: DOES NOT WORK below FREEZING!  Not one-week programmable.
author: Dreadflint
info_3: Below 32 degrees F this thermostat WILL NOT TURN ON MY HEAT!. This thermostat is useless for my garage. I am going to stop using the one I got for my house as well. Exactly when you need it most, this thermostat will not work. Below freezing the screen also reads 'LO' instead of a temperature.This is not 'one week programmable'. It is what I would call 'one day' programmable. It has no concept of a 7 day week. It will run the same program every day.Update: We still are using this thermostat in our house, but today we ordered a fancy wifi thermostat because, horribly, the thermostat can not keep a good connection to the batteries. Many times when my roommate walks past the thermostat the screen is blank and he has to jiggle it to make it come back on. It also loses time very rapidly.

title: I can't believe I wasted half a day before finally getting this thermostat to ...
author: John
info_3: Absolutely NO wiring instructions.  One might expect Honeywell to include a wiring diagram to install it on a three-wire system, but nooooo!  It took me several hours of research and several unsuccessful calls to tech support to get it to work.  A hidden jumper needed to be removed, and the wire colors didn't even remotely match the marks on the terminals, i.e.,"W" did NOT mean white wire, "B" did NOT mean blue wire, etc.  Honeywell's ARROGANCE is beyond the pale!  I can't believe I wasted half a day before finally getting this thermostat to work, and I would NEVER buy another Honeywell product.

I have found this is not the case, and it clicks on and off just as loudly as any other digital thermostat.  Also, it has at least a 2-degree dead spot where it wont come on for example when it's set to 76 until the ambient goes to 78. That's a loose range, and it would be much better if it would recognize half-degrees.

author: sean
info_3: The 15 minute setup time in my case was a bit misleading. Considering the AC unit in my house wasn't wired correctly and was rigged to function. I got this installed and the programming on it was stupid simple. You can set it up with a single program for four times of day and the thermostat obeys. This is a great no frills 7 day programmable thermostat. Honeywell also includes everything needed to install in seconds to the wall. I don't have the greatest vision and the display was easy to read and setup compared to my old mechanical mercury thermostat. For $20 you can't go wrong.

You can NOT chose the day of the week at all.

title: NEVER BUY A THERMOSTAT FROM AMAZON!
author: SerenaC
info_3: This is the worst amazon experience I've ever had, both in terms of product and response.  I bought one of these thermostats because I wanted something easy to program and was under the impression that Honeywell was a reputable brand.  After a few weeks using it successfully, I bought a second for the other heat zone.  Shortly thereafter, the first one stopped working. To make a long story short, its prongs got corroded and had to be wiped off, something to consider if you live in a humid or coastal area, as this is a chronic issue.  Now, the second one has mysteriously  dropped stone dead, with no corrosion issue.  A 15 minute tech call with a hard-to-understand Honeywell rep ended with the direction to get my money back or a replacement from the vendor. Now, that would be amazon. Amazon's website says they only have a 30-day return policy, even though Honeywell's manual says this piece of junk has a one year guarantee.  After a phone conversation with amazon, they are refunding some of my money, but charging a $3.80 restocking fee, and I have to take said junk to UPS to return it to them.  Meanwhile, I'm living in northern New England and I AM FREEZING! I obviously can't wait to purchase another thermostat from amazon and have it shipped, as the heat in the second zone does not work without a thermostat, so had to get one at a local hardware store. Moral of story -- avoid this particular model, and buy your thermostats locally after reading on line reviews to learn which is right for you. If you have a problem with it, you need a refund and replacement immediately for something like this, not a week down the road.

title: Easy install and setup, but lacks some user-control of temperature cycle.
author: BF Hammer
info_3: I bought this at a local Menards store with assistance of the staff. I replaced an old round Honeywell mercury-switch model. Have the typical 2-wire setup for a very ancient (40 years old?) natural gas forced hot air furnace. I decided to squeeze some savings on the gas bill by lowering the temperature during the workday when I'm never home for 9 hours, and also drop temperature overnight as I like it cooler while I sleep.Installation was a breeze. I work as an office equipment service tech, so I did not expect any trouble figuring it out, your mileage may vary in that regard though. I had the required small screwdrivers on hand. The mounting template perfectly matched the old round thermostat, so I just reused the old screws in the original holes in the wall. As I customarily do, I did read the installation and setup directions prior to installation.Programming was also fairly easy. What you have to understand here is that there are 4 adjustable times of the day where the temperature can be allowed to change. Exactly what the amount I needed for my purposes. If you wish for fewer adjustments, just set 2 or more of the consecutive time events to be the same temperature. This is how I handled the weekend program, as I only wanted to lower the temperature at bedtime and raise again in the morning. I left the "away" and "home" at the same temperature as the "wake" setting to accomplish that. Again, you can adjust the time of day for these events in 15 minute increments. I did not see anything confusing about this other than I would forget to push the set button and think I was adjusting the temperature, and instead was changing the time. The numbers being adjusted flash, so that was just me not being observant.The reason for me giving 3 stars is this: there is no adjustment for temperature on/off cycle. That old mercury-switch mechanical thermostat was designed to turn on the heat a couple of degrees below the set temperature, and turn off heat a couple of degrees above. That allowed the furnace to cycle on fewer times, and not waste fuel warming the heat exchanger each time. This cheap Honeywell digital thermostat turns on the furnace with only a dip of 1 degree F, off after warming to set temperature. My furnace in my 100+ year old home with little insulation started cycling on every 12 minutes for short bursts of heat. Turns out that the temperature cycle is factory set and cannot change. The only way to gain some control of this is to go into the advanced programming features and adjust the "cycles per hour". Default setting was 5 (maximum) cycles per hour, thus the furnace turning on every 12 minutes (5 times per hour). I dropped this setting to 3 (20 minutes wait between cycles) and may readjust to 2 in the future. Naturally, the manual does not explain the cycles-per-hour setting other than generic recommendations for different types of heating systems. I can see this becoming a potential problem with actually causing me to use more fuel than with the mechanical thermostat. I'll just have to monitor my fuel use and re-evaluate later in the winter. I may need to bite the bullet and spend 2-3 times more for a different brand thermostat that will allow me to adjust the heat cycle to something that approximates the old thermostat more closely. Wish I had researched this prior to purchase now. Cycling the furnace on-off more often can also lead to it failing, and I do not see how taking a 3-5 year loan to pay for a new furnace saves me money. Everybody I know that replaced furnaces with higher-efficient models during the 1990's are replacing their expensive furnaces again. Mine keeps chugging along.11-23-2013: I bought the Honeywell trim kit http://www.amazon.com/Honeywell-50002883001-50002883-001-Coverplate/dp/B00096JC72/ref=cm_cr-mr-titleAfter installing, I am noticing that the temperature is tracking more correctly compared to a mercury thermometer on a nearby wall. I suspect that the trim plate is isolating the theromstat from the wall surface temperature (which is cool to the touch usually). The temperature is not fluctuating so badly. Furnace is not turning on at regular intervals this weekend. It's also a lot warmer outside, so again time will tell on this.

title: Gets the job done
author: Dion Weisler
info_3: Installation was very simple and intuitive.
