It's an easy direct replacement for the thermostat that was built into out new house a few years ago that was damaged by the kids, The old unit used metal pins to terminate connections to the back plane.  The kids had pulled it odd and broke some pins.  I soldered the pins back on to the printed circuit board but I knew it would never be the same.  Once the batteries grew tired I decided to replace it with the Honeywell RTH2300B1012/E1.  I'm glad I did, because it works great, has excellent scheduling capability, good LCD back light, and the nature of the physical mounting should prevent pin damage from children.  A forceful downward pull should not dislodge this unit as it did with the one it replaced.  The January 2018 cold snap is a clear indicator that we shouldn't roll the dice with a cobbled unit.The temperature reading seems identical to my home's OEM thermostat.  It works for heating and cooling,  I cannot complain.

title: No way to delete unneeded set times
author: William Taylor
info_3: Have had it running for a month and it works a lot better than the builder grade Carrier thermostat that it replaced. Temp displayed is within a degree of an instant read thermometer. What I do not like about it is it assumes you go to work and leave the house empty during the day. We work from home and only need to set back the temp at night while we are sleeping. Have not found a way to defeat the extra setting other than just duplicating daytime temp in the program. Stay home scenario is not addressed in the instruction manual. It seems to be working at least so far.

title: Not disappointed - good value
author: ML
info_3: Easy enough installation. Has worked well so far. Display is not that easy to read without the back-light and the main numbers are a little smaller than I hoped.I am not using the cooling side since I have no air conditioning. It presented no problems working with a millivolt furnace.

title: Perfect!
author: Elizabeth
info_3: Ordered two. One of my AC units broke two months ago, and after having repairs done repeatedly, the house still wouldn't cool down. The old manual thermostat would be set at 50Â°, but the temperature of the house stayed at about 80Â°. Once outside temps hit 120Â°, I gave up and ordered this product. I went cheap, in case the thermostat wasn't the problem, and we're selling soon so I can't overspend on upgrades.Installed as quickly as the packaging states. Set up the schedule and turned the AC on. Much to my surprise, the AC unit isn't, in fact, hopelessly broken! The thermostats work great. I didn't need anything fancy to connect to my phone and Wi-Fi nonsense. I just needed a thermostat that worked, and shut off the unit when the temperature was reached (the old one just ran non-stop).Would definitely recommend!

title: Ok for the price. Mounting design needs improvement
author: R. C. Kuerth
info_3: The cost is very good. The mounting system could be better. The cut out on the back of the thermostat is very small which does not leave much space for the wires. The set screw on the red terminal was over torqued. Getting it loose to connect the red wire almost broke the terminal block.

title: Works Well
author: Rich
info_3: I bought this specifically for use in an RV because it runs on internal batteries.  RV's use a very different method of controlling the heater than a home heating system.  I had to use a meter to determine how to hook it up since the thermostat is clearly designed for home heating, not an RV.  It's working well for the purpose I'm using it for.One caveat for anyone thinking of doing what I did or using it in some sort of cabin normally not occupied.  There is some internal programming that is not documented in the manual and which I discovered by talking to Honeywell after I ran into a problem.  Below a certain temperature (I don't remember the number but it's near freezing) the thermostat will not turn the heat on even though it appears to be working.  You need to warm it up with your hands to a temperature above the threshold before it will start to work.Other than that little bit of a pain for my application it seems like a nice inexpensive programmable thermostat.

title: Works excellent with hot water heating system.
author: Mr. V
info_3: Was easy to install. Back-lit display is nice. Best feature - setting number of heating cycles per hour, for more consistent temperatures. Made a huge difference for me in curbing temperature swings with hot water heating system, compared to conventional thermostat.

title: Exactly right
author: G. Knolan
info_3: Not my first digital thermostat, so programming was easy. Even so, it is straight forward and simple. So much so, hardest part of install and settings was filling the previous thermostats holes, spraying wall with texture finish and painting it to match well!

title: Great Thermostat.  Works perfectly!
author: ShannonT
info_3: I set this up in my grandmothers house to replace an old mercury thermostat.  Her vision is starting to get bad and she was forever moving the temp up and down on her old thermostat because she couldn't see where the temp gauge was actually at.  She has a pellet stove and was burning 1-2 two bags of pellets a day!  After installing this thermostat I set her day temp to 75 and her night temp to 70.  She is perfectly content and warm and is only using about 2/3 of a bag of pellets a day.  Awesome product that started saving a ton of money from the first day of installation.  I would highly recommend.

title: AC costing you a fortune?  Give this a try!
author: SarahBeth
info_3: We've been having issues with the manual thermostat installed in our apartment for well over a year now.  The AC would kick on and never turn off and it got to the point where we were actually smacking it to turn the air on and off.  VERY annoying to say the least.  After getting permission to buy a personal one, I started shopping.  This thermostat is just perfect.  The programmable options are amazing for such a steal of a price!  It allows you to customize temperatures for the weekday and weekends.  Then it gets even more complex by letting you choose 4 times a day to change/set the temperature. (Wake up/Leave the house/Return home/Bedtime)Once installed, I set the temps to be nice and cool when we're home and much warmer when no one is.  This is a very big deal for drastic warm or cold places.  This has saved us a ton on our electric bill!  I strongly recommend this thermostat for the price and for the convenience.  Installation is simple and quick with the connection of just a few wires and screwing it into the wall.

title: Careful with this one. Only allows for 5 day ...
author: Michelle Plasencia
info_3: Careful with this one. Only allows for 5 day programming and not separate weekend programming. Otherwise, does it job. If you require independent "Weekend" programming as well, then select Honeywell: RTH221B1021/A 1 Week Programmable.

title: temperature reading is off by 3.5 degrees - dont buy
author: B. Weber
info_3: Cheap and easy to install but displayed temperature is low by 3.5 degrees when compared to two other thermometers whose readings agreed.  Other one star complaints of this Honeywell model concerting temperature are a warning that this model is a problem.  Be wise and look again.

title: Great purchase
author: Matthew Phillis
info_3: Wow, didn't know how bad my previous high-end thermostat was until I installed this unit.  Install instructions could be a bit clearer with electric heat-pumps, but not bad enough to impact my 5-star rating.PROS:Optional 5 minute minimum run time (to protect against short run times)Programming is easyBacklit Display - clearCons:Audible click when target temp is reached

title: Must have in Florida
author: Maggie
info_3: My husband had no issues installing this, and the scheduled timer is saving us money on our electric bill! We set it higher for hours when we are at work, and I don't have to remember to turn up the air before leaving the house.

title: one of the best thermostats i've installed ever.
author: Bobert
info_3: very good thermostat, but very small letter size, (ridiculously small letter size when trying to setsetting), otherwise very good, have three, one in shop, upstairs bedroom, and house. keeps temperature within 1 or two degrees.

title: Overall a good deal!
author: Jason
info_3: Purchased this thermostat to replace the OEM analog thermostat in our travel trailer. Installation took less than 10 minutes and it worked perfectly. Went with the programmable model because we park our travel trailer on the side of our house and use it as an office during the week. Twice the price at some of the big box retail stores. Overall a good deal!

title: Quality control issues.
author: C. Coulter
info_3: First one was DOA, the hours portion of the LCD screen was out, making it impossible to set the time or schedule as all you can see is minutes. Fun. Amazon exchange process is easy and all that, but the several day delay to wait for a new one is a hassle. Quality control on these units from Mexico seems to be lacking.Other than that, my old honeywells could set the schedule in 10 minute increments, these new ones only do 15 minute increments. Not a huge deal, but still annoying that there is less control than the old ones, rather than more. And of course the form factor changed, so new holes in the wall, another minor annoyance, but it makes you wonder if the product design teams ever bother to think at all.Assuming I get a new one that works, the price is right and I'd still use them because of that. It's completely ridiculous in this day and age to pay hundreds of dollars for a simple programmable thermostat with less smarts than the average modern wristwatch!Update 2/23:My replacement has been installed and operating for a few days now. I'm upgrading my star rating accordingly.

title: Slow to start when frozen
author: OTTO
info_3: We use this on a cabin in the Michigan Upper Peninsula. When we leave we shut the cabin down completely, no heat, no water, no power. The inside temp may be below zero in the winter when we start up the heater that this thermostat controls. Our other cabin heater starts up instantly with its old Honeywell mercury switch thermostat, but this one takes a while to get going. My guess is that the batteries are frozen and don't provide enough voltage for the control circuit to work until they warm up a bit from the other heater. Once it starts working it works great. Maybe I should  put some warm  batteries in it before I try to start it in the winter. This is an unusual situation for a thermostat and I am not downgrading the thermostat because I am probably using it outside of its design parameters.

title: simple and efficient thermostat
author: Ratatouille
info_3: This is 5/2 day programmable thermostat that is simple to use and install.  It needs two AAA batteries, which are not included in the package.  I installed this thermostat on a Sunday and had an issue.  I called the toll free #, and got a support person online with no wait time.  The person helping me out was a lady from India.  I had no problem communicating with her and she was patient in helping me out.  Essentially, I had the blue cable in the incorrect slot.  She had me move the blue cable to the "Y" slot, and told me to wait for a few minutes until the "cold on" stopped blinking.  She said the thermostat had a built in safety feature for the compressor.  As soon as the "cold on" was solid, she told me to check the compressor.  The compressor was on and a few seconds later, the fan kicked in.  I started feeling cold air blowing out of the vents and my problem was resolved.

title: Ok for the price....
author: animageofmine
info_3: Had this unit installed by the builder and worked for a bit less than 2 years. Then suddenly it lost the accuracy it had earlier. It did not detect temperatures at an offset of about 5-6 degrees. So, if I set the temperature to 70, this thermostat would not start until the temperature actually reached 64/65 and then it would be on until the actual temperature reached 75. I thought it might be the batteries that needs replacement, but that didn't help. So, I thought there must be some dust over the sensor, so I cleaned that up too, but in vain.Since, the new unit was just 20 bucks, I didn't think too much about troubleshooting the existing unit. Ordered a new one and it is working just fine with an accuracy of 1 degree, pretty neat. I took off 2 stars because I don't think 2 years life for this product is durable. Usage wise, its very simple to use and settings are quite easy to update.As far as the installation is concerned, I just replaced the top unit. Kept the rear unit that is attached and screwed to the wall as it is since the sensor is in top unit. Took me about 5 minutes maximum to install, quite straight forward.

title: Works great
author: Brian A. Carter
info_3: I bought this to replace a White-Rodgers non-programmable thermostat (it looks like this one: [...] This product is a fine replacement.I bought my house with an 80% efficiency gas heater installed (Trane, around 7 years old), but no air conditioning. Around a month ago, I had air conditioning installed (Carrier). The non-programmable thermostat became a bit annoying because it got too hot during the day and too cold at night, depending which direction I changed the temperature.I took a look at the old White-Rodgers thermostat and had the following connections: white to W, red to RH, a red jumper from RH to RC, blue to C, green to G, and yellow to Y. (A very good reference for what those all mean is [...]The Honeywell unit does not have an RH terminal, only an R and an RC. I assume R, RH, and RC are all the same (at least in this situation), but not wanting to start a fire or something, I called the customer support number and was incredibly surprised to find that the person I spoke with was actually able to help me.Turns out--and please don't blame me if it breaks your system--that red goes to R on the new unit and the jumper between R and RC (there by default) remains in place.Minor annoyance: the Honeywell *requires* batteries. The White-Rodgers unit operated without batteries (the person I spoke to told me the blue wire, C, supplies power). Since the Honeywell doesn't take a C connection, it must run on batteries. (Hopefully they last a couple of months at least.)My final connections: white to W, red to R, jumper from R to RC, green to G, and yellow to Y.One more minor annoyance: you'll need an incredibly tiny flathead screwdriver to tighten the terminal connections. If you have an eyeglass screwdriver or similar (and know where it is), you'll be fine.Otherwise, I'm very happy with the unit and Honeywell's phone support.

title: Love to set it and forget it!
author: SaipanRick
info_3: I sure needed this to keep from having to visit the thermostat several times a day to change the settings. Now I set it and forget it. Price and delivery are awesome as well. I'd recommend this to anyone!

title: quick install, easy programming
author: TMG_FL
info_3: Sooo I will start this off with that I, a single 30's something, thought this might be a nightmare or complicated. It would have been if I did not have a set of very small screw drivers. I also shut off both the inside and outside AC power. My original thermostat was very old mercury one that never showed an accurate temp and the old one had three pieces and this new one has two. So the middle piece had these wires and I thought blue and tan were not in theinstructions but I popped that off to get to the real wires.Luckily for me the original screws holes lined up to the holes in the new unit.It was easy to attach to the wall, the wires lined up just as it said, and the face plate went on easily. Quick and easy programing. All in all took less than 20 minutes to put in. And a few minutes to set up the programing.

title: IT WORKED FINE, may have just been a sluggish dip switch ...
author: C.Daigle
info_3: Product works as advertised.  When I initially installed mine, the Heat pump / Conventional dip switch was correctly set, but I could not get the unit to function in AUTO mode.  After troubleshooting my fan unit for an hour and finding no issues, I toggled the dip switch 4 or 5 times and then retested.  IT WORKED FINE, may have just been a sluggish dip switch on my unit, but keep this in mind if you have any issues upon install of your product.  Currently works great, and is nice to have weekday and weekend plans that you can adjust to your schedule and needs.

title: It works for keeping a good temperature for each set of programmings and worked exactly ...
author: ryan broussard
info_3: I ended up not using this but we did give it to someone else that used it. I helped him install this and it worked on the first boot. We had no problems with the install. It works for keeping a good temperature for each set of programmings and worked exactly as expected. Good product and the install went easy. We did have to look up instructions online to make sure it was correct. Otherwise I have no complaints.

title: They serve my needs and look good. No issues
author: jaerick
info_3: I bought 4 of these as I installed a new heating system in my house.  I installed baseboard hydro radiant from the oil-fired boiler.  They serve my needs and look good.  No issues.

title: I enjoy how easy this product is to program
author: 30/M/Ohio
info_3: First Impressions: This is the second one of these that I have installed and have been using them in multiple houses for yearsThe Good: Great, Quality Thermostat- Easy to program and a decent price ( a bit high IMO)The Bad: Price is a bit higher than it should/could beWould I purchase this item again: Yes

title: Easy install and works like a charm!
author: Brooke G.
info_3: I installed one of these to combat high electricity prices. The programmable feature is awesome, because I don't have to think about whether or not I turned the heat/air down/up after I leave for work. Installation was a breeze, taking only about 10 minutes, if that.

title: Small but very nice thermostat.
author: Amdroid007
info_3: Excellent thermostat. Installation was a breeze - connectors are big and easy to attach. It was almost a snap on replacement for my older thermostat - the holes for the old backplate actually worked out fine, so I did not even have to drill new holes. My furnace was giving me a lot of issues before, and I thought before calling the tech, I would try this simple fix that I can do without even touching the furnace, and it worked! Keeping my fingers crossed, but looks like the thermostat was the issue since it has been running flawlessly since the installation. Whew.Its fairly easy to program - my only gripe will be that the batteries are a little hard to replace - it uses AAA batteries, and you have to snap out the thermostat to replace them since the battery compartment is in the back of the thermostat, unlike my old one which had the batteries right in front.

title: Batteries NOT included. Still too complicated for some people.
author: WL
info_3: This is the simplest unit that I could find that included a backlight. Unfortunately, it is still too complex for my in-laws to understand fully. Ideally they'd have a thermostat with two controls: heat/cool and temperature setting. Here's the problem: They'll try to set a temperature by pushing the up/down arrows, but then the programming will override it at a later time. I haven't convinced them to push the 'HOLD' button yet (which would do the trick.)I replaced an existing thermostat with this unit. It was a very simple procedure involving only a screwdriver. I did not have batteries readily available so I had to scrounge from a remote control.Programming the unit is straightforward. The backlight is a nice feature to have for nighttime adjustments.

title: An inexpensive way to save money on heating bills.
author: hitchicken
info_3: Thanks to the other reviewers who explained how to wire this device when you only have a 2 wire (old fashion mercury switch) system.It worked exactly as advertised.  Installation was quick and easy although the hole in the wall left by my old bulky thermostat required patching.  Read the instructions, the set up is simple and straightforward.  Please note: I only used this thermostat on my heating system.  I am seeing savings on my fuel oil bill, but it's been too soon to know if this can continue to be expected.  It might be the weather or measurement errors.  In any case, I will monitor and report any change in updates.  Savings?  TBDGreat thermostat.  Easy to use and program.  Highly recommended to those who do not already have programmable thermostats for their heating systems.  A great value.

title: When you don't have a "C" wire present in the ...
author: Rprowley
info_3: When you don't have a "C" wire present in the thermostat wiring its solves the problem.  The thermostat is operated by 2-aaa batteries and will control heating, cooling, and

title: If you are on a time of day usage plan like me.
author: azdevilette
info_3: Wanted an inexpensive and programmable thermostat to turn my AC unit on/off at specified times because of the energy savings plan I'm signed up on.  It will start/stop EXACTLY at the time you set up  (ie. turn off at 1 PM...AC turns off, turn back on at 5 PM...turns back on).  Most of the fancy new thermostats, while much prettier and more options...will run at times you don't want so your house will be at your desired temperature at the specific time you indicate.  If you are on a time of day usage plan like me...this thermostat is the solution.  BTW, I live in Arizona (hence the AC being my main concern) and my highest energy bill for a 2 story house is less than $135...and that's during the hottest part of the year.

title: Good value but very un-intuitive to use.
author: M. Hamilton
info_3: Cute, small, relatively inexpensive, easy to install. Cons: incomprehensible unless you keep the manual pasted right next to it. Not intuitive at all.

title: So far, so good!
author: p
info_3: This was very easy to install (I was worried, I'm not the most confident or talented handyman). The instructions were easy to read and understand and total install time took me 30 minutes.I like that it has a five-minute delay built in before it starts up again if you try to turn the air back on immediately after it went off. This apparently helps ave your compressor which sounds good to me.Programming was easy and very similar to my old unit. You just hit the SET key as many times as you need to select the proper thing to change then use the arrow keys. Easy.You can select Mon-Fri and then Sat/Sun to set the temp for them. You can't select individual days, just "Weekdays" and "Weekend" to set a program. (I knew this going in, my old one was this way and that is fine, I just wanted to make sure the average buyer had clarity on this.The only negative I have is that the screen is very hard to see when the backlight isn't on. Even with a bright hall light I can't read it without the green backlight. You only have to push any button for it to light up (this first button press doesn't change a setting, it just "wakes up" the light on the screen) so it isn't a huge hassle, and I suspect that is the quality of the screen to expect on a "budget" unit.. Once the light is on it is very easy to read the display.Nothing fancy, but I didn't need fancy for a ~$30 thermostat. It does the job with no frills and a low price.

title: Easy to install!
author: Allie L.
info_3: Our heat stopped working one night and we were tired of waking up freezing and not knowing the problem. I ordered this Honeywell thermostat and was able to install it myself while my husband was at work. This fixed our problem! EASY TO INSTALL!

title: Works well, especially for the price.
author: Scott
info_3: Was easy to mount and pretty straight forward to program.  Would like the LCD screen to have more contrast.  Have had it installed for about two weeks, and it seems to be working well in the Garage.

title: Very happy with this thermostat!
author: Rosie Campos
info_3: Very easy to install!  I was a little concerned because I'd never installed a thermostat before, but the provided instructions were clear.  The house we moved into had an old-style analog thermostat that was broken, and the fan kept kicking on constantly.  I switched the breaker off, and followed the instructions without an issue.  The most difficult part of the process was taking the old thermostat off, which has absolutely nothing to do with the quality of this product.The thermostat works great, maintains the temperature fine, and is very easy to operate.  The excellent price sealed the deal.  Great product!

title: I have never installed one before but the instructions were clear and easy to follow
author: Meghan
info_3: I bought this to replace a very ancient rotary thermostat. I have never installed one before but the instructions were clear and easy to follow. The programming is very easy to set and has multiple times for the days of the week and a separate program for the weekends. Great price for a good product.

title: easy to use
author: Y. li
info_3: bought two, both have some black stains on LCD screens, might be on shelf for very long time?I only have oil furnace, and there are only two wires coming out of wall, so I just inserted red and white to R, W, everything works well.Now, I just use HOLD to manually adjust temp, maybe later I will try schedules.PRO: easy to use, manual is very straightforward to understand, installing it is quite easyCON: black stains on screen, changing battery

title: Great Thermostat for the Money
author: Gem Box
info_3: Bought three of these to replace a forced hot water heating system that was on the old honeywell mercury spin dial thermostats. My wife forgets to turn down the heat when we go to bed, or if she leaves later for work so I wanted something we could set and forget.These were simple to install and setup, most of the time was spent on removing the old ones.My setup had two wires coming out of the wall, white and black. There was no fan or AC hookups. I popped them into the slots according to the directions and was up and running in about 45 minutes in all three zones.Programming is easy and I had my awake, leave, return and sleep cycle plugged in in a few minutes. Having three zones in my house is great for this as I can have the upstairs, downstairs, and family room on their own separate use cycle.

title: Excellent cheap thermostat.
author: Dennis Charles
info_3: Works great and has a lighted window when you push the up/down button which works great in a dark hall or at night.  Don't forget to change the AAA battery if it quits working.  Have not tried the programmable part since I don't need it.  I just set it at 76 for air conditioner or furnace.

title: Simple install, Accurate.
author: Christopher Todd
info_3: Easy install. Works as expected for both heat and cool. Keeps the inside temperature fairly stable. Maintains the temperature pretty accurately.

title: Your basic thermostat
author: Clint Stanger
info_3: Not super well made or fancy, but I don't think it's going to break tomorrow either. Mine came with a few spots on the screen that haven't gone away, though it doesn't affect the utility of the unit.

title: Very happy with these programmable Honeywell thermostats
author: andrey
info_3: The previous owner of my house had four different types of thermostats in each of the four zones of the house. It was driving me nuts because each one had their own unique way to program. So I did some research and this Honeywell model had a log of good reviews regarding ease of programming plus back-lighting while programming so I bought four of them for around $100.They were fairly easy to install but you have to make sure you turn off your furnace while installing them. If the display doesn't come up after you plug in the front to the mounting plate then this might be the reason.The net result is that I love them as they are easy to program and now all my zones are consistent.Nothing fancy like a Nest but very cost effective for me.

title: Poor Quality Control
author: Tony
info_3: I bought 3 of these at the same time.  All 3 are in use but suffers the same material defect/poor quality control.  All 3's LCD have dark patches at the same spot and pattern.

title: Nice replacement to the analog thermostat found as standard equipment in an RV
author: John
info_3: This unit is an effective replacement to the Coleman-Mach analog thermostat that came with my Laredo 5th wheel when it failed to operate.  I'll note that the wiring instructions work fine for matching up with the wires used in the CM with the exception that the low/high fan feature of the CM is not available on the Honeywell.  You will need to be sure to connect the "high speed" fan wire to the Honeywell for your heat and cool function.  There are "handyman" projects available on the internet for connecting a SPDT switch to the high and low fan wiring which then feeds the electrical current from the thermostat to the selected fan speed.  I don't need this so I didn't make the modification.  I really like the digital display, it is very readable and illuminates when you press any of the function buttons.  The controller is easy to operate without instructions so you can file that booklet away in your drawer.

title: Great little thermostat. Just be sure to check the switches in the back before you install it.
author: Reclutant readers mom
info_3: This has worked fine in our home. We do not program it, but adjust it ourselves for our needs. We do not use heat much in the winter with our woodstove. That said we did have one problem in which the unit would not shut off a few days after we installed it. We came home from church and our house was bout 85 degrees, in the winter!!  We tried many things to get it to work. Finally, thinking it was our heater we called a repairman. He figured out pretty quickly that there was a button we did not have switched correctly on the back of the thermostat. UGH!! 150.00 for a guy to flick a switch.  Since then. No problems.

title: You won't regret buying this. After you program it ...
author: KENNETH PYE
info_3: You won't regret buying this.After you program it to what you consider to be the ideal temperature for the various times of the day, gone are the days of moving the thermostat up and down when you realize the temperature is too hot or cold. When you leave for work you don't have to worry that you are overheating or overcooling a house that will be empty all day long.  Prior to getting home the thing automatically starts returning the temperature to what you consider the ideal so that is the temperature that greets you when you open the door.  More than pays for itself in short order. The first month after I installed it, I noticed a $25 reduction in my electric bill.

title: Works well, keeps me comfortable, saves me money!
author: J. White
info_3: Works great, easy to install. Saves me money in the summer and the winter with its improbability. Solid unit. No complaints.

title: Works great.
author: Hugh Jorgan
info_3: I bought two of these to replace older programmable units, and for the money they couldn't be better.  Easy to install and program.  They are more sensitive to the ambient room temperature than my old units, which cycles the furnace more frequently, maintaining a more consistent temperature.  If your old thermostat is smaller than this unit, I highly recommend purchasing the Honeywell 50002883-001 Coverplate to cover up the outline of the old unit.

title: Works fine. Easy to program and easy to read
author: Yitzak
info_3: Works fine.  Easy to program and easy to read.  Installation was simplified with clear to understand instructions.

title: Works great... good price!
author: H. M. Johnson III
info_3: I have a few of these in my shop for using with my RENOR gas heaters and they work great. Real easy to program!

title: Five Stars
author: Matthew McCleary
info_3: Easy fifteen-minute install and easy programming. I love the heat kicking on fifteen minutes before I wake up.

title: Good priced programmable thermostat
author: AC
info_3: I moved several months ago. Now that it's starting to get warmer, I wanted to replace my old thermostat with something programmable so I don't have to remember to adjust things before I go to work, when I go to bed, etc. This seemed to be what I was looking for at a good price. Installation was fairly easy. I did have some trouble initially since I put the red wire into the hole next to where it should have gone; but once I got everything in the right place, it started right up and has been working fine ever since.

title: I matched wiring and still couldn't get this thing to ...
author: NikoBlue
info_3: I matched wiring and still couldn't get this thing to work. Luckily my old one worked when it was reattached.

title: If you have EM heat on your current thermostat this one will not work for you. But it is really nice.
author: PeoplePhobic
info_3: If your current thermostat has a Emergency Heat setting (em heat) you have a multi-stage system and this single stage thermostat will not work for you. Or, it will work but you will lose that stage. I did not know this when I ordered this so I thought I would share this in my review as it is the simplest way to know whether or not it will work for your system.Great item and great price. I did not install because I have a multistage system and this thermostat is single. The wires go straight into the back so you don't have to worry about rolling loops in them. I would have really liked this thermostat but I ended up having to get a multistage one.

title: Works perfect, easy to install
author: Rachelle Mohler
info_3: Very easy to install.  Had never done it before, watched a youtube video and complete.  Works like a charm

title: Seems to work fine, but I accidentally touched the screen and now ...
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Seems to work fine, but I accidentally touched the screen and now there are some very weak pixels there (not quite dead, but definitely grayish).

title: Nice unit. Easy to program and install
author: EHawk80
info_3: Nice unit. Easy to program and install. The slots in the back are labeled so you can tell which color wire goes into which slot.

title: i assume there was a bad batch. It doesnt effect performance and I can ...
author: J. Jankowski
info_3: Programming Is straight forward and it operates as expected. Installation might be confusing based on your HVAC setup. The display has some distortion to it. I had the item exchanged and the same distortion is present in the lower right hand corner of the display. See attached photos. Considering it was on both displays, i assume there was a bad batch. It doesnt effect performance and I can live with the cosmetic defect.

title: Works great, easy to install
author: Nicole
info_3: I had debated buying a programmable thermostat for quite some time. I don't know anything about the installation of thermostats, so I took a leap of faith and trusted the reviews that said it was easy to install. They were true. It explained everything very clearly and even provided little stickers so you could keep track of which wires went where when you uninstalled your old thermostat.Once you get it installed, it's just as easy to set up. If you don't like the schedule you've created, it takes only a few seconds to change it. I just love this thing. It has saved us money while still keeping us warm all winter. No more mornings of getting out of bed to a freezing cold house. We can lower the temperature while we sleep to keep costs down, but it's toasty when we get up! I can't recommend this thing enough.

title: LCD Display Backlight is defective
author: C. Cox
info_3: The thermostat runs fine,  it's great.  The issue I have is with the display.  Like many, many, other reviewers I received a unit with a black smudge in the bottom right hand corner that is only shown when the backlight is illuminated.  I went to Walmart to get a new one, installed it, and saw it has the exact same issue.  The complaints about this issue go back several years, and still they're being manufactured with this defect.  Pretty dissatisfied over here.

title: A Programmable Lighted Honeywell Thermostat
author: Wade Howard
info_3: I purchased this Honeywell to replace a new Honeywell that didn't have a light - my mistake. We love this thermostat! It has a lot of features that we don't use. Our schedule was too hectic to program our daily use, so we decided to use it manually. The way this is done is by placing the unit on "Hold", which is easy to do. By placing the unit on "Hold", all the programing is on hold. We just use it manually, and it works great! It does display "Hold" in small letters all the time, but this doesn't really bother me. It would have been nice to be able to choose "No programming" or "Programming". Anyway, it works great, and we Love the Light feature! Every year or so, we have to replace the two AAA batteries, and the unit lets you know when they are getting low. Very nice unit!

title: It operates off 2 AAA batteries which it did not come with and I noticed some pretty heavy defects in the lower corner of the lc
author: David D.
info_3: Received in the mail today. Took about 25 minutes to remove the old mercury filled thermostat and install this new one. I still have to program it for the different days but didn't have time on my lunch break.It operates off 2 AAA batteries which it did not come with and I noticed some pretty heavy defects in the lower corner of the lcd display which is the reason for my 3 starsAlso, the screws that secure the different lines that connect, are as small as screws used on sun glasses. I had to use a pocket knife to screw each one in. This sized flathead screw is not something in everyone's toolbox and I feel this should have been part of the kit.

title: Great product. Switch on the back for use with ...
author: arrrrr
info_3: Great product. Switch on the back for use with either gas or electric heat. Easy to program. Only problem is when using this to adjust temperature in a garage in a cold climate where you may not always be heating, if the temperature drops below 32, the unit simply reads LOW and will not call for heat until the temperature rises above 32 deg. Select-able temperature range is 40F-90F for heat and 50F-99F for AC.

title: Hold Temp Well, Easy To Install and Operate
author: Gary H
info_3: These are great devices especially if you have hot water baseboard heat. Why? They have a setting for hot water heat, lets the boiler run a bit longer for fewer periods in an hour. Of course, there are settings for forced air, etc, but for me, I have three zones of hot water and wanted a thermostat that would optimize the cycling of the boiler. This one does.Easy to install, looks good, easy to program, accurate in reaching and holding temperature.Nothing fancy, but it does exactly what I wanted with no frills.

title: Exactly as described.
author: Mangobel
info_3: Good, easy to use thermostats.  I bought 2 of them.  I had to get them professionally installed because I was changing them from 2 old style thermostats and was not sure how to turn the power off, but also whether the old ones were high voltage.I like that they are easy to read and pretty simple to program.I don't like that they do not come with the batteries - luckily I had some laying around (2 AAA batteries).  I also am not fond that only the room temperature displays.  To see the set temperature, you need to press a button.  Not a big deal, and worth the price.  I would not pay extra for those features, but it's something to note.

title: Simple and effective
author: nuffer
info_3: Very simple installation, works great in ajusting temps and controlling heating costs

title: Easy, Affordable, Works Great
author: leek
info_3: First time home owner, know nothing about this stuff..I was a bit concerned about the hook up but the set up was MEGA simple and the directions are very clear, I didn't have to think what does that mean or how to do that. I purchased this unit to have the house toasty when I got home from work and it works perfectly.  I am often doing weekend trips and the set up is so easy that I can easily adjust it, the settings are very clear it really just guides you through weekday, time wake time leave, time return and time sleep and the temperature blinks like is this how warm/cool you want it at that time?  Really cool, really easy, def. recommend

title: Simple install and easy programming.
author: Glenn A. Hendricks
info_3: Easy install for a hot water system.  Programmed and in place in about 5 minutes.

title: Five Stars
author: Shorecka
info_3: Easy to install works great. The smudge people complain about is not an issue at all

title: good enough
author: ventingisok
info_3: Good price and is working well.  Replacing the old round manual.  It finally died  - why?  This replacement is working well, but this one does not cover the screw holes or the void paint spot due to its size and the wire placement.  Tiny manual slide switch on the bottom for heat/cold and fan controls are not smooth.

title: Easy to install, works great!
author: brock hall
info_3: Other reviews say this was hard to install but I don't agree at all. I don't have any sort of background or knowledge of installing these and it took me maybe 10 minutes. Works just like we expected. You can set weekdays and weekends separately so that on weekends when you're probably home during they day the temperature doesn't fluctuate. It's very helpful to us as we live in Phoenix and we can automatically set the thermostat to turn off the A/C during the day when no ones home. It saves us a ton on our bill in the hot Phoenix summers.

title: Good thermostat for a reasonable price.
author: TheWaldo
info_3: I have an auxiliary heating system that had a mechanical thermostat with just the sliders.  It was impossible to tell the real temperature from it. I bought this to have more precise control over the temperature.  The installation was simple, the required adjustments likewise and now  I can set the temperature precisely where I want it.The price was fair and the quality seems to be excellent.I would not hesitate to buy this brand again if needed.

title: Keep batteries on hand
author: LIDeb
info_3: Has worked well with one exception.  When battery dies, you lose ability to control thermostat.  My old Honeywell thermostat only ceased showing the backlight.  This one ceases displaying period.

title: Nice thermostat
author: Karen
info_3: Easy to install and program.  Instruction book leaves a little to be desired, but youtube instructions for installation popped right up and that's all it took.

title: Nice effective thermostat
author: Anthony
info_3: Great theromostat for the price. I program one setting for Monday-Friday when to turn on in the mornings, off when i'm away, on when im home, and off when i sleep. Then a second program for Saturday-Sunday. Easy to program and has a nice well lit screen. I use it on a gas central heater with only two wires to control it.

title: Good for the price
author: Jesse McCrostie
info_3: It's a good little thermostat at a decent price point.  I replaced an ancient honeywell thermostat on my wall with the same feature set.  My main issue with this thermostat is the backlighting.  There are marks on the display that you only see when the backlight is lit.  I took it apart to see if it was just dirty somehow, even though I bought it brand new.  I believe I could see where the marks were coming from.  The clear, ridged piece of plastic that holds the display in has uneven ridges in the corner where I see the marks.  But there is nothing I can do about it.  Just poor QC from the factory.  But for the low price I paid, and the fact that it does function properly otherwise, I didn't feel like dealing with replacing it.  It works well enough.

title: Gas fireplace
author: Normal consumer
info_3: Looking for replacement for gas fireplace thermostat with basic time and temp control.  This work perfectly and was simple to install.  It's actually had more time setting than I actually need.

title: T Stat for the house
author: James K. Hardy
info_3: Keeps temperature within 1 degree. Great back light to see whats set

title: I'd have to say that these were very easy to install
author: Christopher M.
info_3: I've never replaced a thermostat before and rarely do any home repairs myself, but I was able to replace six very old units in my house with these without resorting to calling Honeywell for help. So, I'd have to say that these were very easy to install. I first bought one at Home Depot to be sure I could get it to work. When it worked fine, I ordered 5 from Amazon. The order from Amazon even came with batteries. Very pleased with the speed of delivery and the quality of the product.

title: Working well
author: JHB
info_3: Working well, after a setup/wiring issue during installation.  The installation instructions only reference wire labels, and not wire colors.  Unfortunately, neither my wiring or the old thermostats were labeled, and my *assumption* about wire color corresponding to terminal lettering was incorrect.  A call to tech support the next day (obviously an overseas call center) got me straightened out.Hope to see a reduction in my heating oil consumption after this upgrade.

title: One Star
author: KT
info_3: Was working perfectly first two days and then no response at all.

title: Excellent quality! Poor design.
author: nusaco888
info_3: Works great without any issue.Just hope the warm/cool switch can be better designed and easier to read.

title: Simple, works great with our fireplace
author: Christine Reynaert
info_3: Simple, works great with our fireplace.  Easy and quick to install and program.  Supports mili-volt

title: One of the better ones I've used.
author: J. Rebello
info_3: Very quick and easy to install (even for a luddite like me) and gets the job done.  Temperature is also accurate.

title: Lasted ONLY 3 months
author: Justin T.
info_3: This lasted 3 months before it completely stopped working.

title: Five Stars
author: Amiee
info_3: Exactly as described, and exactly what I expected. Thanks!

title: What's to say? I installed it in my shop ...
author: JPC
info_3: What's to say?  I installed it in my shop, programmed without difficulty, and it's been working flawlessly.

title: Five Stars
author: Richard H. Sweet
info_3: Quite versatile and easy to set. No trouble installing.

title: Easy to install and program!
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: I just installed this myself and was so pleased at how easy it was! The thermostat works well and was easy to program. Such an affordable upgrade!My house, built in 1920, has plaster walls so I wasn't able to install it into the wall with the enclosed screws and anchors. Instead I used sticky Velcro dots, stuck to the back of the unit and the wall. It works perfectly.

title: Easy to install, lights up great, only needs two double A batteries
author: Jaric Fontaine
info_3: My wife and I were able to install three of these easily. We had a simple red white wire connection and fit them on easily. It was easy to program it. I wish it was able to be programmed daily but it's in M-F sequences and a Saturday and Sunday. Luckily I work M-F and so doesn't my wife but for those that don't you might not find it's programmable feature that useful.It's back lit a nice bright green when the thermostat is raised or lowered, and it is very easy to see in the dark. I always used to have to find a light to turn on, if I wanted to raise or lower the heat but I don't have to do that anymore.I like how it only needs two triple A batteries, so it's not an energy hog. It's a good thermostat.

title: Excellent Thermostat
author: Stephanie Conrad
info_3: I recently moved my little art studio into a new shop and discovered that the thermostat in this older building must now be worth some money in an antique shop. It was absolutely unusable, so we immediately ordered a new one to replace it. This thermostat arrived quickly, was incredibly easy to install and has done a great job since we set it up. It was very affordable and definitely a great purchase.

title: Terrible quality control
author: Sebastian Xavier
info_3: It basically works as described, and is easy to install, but like other reviews have noted there is an ugly fingerprint on the display. That is absolutely ridiculous QA. It would cost them next to nothing to make assemblers wear latex gloves and actually inspect the product before shipping.

title: Great programmable thermostat
author: CCinAZ
info_3: I use five of these and they are great.  Easy to program

title: Decent no frills thermostat.
author: MDL
info_3: Decent no frills thermostat. Installed this myself as a replacement for a thermostat that was damaged during moving. Has the 5 week day programming and a separate 2 day setup. Its a little cumbersome to program, having to go through the menu options for each day etc to get to the other. Otherwise, after its setup there are no problems so far.

title: Four Stars
author: Anny Omys
info_3: Easy to set up. Haven't had any problems in 6 months

title: Arrived DOA
author: lpm
info_3: Came DOA. Honeywell support was non existent. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone

title: Average product, pathetic customer service.
author: QOTN
info_3: I bought this to replace a unit that we thought was broken. Turns out it was our system that had a problem. The directions aren't very clear and customer service at Honeywell is useless...complete morons that don't know the products or listen well enough to know what your actual problem is. Once we figured it out it was fine.  I just don't like that the screen can only show you what the temp actual is or what it's set at, but not both at the same time.

title: Works for me
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: It works okay, but is very complex to set up...

title: A nice simple product
author: James S. Whitcraft
info_3: This is exactly as advertised. Simple to install, though you may have to repaint your wall, a easy to program.  It also fixed a problem I had with the old thermostat where it would turn the furnace right back on after stopping. I haven't tried the AC. Will advise if there is a problem.

title: Five Stars
author: tdi_trainer
info_3: Works great, easy to install, easy to use.

title: Works great!
author: DRH
info_3: works great, priced great.  No complaints

title: Honeywell RTH2300B1012/E1 5-2... Honeywell International
author: Dalyn Kriesman
info_3: Very very disappointed I hired an electrician to install properly and once installed if failed to  work correctly.  Lights displayed time and temperature but it would not turn my unit on Electrician said it was faulty thermostat .  Good to schedule time for installation and now I ended up spending more money in purchasing another thermostat

title: Five Stars
author: silvermyr
info_3: This is really working well. installed in 2 minutes with old 2 wire system.

title: Works Great
author: Brad K.
info_3: We went from a 1 week programmable to this 5-2. With my wife at home this year it's not what we need, but when she goes back to work it will be a lifesaver on the weekends.This was a fairly easy install. I didn't read all the directions, but make sure you turn your system off before installing. Otherwise you might kick it on while installing this new unit. It is considerably smaller than I thought it would be, but overall I'm happy.

title: Great product and price!
author: J. Porter
info_3: Great product and price! Very pleased!

title: Five Stars
author: Norman V.
info_3: Really easy to install and work great.

title: Simple to install, setup & use. Lacks advanced features.
author: J. Stanton
info_3: We live in coastal Southern California and only have a natural gas forced air furnace that doesn't get used much. The RTH2300B replaced an old mercury filled thermostat that was constantly short-cycling the furnace. Install was quick, just mount, connect the 2 wires (Red/White), select Heat and that's about it. You can use or change the 5/2 day program (four time zones each) or use it as a regular thermostat with the Hold feature. Very simple, very basic but functions well.Pros: - Accurate temperature display, +/- 1F or 0.5C - Easy to read LCD display without enabling the backlight (can be enabled for 12 secs by pressing any key) - Quick Install. Two screws with included wall anchors. Small footprint. - Simple to program. Includes default heating/cooling profiles - Compressor protection and Heat cycle rate controlCons: - Limited advanced menu control (can't set temp swing, etc) - No option to power from system power ('C' wire), must use 2 AAA batteries - LCD display has some "ink smudges" which are visible when backlight is enabled. - Max/Min temp range is limited (90F cool, 40F heat)

title: DO NOT buy this if you have a heat pump!
author: Angela D
info_3: I bought this and didn't read the fine print... it's not for HVACs with a heat pump!!  I didn't know what kind of HVAC I had or why it would matter when it came to a thermostat. All I knew was that mine looked like the original thermostat from the early 80's.  So I bought it.  Installation was easy.  I heard a "pop" and then nothing.  I could not get the AC to work.  So, I put the original back on.  Still nothing.  $200 later and a visit from an HVAC repairman, my AC was working once again.  It blew the transformer.  Note to self:  Next time, buy the right one.  Amazon was awesome and allowed me to return it. That's why they keep getting my business.

title: Savings With 'Peace of Mind'
author: Andrew J DePalma
info_3: My heating and cooling bills will definitely go down now that I have this programmable thermostat. When I get into bed on a winter's night I don't have to worry that I forgot to turn the heat down. When I get out of bed in the morning, the house is warming up because that's the way I set the 'stat'. When I go away for a few days, I set the temperature where I want it and press "hold". It will hold until I change it when I get back. I love it. It provides great 'peace of mind' and it's easy and quick to install and program, really. I'm buying one for my ex-wife because I still love her and I know she'll like it and benefit from it. Of course, I'll program it according to her specifications. :-)

title: Four Stars
author: Greg W.
info_3: This has worked just fine for over a year now.

title: Terrible at keeping a set tempurature, get what you pay for.
author: LaLunaTrevor
info_3: The only reason im giving it 2 stars instead of one is because it was inexpensive. This thermostat does not keep the tempurature well regulated. I purchassed this to replace the only analog dial looking one that was on the wall, and so far wish i hadnt. It is fairly easy to get set up and to program, but the thing just turns on and off the heat whenever the heck it feels like it. For example: i may have it programmed to just stay at 70 degrees all the time, and it may be 60 degrees in the house and you cannot get it to turn on the heat, then other times when the heat is running it will keep the heat at 78 degrees for several hours and wont turn the heaters off!Im assuming unless all 3 i got (2 from Aamzon one from Walmart) of the same exact model are all lemons that it is just terrible, because all 3 zones that i have in my house are doing the same thing.

title: Good cheap easy to use Thermostat.
author: BB
info_3: Good cheap easy to use Thermostat.

title: Didn't work for me
author: NULL
info_3: I have a heat pump and was unable to use since it was not compatible.

title: Five Stars
author: M
info_3: easy to install and works well

title: Four Stars
author: bigdatamark
info_3: Easy to install, and works great. Lights up by pressing any button, to read at night.

title: Easy install and works like it is supposed to
author: Doctor J
info_3: The installation only took about 10 minutes. There were instructions about whether you used a fan blower or not and it determined whether or not flipped a switch in the back. I thought that was a bit confusing, but it didn't seem to matter. I tried both switches and it still worked. The programming is pretty straightforward. You have to toggle through each day of the week, so it should be easy for most people to learn. The only thing I don't like about it is that when the A/C or furnace is activated, I heard a reasonably loud "click" from the thermostat. The is my first replacement thermostat, so I'm not sure if this is normal. The original one did not do that. It makes me wonder if I installed this incorrectly. Otherwise, it works great.

title: Five Stars
author: shopper
info_3: Easy to install and program

title: Worked well upon receipt. When I tried to take ...
author: Kelbatyrov Klan
info_3: Worked well upon receipt. When I tried to take off the back mounting plate, it was really difficult to remove. I managed to remove it, but the circuit board came out, and the LCD screen came off. It is all put together by snap points. It is not a complicated construction, so I was able to put it back together, but I was irritated that this happened. Now there is a little dark spot on the LCD screen. It is not very noticeable so I kept it.

title: Five Stars
author: Starlet D. Bass-Coleman
info_3: easy to set up and works great so far..

title: Cold on the outside, warmy on the inside!
author: squinja7000
info_3: Easy to install and comes complete with mounting hardware. It's much smaller than assumed and has a very small backlit screen. Every electronic item seems to get smaller, so that's just the way it is. Controls are relatively easy to use and programming took a little trial and error to get it right. Great price and works very well :)

title: Simple UI means more items to cycle through
author: BILL WU
info_3: This replaces a 20 year old Honeywell programmable thermostat whose plastic housing was breaking down and the LCD display started flaking out but was otherwise working perfectly.  This unit appears solid, but with fewer buttons, which is both more simplistic and slightly annoying at times, compared to the old unit which can go to the specific program / day with at most a couple button presses, this one requires cycling through time set and every programmed time / temperature.  But that's really the only downside, but I think most of them are this way now, it is "simpler".

title: Defective!!
author: EB
info_3: I was looking for a user-friendly programmable thermostat for my parents to replace their manual unit, so I decided on this one. Unfortunately, the one I received was defective. The motherboard was covered with a putty-like substance. Unsure if this would affect its functionality, I returned it. But, for what it's worth, this model looks nice.

title: Works as advertised.
author: Crazy Critter Lady
info_3: Not too difficult to program, easy to install (even for non-professional and very unsure fix-it folks like myself).  Great for programming air conditioning to start just before you arrive home from work.

title: Be Careful buying this item, make super sure it will work with your system and not damage it
author: Timothy Hightower
info_3: Caused damage to my unit, had to have repair man come out on week end at time and half, big mistake for the heatpump system that requires a common connection, burned out a fuse and transformer, under $30.00 item costing upwards $350.00. Tech support useless

title: Turns on for no reason
author: Alli Marie
info_3: During the winter I loved it. Right now not so much. I turned it on and set it to hold at 55 (night presets are also 55) a few nights ago because it was very cold  here. Well then a heat wave hit and house finally dipped below 80 not any flippen more heat kicked on and  stayed on till it was 82. None of our presets or anything ever go above 69. What a screwed up glitch.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: very easy to operate

title: During installation used the default setting of 5 heating cycles per hour which is the recommended setting for this type of furn
author: Mel 45
info_3: Thermostat would consistently overshoot or undershoot the set point temperature by 3 degrees.  My heating system is forced air oil with a two wire 24 VAC control circuit connected to the R and W terminals of the thermostat.  Prior thermostat was a similar Honeywell electronic thermostat, but without the setback feature which always controlled the temperature right at set point.  During installation used the default setting of 5 heating cycles per hour which is the recommended setting for this type of furnace.  After a week of consistently poor temperature control (gave it a week in case it had to ?œlearn??something in order to work properly) tried heating cycle per hour settings at the lowest (2) and highest (6), but it had no effect on the consistently poor temperature control.  Suspect this particular thermostat was defective and would have returned to Amazon to try another, but all packaging materials were accidentally thrown away.  Not too upset since this thermostat is remarkably inexpensive.  Switched back to the old thermostat which continues to work well, but without the setback function.

title: I ordered a second one and will soon order a third for my garage.
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Works great for me.

title: Easy to use. Looks great.
author: Richard Parian
info_3: Easy to program. Looks great.  I have notice this in many a business so I figured if HVAC are using these they must have some value.  Sure enough it works perfectly.

title: never have to worrie about when i need to turn ...
author: kevinZ
info_3: never have to worrie about when i need to turn on and off my heat manually, it will just control the heat temperture for me

title: These were terrible. It would sense one degree in the temperature ...
author: Russ D.
info_3: These were terrible.  It would sense one degree in the temperature and kick the heat on every time, it made my bill higher!

title: Works as expected
author: Milton Yee
info_3: This is OK.  I noticed my furnace seems to cycle on and off more frequently.  When I was using my old mercury thermostat, the furnace would stay on for a while before turning off. This caused the temperature to go a few degrees higher than the settingWith this thermostat, if the temperature drops by a degree from the setting, then it would turn on the furnace and vice versa. This is great if you want your house to be at a certain temperature, but I'm concerned about the longevity of my furnace.  I think more cycling will reduce life of furnace.

title: Five Stars
author: Bobby Sturgill
info_3: The best I have used

title: Five Stars
author: jdt906
info_3: Works well and really easy to install

title: Perfect  for me need
author: Robert L. Schwartz
info_3: Easy to install and works great!

title: Who needs WiFi?
author: L. Guarino
info_3: I bought 2 ( one for each zone)  for less than the price of one wi-fi enabled unit. Not gone from home that often to warrant adjusting the temperature via smartphone (nor that lazy to get out of chair to adjust temporarily).  Plus I didn't need to re-wire for C-wire power. Runs great off 2 AA batteries included.

title: THERMOSTAT
author: T-man
info_3: EASY TO USE

title: Five Stars
author: Dave
info_3: Work well.

title: I would definitely recommend this product
author: JFred
info_3: I would definitely recommend this product.  Even after dropping the product once I took it out of the package (oops!) it survived and was easy to install.  It is easy to program and you can adjust the temperature depending on the time of the day, such as when you are at work, so your furnace or AC are not working full blast at all times.

title: Five Stars
author: MLNORDERS
info_3: Worked well

title: Five Stars
author: T. G. Edwards
info_3: Product was as expected.

title: Nice to program when the heat turns on so my ...
author: Lauralyn Baughn
info_3: Installed in my several of my camp trailers (no AC) and also in my apartment. Nice to program when the heat turns on so my wife doesn't have to mess with it when camping, or for tenants that like to waste energy.

title: It worked for 1 year and 5 days from the ...
author: pitstaff10
info_3: It worked for 1 year and 5 days from the date I ordered it and failed today, just out of warranty. The fan was controllable but the furnace was not and was coming on every few minutes even though the room temperature was above the set point. So I guess I won't be buying a Honeywell product this next time

title: Four Stars
author: Paul
info_3: Nice cheap thermostat. Works just like it should. Fairly easy programming.

title: Five Stars
author: Gloveman
info_3: Works great

title: Do not buy any Honeywell trhermostats, no product help availavle from Honeywell. Their 800 help number is a joke!!
author: Fred G.
info_3: Needed help with wiring, called Honeywell 800-468-1502 for two days, only got message, Overload calls,  try again later. Two days of this,. and no help!! I was close to returning thermostat to Amazon, but fourth guess as to wiring, got unit to work.Honeywell help is a joke!!

title: Easy setup, nice simple operation....
author: James S
info_3: I used to have to turn on a light to see my old thermostat and I wanted a new programmable with a back light and this one is great..... This baby does what it suppose to do...it has weekday and weekend settings and is easy to install and operate.....it comes with labels for you to label your wires if not labeled already..it has a terminal block with set screws which makes it very easy to attach your wires...runs on a AAA battery which is easy to replace with just snapping the unit off the mounting plate..... the temp number is nice and big for easy reading.... the day and temp settings are easy to set.....I found the instructions easy to follow  though I have an electrical background.

title: I love this thermostat!
author: R. Hegeman
info_3: I installed my first on 1 of our 3 heating zones and liked it so much I quickly bought 2 more.  Very easy to install, and the simple programming matches that of our A/C thermostat, a plus.  Four time periods (wake, leave, return and sleep) for both M-F and S-S provide lots of flexibility in temperature settings. Plus, if necessary, you can make temporary and/or permanent adjustments to the normal program. I even like the backlit digital display... no more need for a flashlight to check the setting or current temperature. With our night and "away" times cranked down 5 or more degrees, I'm looking forward to saving some fuel oil.

title: Five Stars
author: JP
info_3: On time as advertised. Works well.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: works  for us

title: Good product
author: Valued Customer
info_3: I bought this to replace an old round thermostat that ran my gas furnace and central air conditioner. Installation was easy and took less than ten minutes. Programming and operation are easy. Would buy again.

title: Easy installation. Allows you to program different settings for ...
author: Steven Airoldi
info_3: Easy installation.  Allows you to program different settings for weekdays and weekends.

title: Very good purchase
author: james hickey
info_3: Very easy to set up, I did call the 800# to make sure I was making the right connections and they were extremely helpful. I would definitely buy again.

title: This is a good one for the price
author: dkc
info_3: This works. It was fairly easy to install. Of course, the wiring diagrams in the puny instructions didn't fit my current installation but I figured that would happen. Its never quite that simple. It didn't take too much to figure it out. I only had to re-wire it once to get it to work. Once you hook it up right it works real good. The programmable features are all you need. You can read about them in the description so I won't reiterate here but I will say it works really nice. A big improvement over the crap I had. A good investment. It will pay for itself.

title: Works great if you read the directions!
author: Ladybird
info_3: When the directions say AND for the two wires it means that.. don't remove the jumper unless you have both wires needing to be connected.  I thought it meant to remove it if you only had one.. well once I set the jumper back in my unit worked! Wahoo!  Very easy to program.

title: Good price!
author: Brian S.
info_3: The instructions were super easy to install, took maybe 15 minutes.  Followed the recommended programming for now, it's too early to see a change on the energy bill but I'm sure it will help.  If anything I don't have to rely on my memory to set the temp when I leave anymore!  Different settings for weekends are a big help since I only work M-F and am home much more on Saturday and Sunday.

title: Easy installation
author: Kelly812
info_3: We are not electrical savvy in our house, but this was a breeze.  Installation took about 20 minutes maybe less and it works flawlessly.  Love the light up display as I am often making last minute adjustments on my way to bed.  You can use the program mode or if you want to leave it on a temp if you are going out of town you can just set the temp and press hold and it will stay at the desired temp until you change a setting.  I replaced an old thermostat that was not digital and drove me crazy because I couldn't chose the temp I wanted.  Much happier now.

title: Thermostat
author: Morgan Porter
info_3: Works great and right on the money as far as the temperature is concerned. Thanks

title: Money Saver
author: Amanda Brady
info_3: This was easy to install (my husband did it, and he's semi handy) and I love the display. I can see exactly what I've set my temperature to and get a reading of the current temperature in my house. My only qualm is that I've tried numerous times to use the programmer, and I've never done it right. I find it confusing, and just when I think I have it set, I didn't do it correctly. So now I just set it when I'm coming and going. I've saved a lot of money going from a dial to digital, as I can determine the exact temperature.

title: Never worked
author: Gbg-usa-inc
info_3: Had a delay in my renovations so when I finally got around to installing this thermostat it didn't work (blank screen) and it was too late to get a refund/exchange. I'm assuming this was due to poor quality.

title: It seemed to work pretty good. Relatively easy to install and program
author: Monica N Treadway
info_3: It seemed to work pretty good. Relatively easy to install and program, but it died today after less than 2 years of use.

title: Excellent thermostat
author: Farley X Wilbur
info_3: I already have owned another of the exact same thermostats located in one of my other buildings. (I have 4 on my farm.)

title: Great product for the price
author: Mr.E
info_3: Great product. With a quick review of the instruction manual it is very easy to install and program. A great tool for improving your AC efficiency and energy  use during the summer and winter. Only gripe is that the 'on/off/auto' switch (I often turn it off entirely when I'm out or away for extended periods of time) is underneath and not the easiest to flip. A small issue compared to how well the rest works. Note: this is a horizontal mounting setup. As such, if you are replacing an older vertical rectangle setup, you will have to fill holes or paint over the old outline.

title: Three Stars
author: Ken
info_3: Good in general though still has the lcd blemish/dark area that others have shown.

title: Nice product
author: John Smith
info_3: Works great.  Very pleased with it.  Installed easily.

title: Easy
author: A. Kindred
info_3: Super easy to install and program. Love it

title: Basic, minor quality issues
author: Ian Nelson
info_3: Very basic thermostat that gets the job done. Instructions are straight forward.I was lucky to have a common type of system with color coded wires. So wiring it was just matching colors to letters.Taking one star off because it appears there is a finger print on one of the internal screens from assembly. I think it's only on the piece between the LCD screen and the back light since I can only see it when the back light is on

title: Four Stars
author: Dietz
info_3: Good price

title: Five Stars
author: El Nickster
info_3: This thing has saved us a fortune in utility bills.  Our old thermostat basically didn't work.

title: Nice thermostat for the price
author: WV Mountain Mama
info_3: Easy to install, works great.  Good replacement for our old, not programmable thermostat for our boiler furnace.  This brand was recommended by our boiler maintenance person.  Hubby installed it quickly and it seems to keep the temperature more consistent than the old one.

title: Four Stars
author: New Homeowner
info_3: Easy to install.  (Make sure you have a tiny "jewelers" type screwdriver.  Programming seems to work.

title: 61 Degrees? BRRR
author: LVReader
info_3: Honeywell used to be a good brand. Not so much anymore. This lasted a week before I had to get it replaced. Got up one morning to a balmy 61 degrees. Thermostat says it's 71. Nope, and neither of those was the 68 degrees it was set for. If the replacement isn't any better, I'll find another brand.

title: Great buy
author: Gail
info_3: Works great.  Someone else installed it and he had to call support - something about the wiring but they were very helpful.  I love having it.

title: Would buy a 3rd time
author: Paul A Hinde
info_3: This is the 2nd one of these we have bought for different locations. They work quite nicely. Have never had a problem with them. Nice program-ability.

title: Five Stars
author: JEAN-CLAUDE NERETTE
info_3: Works perfect. Arrived on schedule as promised.

title: Fix the tight contacts
author: Pete In Illinois
info_3: So far so good. A hint: After opening (which is hard to do) put some petroleum jelly on your finger and wipe the contact posts with your finger. You just want to put a very lite amount of jelly on contacts. You should not be able to see the jelly on the contacts. Then close the unit and reopen a couple of time. Opening and closing the unit should now be much easier to do.

title: Works well, easy to install, buttons hard to read
author: P. Bergstrom
info_3: I installed this for an old but simple oil furnace with only 2 wires. The wires were red and white so I connected them to the R and W terminals and it works fine, with no change to the jumper. When set to 65 it comes on when the ambient falls to 64 and stays on until it reaches 67; presumably this keeps the furnace from cycling on and off too often. The screen is easy to read but the labels on the buttons on the left are quite small and hard to read. It would be nice if the display showed the set point as well as the ambient; you have to press one of the arrow buttons to see the set point.

title: Poor design
author: G. Burk
info_3: Separating the unit from the wall plate was a bitch! Then some pieces separated from the wall plate and were stuck on the unit. Piece of crap. I am returning it.

title: Would not recommend.
author: DGG
info_3: Installed unit noticed view screen had dark discoloration. Customer service was not helpful. Would not recommend.

title: works fine caution slightly smaller than one i replaced so you ...
author: Mary Ann Bailey
info_3: works fine  caution slightly smaller than one i replaced so you can see 1 screw hole in wall

title: Inexpensive and easy to program
author: VinnyD
info_3: I would have given this thermostat five stars, but they need to improve the installation instructions.  I had connected all the wires, placed the cover on, and turned back on the power as instructed.  I then read further back in the manuals about connecting the O wire if you have a heat pump.  This is important because my heat pump was pumping out heat instead of cold air.  I then had to turn off power it do the subsequent connections.  So, I highly recommend, just ready the manual all the way through before installing.

title: Doesn't Match my System, but Support was great
author: WT
info_3: I didn't realize I had a multi-stage heating system. After I installed it and it sounded like it was working (the fan was running), I went to bed. I woke up to a cold house and called the help line. They were totally nice and helpful and quickly helped me figure out I had bought something that wasn't compatible with my system and had some recommendations (both expensive and not) for a product that would fit my system. Even though the heat never worked, it was pretty easy to install and program. I've returned it and am waiting on my appropriate model.

title: easy to install, good instructions
author: PrimeQueen
info_3: I ordered this to use with our heat only furnace. I am by no means technical and this was very easy to install. The instructions were crystal clear. Easy to install for a heat only furnace and now we can save money using the programs!

title: Easy install, easy setup
author: Renzo
info_3: Easy install, easy setup. Worked great after install. After 3 days stopped working. You can hear it make a click when it's supposed to turn the heat on but nothing happens. Luckily still had my old one and had to eventually hook it back up. Very dissapointing.

title: Works great! I had an ancient thermostat in my new ...
author: Brian R Orosco
info_3: Works great! I had an ancient thermostat in my new home that worked like crap, so I bought this for simple style and operation of turning on and off the AC. I haven't gotten into programming it, but we are always home so this is easy to use. Installation was super easy. Just remember to mark your cords from the wall when replacing the old thermostat so you know which node to attach them to.

title: Four Stars
author: eli goeta
info_3: ok

title: Boo!
author: Doc
info_3: Bought this June 7 of 2015.this was the first winter using it.worked great.hell I was saving money and that's a good thing.all that changed this morning when it died.thought it was just the batteries so I changed them 3 times.nothing.I really really liked this thing but if it can't even make it 1 winter it's a 1 star.a real shame.

title: Five Stars
author: KG
info_3: works as expected

title: Works great.
author: Miss Lemon
info_3: This installed quickly and was a life-changer - helps me keep my place warm while not being wasteful.

title: Read the fine print...make sure it works for your unit.
author: JIsaacs8
info_3: We learned the hard way to read the fine print.  There are a few things you need to make sure before you make this purchase.  Read carefully the type of unit this works on.  We tried three different models and none of them worked for ours.  After returning one to Amazon and two to Wal Mart, it took a professional and $275 to replace our thermostat.  Overall though, the installation was not that bad.  We were installing it correctly, it just didn't work on our type of unit.

title: Hard to Program!
author: Pat
info_3: Thermostat is difficult to program. I'm pretty good with technical/computerized items and this is the first I've come across that was next to impossible for me to set up. So I've just set the temp and forget the rest of it. It comes down to that old adage - you get what you pay for!

title: Internal connections were bad before I got around to hanging it
author: Anony Bob
