title: Five Stars
author: Paul Byers
info_3: worked great

title: Five Stars
author: jman
info_3: works fine

title: Five Stars
author: moroni
info_3: Perfect

title: Five Stars
author: Robert Taylor
info_3: love it

title: Unable to adjust the temp.....
author: Keibbler
info_3: Product does work but does not allow me to adjust the temp when I press the arrow up or down button.  Amazon.com has been very fast and is sending me out a replacement.  I will be more than happy to keep you updated.

title: Limited operating range
author: John in Seattle
info_3: For my use this unit has a fatal flaw.  The lowest operating temperature is 32deg. If temperature goes lower than that, then this unit WILL NOT turn the heat on. I called the help line and they confirmed it was operating correctly.  It can not be used to control a heater in a normally unheated garage or cabin that may drop below 32deg.  What were they thinking?

title: Cheap easy to install, Saves you loads of money.
author: Jose Munoz
info_3: I've always been pleased with Honeywell products, this programmable thermostat is perfect for the price and suits a medium size home/apartment. Took me about 10-15min to install; I replaced the old mercury dial thermostat which was driving up the electric bill.

title: Very cheap thermostat,
author: J. BLAIR
info_3: this is the third one in 2 years. Like I said it is cheap but also cheap as in price and it is only used for my garage.

title: Please do not give honeywell your business.
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: I have now bought 3 different honeywell thermostats from 3 different stores (lowes, menards & amazon) all had a big dirty finger print on the LCD.  Contacted honeywell & was told it's a normal part of the assembly process & there was now way to get 1 that does not have a fingerprint on it! Unbelievable, will not be buying anymore honeywell products.

title: DONT BUY!! Cheap! Cheap!
author: John Blalock
info_3: Does not work on two wire system, will instantly burn the board. My roommate spent $50 on a nicer thermostat and his worked. (Same setup). 110 volt wires turning off/on baseboard heat.

title: Annoying thermostat
author: Elena
info_3: This came up as a #1 seller so I bought it.  It's pretty annoyingly complicated if you just want a simple thermostat. Also it has a protective feature where if you go to change the temp it turns off, the only starts back up at the newly set temp after 5 min.  Super annoying and you can't turn that feature off.

title: as they don't hate America.
author: jack
info_3: Defective with cold solder joints on the pins for the terminal block. Several were broken upon receipt. Honeywell quality has gone rapidly downhill since they shifted manufacturing to Mexico. Ended up purchasing an ICM controls thermostat after returning this, as they don't hate America.

title: One Star
author: Ricky
info_3: No emergency heat, had to pay 150$ for a blown fuse.

title: I gave it a low rating as when I read ...
author: Margaret J.
info_3: I gave it a low rating as when I read the description on the site it did not say that it could not be used with a heat pump that had auxiliary heat which I do so I cannot install it.

title: Five Stars
author: S. A. P.
info_3: I am glad I bought this mouse. very sharp and handy. works well on any surface.

title: Not recommended
author: Ram
info_3: Think before you buy this. Devil is in the details. This is a battery operated unit (Why!) and the display and buttons are not really readable in low light.

title: Makes air handler blow fuses
author: Jennifer Weatherford
info_3: Total piece of crap.  Bought 2 and caused our ac to blow 2 fuses in the first week we had them.  Going to have to return for a different thermostat that isnt total crap.

title: Wrong product
author: Lee
info_3: Non prgromable

title: Dont buy
author: ryan
info_3: Doesn't work I installed and now that cold weather is here it's 4 days past they won't exchange WASIT OF MONEY

title: Didn't have instructions that applied to my situation
author: Alan
info_3: I had a really basic thermostat that I was replacing.  One of the round ones with the mercury switch inside.  (Made by Honeywell, I might add).  Once removed, just two wires came out of the wall.  When you touch the two wires together, the furnace comes on, and when you keep them apart the furnace is off.  Couldn't be simpler.But can you imagine that this thermostat doesn't have instructions for that scenario?  I was able to Google instructions eventually, but it is ridiculous that it describes what to do if you have 5 different colored wires but not what to do if you have only two.  By the way, what you had to do was remove a jumper and attach your two wires to the CORRECT two posts, which I no longer recall.  After that the thermostat works fine, but it was unnecessarily complicated for such a simple use case.I did end up buying a second one, for the upstairs.

title: not what was listed
author: J. Johnson
info_3: This said it was one model and it was not. listed as RTH2300 yet is an RTH221. Has no backlight and is not a 5-2 day programable. You can only program the same for everyday.It is still an ok deal and we can make it work but listing needs to be evaluated and adjusted to reflect the actual product. Even the heading shows RTH2300 5-2 day programable.My advice is not to buy this product if you need thses features. These two models look exactly alike. If the listing is not acurate which this one is not you are not going to get the product you want.We made it work for now but again not happy not the product listed.

title: Died a few weeks after the return window
author: cnwh
info_3: I purchased mine in May 2013, and it died two days ago - I woke up and found it completely off, so I replaced the batteries, and then it displayed an incorrect temperature (about 10 degrees higher than actual), and there seemed to be some moisture in the back of the display panel. I pulled the new batteries out and let it dry out for several hours, tried again to power it up with replacement batteries, and when I tried to snap the front of the unit back to the wall, the display just got all scrambled and never recovered. This was past the return window, so I'm out ~$30.

title: Does the job as advertised
author: Robert Reale
info_3: Easy to install and program. Apparently I need to add more words to satisfy amazons requirements so I've done that.

title: Nice unit but poor temp regulation
author: Dweib McGee
info_3: Works as advertised. Got it two bucks cheaper here than at Menard's. Realising we only paid $22 for this, that little black smudge in lower right of display which some complain about, and is only visible when the light is on, is very insignificant and of no consequence. Silly people. Since wife is home all day, I have wake, leave, and return all programmed with the same time and temperature of 72Â° @ 5:45 a.m. Sleep is set for 65Â° @ 11:00 p.m. everyday. Weekends have wake, leave and return set for 8:00 a. m. The backlight feature is really nice in our darker hallway. Lights up when pressing the run button to check time and temperature. Fairly easy to program. Recommended. Only issues was having to spackle, sand and paint the wall where the previous larger unit was and noticed it was having hard time regulating temperature. Set at 72Â°, it would quit at 74Â° near 75Â°.(too warm).and come on at 71Â°, nearer to 70Â° (too cold). Noticed in the advanced menu, there is a setting for high efficiency furnaces (90% or higher). Our 20 year old furnace has a 95% efficient label. So have now changed the thermostat from the.5 setting to 3. Now this morning I see it did shut off at 72Â°. So we'll see how it goes over the next few days.

title: Cooling cycle range too tight - cycles AC ineffiently.
author: Dorena Rode
info_3: I purchased this thermostat in 2013.  It works great and is still running on the original batteries.  Great thermostat for the price.  My only issue with it is that it doesn't have a way to program the cool cycle rates or the cycle on and off temperatures.  I've confirmed this with the Honeywell help technician.  I've seen a couple of posts that say the heat cycle is adjustable, but the manual doesn't give instructions for that either.  I only use this for cooling.  So, yesterday my program is set for cool to come on at 80 and it does.  The AC runs for 7 minutes and then turns off - thermostat still reading 80.  It is supposed to be +/- one degree and mine seems to be operating at a tighter range then that.  Unfortunately it is bad for the AC and not efficient to run less than 15 minutes.  Fortunately, this is less of an issue here in Arizona in July, when the system will run constantly and never move the temperature.What I do this time of year is simply operate the system manually.  I keep the program set about 2-4 degrees above what is comfortable and when I get hot I just hit the arrow button to do a temporary override of the program.  When I get comfortable I hit the run button to reinstate the programmed temperature.  I like this thermostat because it is easy to override and reinstate program.If anyone knows of a inexpensive thermostat where I can set my cooling window to +/- 3 degrees let me know.  It seems this feature is only available on thermostats that cost $100 or more.

title: Three Stars
author: STaylorJuly
info_3: Wouldn't know the man of my home still hasn't put it up yet, but I believe it will work.

title: Great Thermostat - But follow the directions
author: John & Lindy
info_3: I bought this as a replacement for an older model honeywell programmable thermostat that had batteries that expired that made the unit become temperamental (worked most of the time but the readings on the screen kept indicating batteries needing replacement even though new batteries had been installed). This new thermostat was smaller than the unit it was replacing. The new thermostat had more features. When I first installed this unit the old tags on the  wires fell off as I removed each wire from the old thermostat so I could not be certain which wire went into which position on the new one. Being a little flustered by losing the wire tags, I skimmed the directions and dig not pay close attention to where the wires connected with the thermostat.  I plugged the wires into the back of the unit instead of on the top of the back of the unit. The front of the unit could not be snapped into place because the wires were where the prongs were supposed to be engaged. The wires were larger in diameter than the prongs, enlarging the holes for the prongs to connect. After moving the wires where they were supposed to go and connecting the faceplate in position I could not get the system to turn on. I was not sure whether the wires were in the wrong position or if the prongs were not making contact. After several adjustments, everything started working. The unit works great and was easy to program. We have used it for both air conditioning and heating. Just take time to mark your wires with the tags provided and follow the directions for how they connect to unit as part of the installation and you will have a great programmable thermostat.

title: 5 Stars
author: tim baldy
info_3: AOK as advertised

title: I threw it out.
author: Walter S Edwards
info_3: I bought this item, and following the instructions, tried to take it apart to install it.  I'm not ignorant of such devices, having worked for years in building maintenance.  But it wouldn't open easily, so I tried to pry the back plate off with a screwdriver.  Instead of having the back plate come off, the whole thing came apart.  -  The buttons and the window and a couple of other pieces fell out.  I felt some rather oily dampness on my fingers.  I called Honeywell, and a woman I talked to (who, when I asked, said she was located in India) said that she was going to talk me through putting it back together.  I said no, thank you, and ended the conversation.  The remains of the thermostat are now in the trash, because I don't want to go to all the hassle and expense of returning it.  I will buy a different brand of thermostat from Home Depot, where I can easily return it if it doesn't work.

title: So far so good.
author: JT
info_3: This thermostat was a good price, had decent ratings, and had the features I wanted. So far, it's done everything I need it to. I'm not sure if I'd agree that it's as simple to program as other people have said. I figured it out, but it seems like it could still be confusing to people. If you never figured out how to make your VCR stop flashing 12:00, this may still be tricky for you. The good news is, you can ask your 5 year old kid to program it for you!

title: An E-A-S-Y instal!!
author: R. L. Taylor
info_3: I was somewhat hesitant about buying/installing this thermostat!!My system was on the blink and I thought it was my older Honeywell thermostat on the fritz. I installed this after waking up to a house that was 44Âº!! The instructions were simple and straight forward, install was completed within 1/2 an hour. Alas, the thermostat wasn't the problem:I had dirty contacts to the heating elements!!The installation manual provides several different configurations - it was needed as my configuration was slightly different from the "standard" one. One caveat - you'll need precision screwdrivers!!The programming is simple and a plus I wasn't really looking for. I use the factory setting(s) and will over-ride the thermostat when I want it hotter in my house - I'm sure I will do the same as far as cooling when the weather gets warmer.I great deal overall...

title: Good solution if you need to replace a two-wire thermostat.
author: Reviewer Pro
info_3: My apartment's thermostat has gone "kaput" and I decided to replace it myself with the permission of my landlord. He gave me the go-ahead when I told him it would only be $25.The directions were very clear, and thankfully, the old unit I was disconnecting had its terminals marked ?“Â I was able to very easily label the wires using the provided label sheet and re-connect them to this new Honeywell unit.There are a few things about this unit that preclude me from giving me a five-star review. Firstly, the inside clips holding the middle plastic panel to the front panel are poorly designed. They don't fasten very well. Next, the thermostat read 80+ degrees (F) for at least a half-hour after I installed it. No, the package wasn't sitting outside in the heat before I brought it in. Eventually it read the proper ambient temperature compared to some meat/brewing thermometers I had sitting around. Lastly, the LCD panel seems to have some sort of dirt or dust from the factory in the lower-right corner. None of these issues make the unit less functional, but it is a clear reminder of how little it costs. Shrug.In the end, I had no issues installing it and it operates my heater (a hydronic/radiant heater, for those in suspense) without issue.

title: We shall see !? ;)
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Honestly i have not installed my Honeywell Thermostat yet so i can not say 1st hand. However, I do hear by word of mouth that these are fantastic devices!

title: Extremely Sensitive Control
author: LarryZ
info_3: I bought this model to replace my old, hard-to-program thermostat. Very simple. Easy to install. Easy to program. Did it all in lessthan a half hour. Very precise temperature control. Maintains temperature to 1 degree. Wherein, there is the rub.When they say maintains temperature to +/- 1 degree, they mean 1 degree. At whatever temperature you set, if your room temperature changes by 1 degree, your furnace goes on. When it recovers that 1 degree, it shuts off. I have seen my furnace go on and run for three minutes and shut off. Three minutes later, it goes on again and repeats the cycle. It does this continuously until the next set-back.My electric bill has gone up 50% due to the frequent cycling, and my gas bill went up 30%. All due to the frequent cycling of the system.I suggest you opt for a thermostat that has a 2-3 degree cycle range. It will still maintain a comfortable temperature without running as frequently.

title: Honeywell has fallen from being a good company to another outsourced, underwhelming, purveyor of substandard products.
author: Dr. John
info_3: I am concerned that Honeywell has gone the way of Sunbeem and other iconic US brands. I bought one of these at my local blue home center.  While it seems to work, the LCD display is bad. When illuminated, it looks dirty in the bottom right corner. I called customer service, after the requisite trouble shooting and talking with a "supervisor" and sending a pic of the LCD they did send me a new one. The new one arrived today, sadly it has the same issue. I tried to call the corporate office to tell them, but was unable to speak to anyone. I think they need to know that they must have a bad batch of LCDs.Well it appears that another fine company has succummed to corporate greed and poor product support The outsourced CS is as you would expect. Poor!  I am unfortunately unable to recommend this or any other Honeywell product.

title: Easy to install, works great
author: John S. Parke
info_3: I research every product that I buy online. After reading several reviews, I concluded that this was the best choice for my needs. I have a gas furnace and electric central AC. My old thermostat was calibrated about 2 degrees too warm, and there was no way to fix it, so for $23, it was worth buying a replacement. I looked at Lowes, but I didn't see this exact model in the store.I had never replaced a thermostat before, but this was extremely easy. I had my toolbox ready, including a small precision screwdriver, & it took me 7 minutes to install it. There are countless YouTube videos explaining how it's done, but the manual instructions are sufficient.The thermostat works great! It is simple to use. Programming it also dead simple. I like the fact that it doesn't have a hinged door that you have to open. All the buttons are always visible and easily accessible.The only reason I withheld a star in my rating is that the green LED screen has a bit of a smudgy looking flaw in the right 1/3 corner. It's not noticeable unless the screen is lit, but it's still a flaw, so I can't give it 5 stars. However, it works, it's easy to install, & the price is right. I would buy it again.

title: Need a watch battery screwdriver but otherwise easy install...other issues
author: VitaT
info_3: I replaced an ancient Honeywell round thermostat with this one.  I was initially going to purchase a much more expensive model to hide the cabling better but  I just put this on top of the old gold faceplate that came with the old honeywell thermostat.  Looks fine.  It took about 15 minutes to install.  The tools you will need:-Ideally a power drill or impact drill with a  phillips bit to remove screws, and install new screws- a watch battery screwdriver to connect the black and white cables.- The box does not come with one.After six months I noticed real savings.  Be patient.After two months of using this unit, there were no cost savings.  I just didn't have to adjust the thermostat each morning and evening.  What did happen is that this caused my ancient boiler to run inefficiently (the boiler would come off and on consistently when cold) causing my gas bill to go up significantly.  The aquastat had to be adjusted and the low setting and differential were decreased by a homeservice heating professional.

title: Stopped working after 8 months
author: KaraBee
info_3: First off, right out of the box, the display had some black digital particles in one corner, ugly, but did not effect the functionality, just visually disappointing. Secondly and most importantly, this thermostat did not last. I bought this in January and it stopped working in August. I live in TX and August is not the time of year for the A/C to stop working! I noticed the issue one day when I set the temperature to 75 when it was 88 outside the A/C kicked on for two minutes and then off, but my condenser outside never shut off! Just the inside fan keeps going on for about 2 minutes and then suddenly off and on all night, all the time never getting down 75. I thought maybe I was working the A/C too hard, maybe it froze over, so I turned it off for the rest off the night and all day and turned it on the next evening, same issue. I checked the coils and everything I could think of to see what was wrong, and nothing. So I turned off the thermostat again and the a/c kicks on again even though my thermostat is in the off position! I checked all the wires and connections, nothing wrong with it, so what gives? The temps are going to be in the 100's the next few days or weeks even, so I got a new thermostat at the Home Depot, and everything is working fine! Not sure if the one I got was a knock off or what, but it was definitely something wrong with this thermostat, what a waste of $$!

title: Great value and unit with a slight modification required because of shabby manufacturing
author: slugmanjj
info_3: As a thermostat, it is easy to use and install.  Our old thermostat died and I used the supplied labels, marked the wires and it works on the old 4 wire system.  The only issue (and I have read this before), is when you take the back off to insert the batteries, the entire unit fell apart with the display, buttons, etc, all coming apart.  I have read that many people said upon initial set up out of the box the unit was broken.  It is actually not broken, but has bad assembly for a good engineered product.  Assembled out of USA.  If you can put that parts back together, then remove the back.  You should be able to hot glue the sides (after installing the batteries) and the unit will hold together.  I did this and have tested successfully.  It is hard to rate this because mechanically, it works perfect, but their assembly is HORRIBLE.  Buy it, get a hot glue gun and for $20 you are ready to go.  Honeywell should really look at their assembly plant on this one as it is a great product being killed by bad assembly.  Just my two cents.

title: A lot of Pro's - Not so many Con's
author: Kelsey Marie
info_3: 7/14/14I just installed this thermostat two days ago and so far it seems to be working great! I have never in my life installed a thermostat and after watching a YouTube video, I was able to do it without calling anyone for help. It's very straightforward, especially if your wires are color coded. It comes with stickers to label the wires if you need to and it comes with the hardware needed to mount it to the wall.The only things I dislike - and the reason I deducted a star - is that it's really hard to pull the faceplate off. I'm a little worried next time I do it I might even pull the whole thing off the wall despite being screwed in. It also takes batteries only although from what I have been told they should only need replaced annually and even then it will tell you 60 days prior to it dying that it needs changed. Another downside is that every time you change batteries, you have to program your settings all over again. But that's just me nitpicking. For the price, it's well worth it and should save me a lot of money on my energy bill.

title: Easy to install; easy to program
author: Penelope
info_3: This product allows you to set your wake, leave, return and bed time and the target temp for each of those times, in order to avoid wasted heating/cooling when not needed. You set 1 program for Mon-Fri, and another program for Sat and Sun.I have a heater only, with only 2 wires, and it was easy to install and very user-friendly and intuitive to set the programming. Figuring out the wiring labels was the hardest part, and I had to refer to youtube and Google to determine which letters each wire corresponded to (as my old thermostat referenced 3 letters for each wire, so I was unsure which letter to use and didn't want to damage my heater by guessing wrong).My old thermostat used to run the heater for severals hours and overheat the house, then allow the house to get too cold. This thermostat does NOT allow you to set the variance (+/- degrees from the target temp). I was initially concerned that the heater might turn on and off too much trying to maintain the target temp. However, I'm pleased to advise that the heater has not done that, and yet, the entire house has been surprisingly comfortable. (My house has minimal insulation and drafty windows and doors, and the thermostat is in the hallway, where there are no heater vents.  I was contemplating getting a $300+ thermostat with remote room sensors to ensure we are heating efficiently. But at the low price for this product, I decided to try/test this inexpensive one out first.  I'm so glad I did. It works like a charm, which I didn't think was possible in my house.

title: Simple and easy to install
author: Kaycee Stone
info_3: Our old thermostat wasn't controlling the temperature at all and we actually thought we had a problem with our AC. I decided to try this first, and didn't want something fancy. I installed this today, which took less than 30 minutes start to finish with clean up and finding my screwdriver. The AC came right on and my house finally cooled down!It isn't super fancy, but the programming is pretty nice and our old one didn't have that option. It's been at least a month and it is still doing well.

title: Below average
author: A. Nicol
info_3: Below average

title: I took a leap and purchased this one and it was so easy to install
author: John Y.
info_3: At first I was worried about replacing my thermostat as I have heard horror stories on issues they had.  I took a leap and purchased this one and it was so easy to install.  Everything was labeled and the instructions were very detailed.  It took me about 10 mins to replace my existing thermostat and another 5 mins to figure out the programming.  All in all it is a good thermostat for what I need it for.I did have the mark on the bottom right of the screen that everyone has complained about and it is strange to see but I don't plan on looking at my thermostat too often.

title: You get what you pay for
author: yongjoo
info_3: Do yourself a favor and buy a more expensive thermostat. Ok, I'm not the brightest. I had a Lux thermostat that worked great for 4 years. We had some people do some work and I guess they turned off the electricity to the air conditioner. I believed the Lux thermostat broke. So I bought this product to replace it. I really didn't need the extra bells and whistles the Lux offered, so I decided to get this product. Anyway, I installed this product to finally realize it was the fuse was the issue. Because I installed the thermostat already I used it. It would turn my air conditioner on and off at the slightest temperature change. On, Off, On, Off. The thermostat wasn't off at all. The product worked. It just wasn't as smart as it could be. Ok, maybe  I'm being too hard on Honeywell. But, what I'm saying is that you get what you pay for. Electricity ain't cheap. Do yourself a favor and buy a smarter thermostat.

title: Works great but as another guy mentioned
author: Mr. Tactful
info_3: Works great but as another guy mentioned, it's almost too sensitive-it should have a 2 degree swing before it kicks the AC on rather than just 1. I'm thinking about putting it in one of those boxes just to create sort of a buffer around it so that it doesn't kick the system on so readily.Update:I disliked that this thermostat is probably TOO accurate/sensitive/quick to react to changes in temperature as small as 1 degree, causing the AC to cycle too frequently.I opened the unit to find the temperature sensor. It isn't obvious, but when you remove the circuit board from the housing, and you're looking at the side of the board that faces outward/toward you as it is when the unit is installed, there is one dot on the board in the upper right area that is larger than all the other dots. Once you see it, you can't unsee it, and to be sure, you can flip the board around and it's a similar dot in the exact same spot on the rear of the board; it goes all the way through.That is the temp sensor. I put a small piece of duct tape over just the front side of the dot and this solves the issue. For different tape or more damping, you could tape over both sides of it, but just over the front made this thermostat perform exactly like you knew it could.Upon reassembly, the only issue you're likely to have is making sure the white plastic sliders for the bottom switches line up with the sliders they control on the board; everything pops right back together if they're lined up, and won't if they're not.

title: It works
author: Alex
info_3: This thermostat does exactly what it says it is going to do.  It was easy to hook up, easy to program, and if you are on a regular schedule like myself I don't see the point in spending a few hundred dollars on a smart thermostat when this can do the same thing for 25 bucks.To hook it up I just removed the old thermostat, took a picture of the wiring, then wired this up the exact same as the old one.  You do need a very tiny screwdriver to make the connections, but I think that is probably true of any thermostat.  You also have to put batteries in it.

title: Worlds better than my old 100% manual thermostat with no timer
author: Simmer
info_3: At first I was looking to get one of those fancy Wifi thermostats....because....well.....i have to have everything top notch. lol. I have my whole house controlled by my phone in some way, but in the end, just couldnt swallow paying 3-4 times the price for the added convience I didnt really feel I absolutely needed.Still finding it hard to accept I was settling for less after buying this one, its been weeks since and I am just as happy with this one. Sure wifi would have been nice, but coming from what I had (100% manual adjustment with no timer), this works just as good for me. I come home and the house is cool (summer time). So Im happy.The only thing was setting up the times. I went through a period of several days to 'see what worked' for me, and if I want to adjust any of the times, I had to go through all the pages of set up again just to change one thing. Was slightly annoying, but its set now and I dont have to worry about it until the season changes.The wiring was also very easy. I just matched the wires to what I had on the old thermostat and it worked perfectly. Just make sure you shut the power off to it first.I recommend.

title: Worked for 8 months.
author: amazon4lyfe
info_3: Last night at 11pm, my AC unit stopped working. I unfortunately live in a city where the low is 78Â° and that's JUST before sunrise.I called a 24 hour HVAC service the next morning to come fix my AC unit because the forecast for the next several months is about 100Â°. Turns out it was just the thermostat I had purchased just 8 months ago was faulty.So, buyer beware. And just a note, if you don't already know, if your AC stops working and your thermostat looks totally normal, try running to Home Depot or wherever and picking up a new thermostat before you pay a technician 3x the cost of a new one, to tell you you need a new one. Learn from my HVAC ignorance!!!

title: Easy Peezy! If you can work your three TV/Cable/DVR ...
author: Pbbland
info_3: My second Honeywell to install (two different houses). Easy Peezy! If you can work your three TV/Cable/DVR remotes don't pay someone else to install this for you. I just have a plain "all electric" HVAC system so I don't know if my review is applicable to Heat Pumps or gas furnaces. I just remember using a small Philips head, a pair of needle nose pliers and a very small slot screwdriver (probably about 1/16). Easy step-by-step instructions. I misplaced a wire at first so I called the help line. They answered quickly and courteously. By the time we introduced ourselves I saw my mistake and quickly corrected it. Two notes: This does require very good eyesight or very good glasses. Also, make sure you know how to turn off the power to your HVAC. Recommended! Oh, nobody gave me anything to say this =)

title: Cheap and basic, but fully functional.
author: Cerulean Dragon
info_3: Does exactly what I needed in a thermostat. Multi-time programming, turns heat on and off when needed, cheap. Absolutely love it. Nothing irked me more (or cost me more) than leaving the heat cranked when I left the house for work. My apartment is a poorly insulated sieve to begin with, even with plastic on the windows and when it was -10-20 out it was costing me $300-$450/mo on gas heat. After my ex moved out I tried really hard to turn the heat down before I'd leave for work or go to bed, but sometimes I'd forget, so either I'd have to drag myself out of bed when I was just dozing off, or be griping to myself all day at work knowing that the heat was cranked at home for no reason.Weekday/weekend and 4 settings in a day: Wake up (turn up), leave for work (turn down), come home (up), go to bed (bed). And since I get my daughter on the weekends (and don't work) I have the weekends set differently. Perfect.Unfortunately in my case the previous thermostat was so old it had non-standard markings and I had to basically take a shot in the dark as to which wire was positive and which was negative, for the basic 2-lead configuration. Not the fault of the Honeywell though, so no stars lost for that.

title: Works as advertised
author: AzGrannie3
info_3: I gave this 4 stars because this thermostat is a real bear to program.  It hooked up in a matter of minutes but the programming is horrible.  It really doesn't program the way the directions say it should.  You have to keep going through it again and again to finally get it to the days you want.  I need to set it so all 7 days are the same because I'm retired and use the same schedule everyday.  I finally got M-F programmed and could not get it to pull up Sat or Sun. After scrolling through each day over and over again, I finally reached Sun...yep Sun, not Sat.  So, I programmed Sun to match M-F.  Then finally Sat/Sun popped up and I could then reprogram it for the weekend.  Now, after many temper tantrums it's programmed and works great so far.The knobs underneath are quite cheap when you're moving them from Heat-Off-Cool.  They seem to be loose and don't slide very easily.  I was concerned about breaking them when I was trying to move them from Heat to Cool.  The buttons on the face of the thermostat seem to be pretty good and adjust the temp easily.  For being made by Honeywell, I expected more quality but for the price I got what I paid for.  My daughter bought one at Lowe's that did the same programming as this one and paid about $15 more for hers.  Not sure what the brand of her's was.Installation was very easy and the directions for that are very clear, especially if you already have the colored wires in your wall.  Even if you don't, it comes with labels to label each wire with it's corresponding color.  The picture guide included is very easy to read so you know exactly which position to insert each wire into.

title: but the LCD screen definitely looks like someone touched it and discolored it during install
author: Christopher Guymon
info_3: had the same issue as many others have.  It works, but the LCD screen definitely looks like someone touched it and discolored it during install.  Bottom right quarter of the screen is all fuzzy.

title: expensive
author: j3000
info_3: the control is too complicated.The cover says it handles outside power source. but when i call the service hotline, they are not helpful at all.

title: Great thermostat that's easy to use and reliable.
author: TJ092561
info_3: Purchased this Packard PTD102 timer along with Supco relay - http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004XS148C?redirect=true&ref_=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_4 ...and a Honeywell thermostat - http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B007BHLUWM?redirect=true&ref_=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_3I wired these into the furnace control circuit (very easy to do) so the furnace blower turns ON via the thermostat and sends the signal to this Packard timer. This timer then turns on the Supco relay that supplies 120 volts to a small window air conditioner (5,000 BTU).I have the window air conditioner in the basement near the furnace and made a sheet metal duct to direct the dry, chilled air from the air conditioner into the duct work. The furnace blower grabs the air and distributes the cool, dry air throughout the house and it is now very, very comfortable (and inexpensive) for central air - in Michigan muggy summer. Never exceeds 73 degrees, and very low humidity in the home. Sister loves it.Calculated usage puts the worst case $$ at $0.14 per hour (960 watts) for the window A/C and furnace blower fan. Even if it ran for 24 hours/day...that's just $100/month. All from a $120 window air conditioner and about another $80 in parts :)I know, I know...they say you should only cool 150 square feet of space with these little air conditioners...but this is the second time I've done this. The first one is in it's second summer in ultra-humid Spartanburg, South Carolina. I use the Haier brand without any electronic controls...just basic mechanical thermostat that is built in to it...and set it on MAX COOL - http://www.amazon.com/AMERICA-TRADING-HWF05XCL-Conditioner-5000-BTU/dp/B00BDRXN30/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1435615912&sr=8-3&keywords=haier+air+conditioner ( I buy these from another big-box for $120).The timer is set for 3 minutes and prevents the window A/C from turning ON if power is interrupted from a power outage...or turning the thermostat ON/OFF. It's very hard on an A/C compressor to cycle ON without giving time to dissipate the pressure built-up within the compressor. This little timer does the trick by preventing the A/C window unit from turning ON for 3 minutes when the thermostat turns on the furnace blower during a call for cool. Great thermostat that's easy to use and reliable.I also use this thermostat to turn on the whole-house air filtering system. I wired this thermostat to turn on a Supco relay... http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004XS148C?redirect=true&ref_=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_4 ...that turns on the furnace blower...and use a BoAir 5-stage washable, electrostatic filter with lifetime warranty to collect all the nasty stuff in the air... http://www.amazon.com/14x24x1-Boair-5-Stage-Electrostatic-Washable/dp/B001FM9UCG/ref=sr_1_6?ie=UTF8&qid=1435619396&sr=8-6&keywords=boair+electrostatic+air+filterThe thermostat is NOT being used to control heat/cool...I am using it for it's simple programming and ability to turn on during set times of the day. I use the HEAT setting and program it to turn ON twice each day...for 4 hours each period. By setting the temperature to 90-degrees, the thermostat will turn ON as it is in the basement near the furnace (where it rarely exceeds 70-degrees)...and turn ON the furnace blower to filter the home's air...and turn OFF after the 4-hour period. Simple and very effective. Whole-house air filtering and a lot less dusting and cleaning the home now.

title: Honeywell digital thermostat
author: J. K. Bennett
info_3: This thermostat is very easy to install, particularly if you follow the manufacturer's instruction.  Pay close attention to the placement of the batteries in the picture in the instruction.  The battery placement if looking at the item is confusing.  The programming is very easy and fast.  This is the second Honeywell thermostat I have had.  I bought this one because it is backlit.  Good value for the price.

title: A great product, so far, at a great price
author: R. Fillbach
info_3: I replaced my manual (mercury) thermostat about seven years ago with a ritetemp programmable controller.  It finally stopped working 10 days ago.  I ordered this on Prime about a week ago and got it quickly.  I was very happy with the price.  I was able to install it in about 15 minutes, helped, no doubt by my previous experience.  I actually thought I had ordered the non programmable item since I am retired and keep some odd hours.  But this thermostat includes a "permanent" manual mode so I can set the temp up and down as I wish, 24 hours a day, without having to override the programmed setting.  I can still decide, at some later date, to go back to the programmed mode with the simple touch of a button.  The only reason I did not give this item 5 stars, aside from the fact I have only used it for several days, is that it does not have a "swing temp" feature that would allow me to decide if the heater should kick on if the temperature deviates from its set point by 1,2 or even 3 degrees.  With a plus/minus variation of only 1 degree the heater cycles off an on more frequently.  Some say it adds to their heating bills??

title: love this!
author: Bmankins
info_3: This thing has cut my energy cost so much! I went from an OLD thermostat to this and WOW the difference is great!  Also, I put this thing on myself. I am NOT familiar with things like this at all. I have ALWAYS had someone around I could rely on to do things like this or to help me though it, this time I did not.  I followed the instructions and did it. No problems at all. Great buy!

title: good reviews
author: S. hariton
info_3: it got great reviews but i have it laying on my desk ,  not installed yet

title: A nice change from non-programmable thermostat!
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: The thermostat that came with our house wasn't programmable. We've used it for 9 years, just having to remember to turn the heat down at night and up in the morning. But the backlight went out and it was really difficult to see the numbers. I almost bought the one like this that wasn't programmable, but realized at the last minute that it didn't come with backlighting, so I got this instead. It's a nice change to have the temperature change itself and not have to remember to do it manually. The screen is easy to read and the settings are easy to change or override.

title: This was a huge disappointment to say the least
author: Livermoreleo
info_3: The device was junk.  When I opened it in order to connect the wires the guts fell out.  Every part was loose as if someone just jammed the parts inside and snapped the cover on.  When I tried to assemble it some parts were missing.  This was a huge disappointment to say the least.

title: One lasted me 6 months and the other 12 months.
author: Nathan Kraft
info_3: I purchased two of these thermostats in December 2016 to replace non-programmable thermostats for my two central air/heat pump units. After about 7 months of use, the first unit stopped turning on the air conditioner compressor and I replaced the unit with my old thermostat. Today (December 15, 2017) The other unit stopped turning on the compressor. Each time the indoor blower continued to operate. I'm contacting Honeywell about their one year warranty.

title: I successfully installed this thermostat and it worked just fine. The problem is after all the work installing ...
author: John B.
info_3: I successfully installed this thermostat and it worked just fine.  The problem is after all the work installing it, the thermostat will not stay snapped on the back.  I'm returning it for a better product.  Honeywell usually makes a better product than this.  Not attractive when it just hangs on the wall.  I tried to contact Honeywell and gave up because of the long wait.

title: I only have a two wire system in my home and found this was super easy install
author: vanguard t
info_3: Bought this for our new home, was really reluctant to order based on some of the reviews. I only have a two wire system in my home and found this was super easy install. Red wire to R/C and white to W, works perfect. I was able to program the remote to lower the heat at night and warm up in the morning before we wake. You can also set up weekend times and away times. if your looking for an inexpensive digital thermostat buy with confidence. I did not find this confusing at all, it was a little intimidating at first; however, once I played with it for a few minutes It was real easy to understand and program. I did find hooking it up was not explained very well, although it was easy enough to figure out.

title: Check Wire Labels Before Ordering
author: cking
info_3: I have a standard central heat/air pump and this does not work on a "multi-stage" system (not sure how I could have determined that prior to trying to install this). Take a peek at your wires before ordering - I had a white wire labeled W2 which made this thermostat incompatible. On a positive note, Honeywell customer service was quick, very helpful and gave me a list of compatible models.

title: Great value for the price!
author: Kim Sepulveda
info_3: Bought this to replace the one that I already had because the old one wasn't working anymore. The old one is 8+ years old and has served us well.  Love this thermostat because it's easy to read and simple to program. No, it's not smart-phone or bluetooth enabled.  That could be considered a good thing.......can't be hacked!!

title: Easy unit to use
author: Shelly B.
info_3: This was a very easy thermostat for my husband to install. I did need the instructions to program it as it was a bit confusing at first, I had to program for weekdays and the weekends. But now it seems rather easy. The only issue I had was that it shows only the current temperature. It would be nice if it also displayed what the set temperature is. We have an older furnace and it's just one way to know all is working as it should. This is of course just personal preference, not worthy of losing a star. It works as it should and keeps us comfortable.

title: Buying this thermostat costed me $$$$$
author: Bill
info_3: I bought this thermostat because it had such great reviews for a basic model. After hooking it up the cooling side worked but the heating portion wouldn't fire my furnace to produce heat. I didn't have heat for 3 days until a heating and cooling company came out and found out that the thermostat that was sent to me was broken. $160.00 house call and a new $50.00 thermostat that I should have never spent if Amazon wouldn't have sent me a broken thermostat from the beginning. Extremely unsatifsfied.

title: Pretty decent, especially for the price
author: AmazonK
info_3: Pretty decent, especially for the price. Two complaints: the LCD is poor quality and there is what appears to be "dust" (little black speckles) inside the LCD on the lower right hand corner. Other complaint is there is no C terminal so that the unit can run without batteries. The unit I replaced with this Honeywell was a super cheapo GemTech, but could be powered off the C wire, with batteries as a backup power source.Lastly, while not a complaint because I knew what I was getting, I wish they let you pick the degree difference when to turn on. +/- 1 degree is too little for my location, so it's turning on quite often. I know there is a workaround by selecting max number of times it turns on per hour under the advanced settings, but I prefer to set it by degree difference.

title: This is my 3rd one. I bought first two ...
author: Steve C
info_3: This is my 3rd one. I bought first two for each unit in my house 5 years ago. One of them started acting up with flickering screen and lock ups after 2 years then it died few days ago. I tried resetting it and cleaning the contacts but it was completely dead. I didn't want to buy different one so I just bought same one so I don't have to switch out the backplate.

title: This issue is the a prime example of misrepresentation of the product and pathetic engineering which renders these thermostats useless in a garage ...
author: Adriano Oppio
info_3: Important note to all Honeywell thermostat potential buyers:After purchasing a programmable thermostat last year (RTH2300), we recently found out that THEY WILL NOT HEAT BELOW 32 degrees C. A ?œLO??indication will appear on the screen and it will not call for heat. There is no indication of this limitation on the manuals or on the packaging so anyone that wants to purchase a Honeywell thermostat for their weekend home or garage, be forewarned.This issue is the a prime example of misrepresentation of the product and pathetic engineering which renders these thermostats useless in a garage or anywhere else the temperature may drop below freezing. If you have a weekend cabin (of course with water shut off) that is expected to be heated on a preset time using Honeywell thermostats, you are in for a bit surprise when you arrive.After contacting Honeywell support I received conflicting information from the initial support agent and the supervisor regarding this flaw. They were also not willing to remedy this issue due to it being over 1 year old. They would not even accept an upgrade option to a commercial unit that would have this ability. I have over 32 Honeywell thermostats at my company that are due for upgrade and I assure you that this experience has definitely assisted with this decision.What is the point of a thermostat that will not turn on the heat when the ambient temperature is below freezing ?????

title: Exactly what I was looking for
author: kevman
info_3: It does exactly what I want it to.  You can program it to come on during the week before you get up in the morning, and go off whenever, then have it come back on right before you get home and go off at bedtime.  Then you can have separate time settings for the weekend.Not that you can't do this for individual days, it is divided into week, and weekend.  Since I get up, go to work, get home, and go to bed at the same time during the week, I don't want to have to program each day individually, this was much easier.  You can manually adjust the temp at any time and it will reset once it passes into the next time preset.

title: Great investment!
author: Young
info_3: I ordered these for my new house, the old thermostats didn't seem to register the temperature correctly. These are fantastic, they were easy to install, only two wires, and extremely easy to program. We were able to program a temperature for when we wake in the morning during the week, when we leave for work, when we return from work and when we would go to bed. Then there is the option to program for the weekend as well. We set the heat to turn on a little later and were able to put in the time we usually leave to do activities on the weekend.It's a great investment and we have no issues with them. Plus it's nice to wake up in the morning to a warm house!

title: Could be much easier.
author: John F.
info_3: Item arrived as expected.  Unpacked it, that's where the fun began.  Couldn't get it apart.  Had a place that stated to Pull (the face forward) to open.  Hah!  I may be 73 but my hands are accustomed difficult things.  Not this baby.  Finally got it apart, removed the old thermostat from the wall, yes, of course this one mounts differently.  I expected that.  Hooked it up per the instructions, turned the electric back on to the A/C & heat units.  Fan runs constantly when in the OFF position.  Also in either heat or A/C positions.  Called Honeywell Customer Service.  2nd worst phone system in the world.  Finally after calling 3 different numbers and getting the same recordings on all I finally got thru to a young fella (in India - no problem, speaks English probably better than do I).  He told me to take the face off the wall mount.  Wrestled with that for a few minutes and finally it came off - in pieces.  The face, the circuit board with display, the batteries.  I had the face, the rest went flying.  Boxed it up and shipped it back.  Bah, humbug!

title: Well worth the money
author: Shodan
info_3: Excellent thermostat.  Easy to use and to install.update:  thirty days after installing I got up one morning the screen was blank.  Nothing worked.  Changed batteries, nothing.  Hit it on the palm of my hand and it started up again.  This makes two in a row I had the exact same thing happen.

title: Poor quality and display features
author: NP
info_3: For some reason this thermostat is incompatible with our A/C however it works fine with controlling our Heating...we changed it out thinking perhaps it was a faulty unit but had the same issue.The switches used to control the thermostat Heat/Cool and Auto/Fan are very stiff.The display shows current temperature only instead of both current and programmed temperatures. Personally we prefer both displayed.

title: Works great. Tip
author: rbyteme
info_3: Works great. Tip: Don't do what I do -- read the damn instructions first. Rule #1 - LABEL THE WIRES. I foolishly assumed yellow would go in the Y slot, but in my case it went in the W slot...and Blue went in the Y slot. Had to pay a Just Answer HVAC guy to help me straighten out the mess of my own making.

title: Lowered my bills with this thermostat. Perfect!
author: amazonmasterz
info_3: I had a little trouble installing since my house is old and my wires aren't the same colors as those listed in the instruction manual. But once I got it up and running (about an hour of frustration before the voila!), this thermostat has done the trick. My electric bill has dropped by 35% on same-temp-as-before days, and by as much as 75% in the cooler weather. My heat/air fan no longer blows constantly, as the program actually works and regulates my air temperature perfectly. Well worth the small investment.

title: Cheap, reliable, programmable and gets the job done.
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Smart thermostats seem to be all the rage these days.  However, they cost $200-300 if you're getting the one you can show off to your friends.  I just wanted something dependable that I could program and then forget about.  This does the job, for around 20 bucks.  I'm already hundreds ahead in savings vs. the "smart" thermos.  I liked that this requires batteries because my old setup doesn't have a power wire.  The batteries supposedly last a season or so, and you get a two month warning when they're low.Installation was easy.  I had an old analog thermostat from what looked like the 1950s.  Two wires (mine is heat only) disconnected, then reconnected to the new one.  Done.  I've been monitoring the different programmed cycles and everything is working great so far.

title: Good, but it doesn't display ambient temperature
author: Richard Himmel
info_3: Easy to install, and it does the job. It does not display the ambient temperature in the house, however, only the temperature you have it set at. I like to see both numbers displayed on a thermostat, so after a few days I purchased a different thermostat.

title: Should come with a back plate
author: C. Mayer
info_3: Bought this unit yesterday and was unhappy that it fell apart in pieces when trying to get the back section off. It took several minutes to put the main board and controls back together and it now has a smudged area in the right corner when lit up. Too bad they didn't have a screw in there so it didn't come apart to change the batteries. Aside that, I still need to learn how to program it. Glad it doesn't cycle any more often that the old mercury one did. I have a furnace blower that I replaced the motor and that might not last the winter either. So, cycling likely puts more strain on it and the two utilities. I have a couple of ceramic space heaters in rooms like the bathroom and the bedroom and the cords usually don't get very warm. This cuts down on the furnace use during times it isn't as cold out. Wish these came with a back plate as they're almost about the same price as the thermostat.

title: Terrific affordable universal thermostat
author: Snow Bird
info_3: I bought this contrary to what Honywells tech support phone rep had to say. I needed a replacement for the thermostat in my RV (which is 12 volts D.C.), they said it would not work for that.  Being an electronics tech, I asked one more question ( "Does it click when turning on? They said yes) that was the key, if it clicked, it has a relay, therefore it can control any low voltage, low current  load.  It also has the wireing  configuration to support two different power sources (AC & Heat).  It works great, and since its power comes from 2 aaa batteries, the voltage it is controlling has no bearing on that.  Actually that was two years ago, and working fine. My latest purchase was for a 120 volt space heater, way beyond the voltage or current capacity for the thermostat, but using it to control a solid state relay (with 5v from a discarded phone charger),  Controls the space heater within +/-  2 degrees of (scheduled) set point. No more cold bedroom, during day 55 degrees, bedtime 72, sleep time 68, wake up 72, then back to 55 for energy saving, while not in bedroom.

title: Can't begin to tell you how bad this is.
author: Alonzo
info_3: Can't begin because I couldn't begin to install it.To install the themostat, you have to seperate the wall plate from the thermostat.You cannot remove the wallplatew from the thermostat. I pulled where it says pull.It wouldn't come loose.  I pried. I pulled and pried. No luck. I ran a blade around the edges.Still stuck.I pried out the corners.Nothing.I pulled, pried after prying the corners. Zip.I pried so much, it will no longer snap back together.....but the back won't come off.I tried the help line.  They were busy.  Then they were closed.Wal-Mart is still open......I'm returning it.

title: Great Product!
author: K. Kress
info_3: Great product. Not a lot of bells and whistles like some thermostats but that is why I like it. It is basic and easy to program. While we are at work we lower the temp during the winter months and program it to kick on about 30 minutes before we are scheduled to be home to heat up the house again. On the weekends we keep it steady because we are usually home. During the summer months we program it to get hotter in the house when we are not home and have it kick in again about 30 minutes before we are scheduled to be home to cool the house. It doesnt look as "fancy" as some of the newer products coming out but it does a great job! Program it to to certain temps while you are away or sleeping or you can just keep the temp steady and dont have to program it if you dont want. Its up to you. No you cannot "control" it with your phone or tablet but then again, why would you need to? It takes a couple of AA batteries and they usually last a long time. Easy to install and if you have questions there is a number to call in the instruction booklet if you have problems. I called once as I was confused about where a couple of the wires went and customer service was very helpful....just know your type of furnace and model number first before you call because they will need that information. Good luck!

title: Good Device just a few flaws
author: Chris Knight
info_3: Decent thermostat, but note these important gotchas. If you can deal with a small flaw with the LCD screen, and a momentary bad temperature reading this is really a good unit. Been working great for several days now.1. Dirty or gray digital screen in bottom right corner. Witnessed first-hand with two units, first with older body style (white buttons), again with latest body style (gray buttons) right out of the box. Seems to be a flaw in the production process.2. Rising temperature reading directly after installing. For a moment the unit seemed defective. The house was in reality 68 degrees and dropping but the device read 72, then 73, and on up to 76 after a few minutes. Tip: Wait 20 minutes and the temperature reading should be correct. It is something to do with first connecting it to electricity, or handling it with warm hands. Super weird though.

title: The instructions say you will probably need to change the batteries every year which is not to bad. It was fairly easy to install and program
author: Brlux
info_3: I realize this is about the cheapest programmable thermostat you can buy so what were you expecting but I gave 3 stars because there are some things missing that I think should be in a thermostat, It should have a different program for cooling verse heating. This one needs 2AAA batteries to power it, there is not a C wire connection for powering it off the AC wires. The instructions say you will probably need to change the batteries every year which is not to bad. It was fairly easy to install and program.

title: Simply doesn't work
author: Jeffb47
info_3: I replaced all 5 thermostats in my house with these.  Some work fine, but 2 don't.  Example: I set "Wake" for 6am but noticed that at 4am it was already in "Wake" mode.  Consequently, the lower temp setting for "Sleep" is essentially ignored, thus defeating the purpose for these in the first place.

title: They are made in China and Honeywell would have found cheapest workshop to make them - it is very hard to find such poor quality
author: Y. Dai
info_3: Honeywell's series of thermostat remain at 1970s design and 1980s manufacturing quality. All these thermostat would have similar problems and won't last long. The mode switches exposed to air will have contact problem soon - even here in California's dry climate - the contacts are not gold plated and became black. They are made in China and Honeywell would have found cheapest workshop to make them - it is very hard to find such poor quality workshop in China now - the SMD seems to be soldered with minimum amount of solder and likely to be manually done. I do found pins that are wrapped with solder but not soldered. The insertion socket of the base usually not solid or will have contact problem also. The screws may be over tighten with feet already broken.My review is for specific model only.

title: Wish there was an off option for programming.
author: jmsnine
info_3: LCD can be better.  Works well.  Programming is easy.  With there was a way to turn off the unit by programming.  Instead now I set it to the lowest temperature to make sure heater does not come on.

title: You have to stay on top of it
author: Rob Pendell
info_3: We installed this thermostat at the beginning of the winter and initially it worked fine.  However, when the batteries got low the thermostat stopped following our programmed temps and just started keeping the temperature at a single temperature.  Our previous thermostat was a set-it-and-forget-it deal that worked fine until it conked out completely after 3-years, but it got us in the habit of trusting the thermostat to do what we told it to do, and this one did not.  A few extra hundred dollars of oil later, we realized that the thermostat was not dipping the temp down when we wanted it to.  You get what you pay for - we will spend more on our next thermostat to avoid paying for it 10 times over in the long run.

title: DANGER!  DO NOT BUY!
author: W. Kos
info_3: Honeywell RTH2300B1012/E1  5-2 Day Programmable ThermostatThis thermostat should be recalled immediately.  Installed it about a month ago.  Worked fine until last night.  Luckily my Dog woke me up, I woke up in a sweat, house was over 80 degrees, thermostat display was BLANK, buttons would not respond, heat was stuck on, furnace was overheated and smoking.  I had to pull the thermostat from the base to shut the heat down.  Tested the batteries, they were fine.  This thing is defective, it should have never failed to a 'heat on' mode.  Lucky I was home or it probably would have killed my pets or burned my house down.Reinstalled my old thermostat for now.

title: AVOID AVOID AVOID!
author: Chandler Hasemeyer
info_3: Thermostat was faulty, causing erroneous voltage to run through the transformer on the air handler. This resulted in the entire HVAC system to fail on the coldest night of the season so far. Because of this, a professional HVAC technician had to troubleshoot the cause of the bad voltage and ultimately narrowed it down to the thermostat. I paid $250 for the company to fix the system and I am currently working with Honeywell customer service to recover that amount. We'll see if their customer service is as good as advertised. Spend the money on a higher quality unit and save yourself lots of time and money. Hopefully my case is an isolated incident. I chose this tstat based on the reviews I read here, but I guess there's bound to be a few bad ones out there. My personal experience only, but I absolutely do not recommend this thermostat.

title: Simple - Cheep - Does the job.
author: T McCann
info_3: The thermostat quits on new year eve.  Did the consumer report research and there is a lot of options, from phone control to on-off  switches.  I picked this unit because it was simple.  Turns the temperature on-off 4 times during the day i.e. warmup the house 6:00AM - 8:00AM and repeat the cycle from 5:00PM - 10:00 PM.  You get to set the cycle for M-F and a separate cycle on weekends.  You can turn up the temperature any time you want.  Let say your home all day.  Just press the up button.  It took me about 15 min to install and another 5 min to program.  It not complicated and the price is right.  I do not need to spend $300 to monitor the house tempetrature nor is my life so complicated that the thermostat needs to learn my life style.

title: Get the Honeywell Th4110D1007 instead
author: Peter K.
info_3: Avoid buying these cheapo thermostats sold at Home Depot, Lowes, Walmart unless you want to replace it every year.This one started acting randomly right after the 1 yr  warranty expired.Upgraded to Honeywell RTH6350. That was even worse. After 7 months, heater would not come on or just blow unheated air.Finally, bought the Honeywell Th4110D1007. Now furnace works fine.This is a pro model, usually sold only to a/c contractors.It has a 5 yr warranty instead of a 1 yr.  Currently amazon has a great price on it.

title: Not junk but I wouldn't put another one in a house I intended to keep.
author: Terry J. Peavler
info_3: We run two of these, side by side, running the fireplace and a backup furnace. They were great at first but then one stopped calling for heat. Then the other did the same. When this problem begins, sometimes you can get it to work by unsnapping it from the base and then just put it back on. Today I started one by smacking it with my hand. Batteries seem to have nothing to do with it. I have been replacing them one at a time but sticking with the same units for aesthetic reasons. I have now bought five, and another one is failing. When we travel in the winter I replace both with the old non-programable ones they replaced. Since I love programable I am going to swap both out for good ones, maybe even Nests. I could have had one already for what I have spent.

title: Bad for heatpump. Good for you power company.
author: whatever
info_3: Works for heatpump BUT it seems to use emergency/secondary heat regularly no matter the temperature swing. It can be 45 outside and 70 inside and if I bump it to 71 the aux/sec/emerg heat kicks on. Kills you on electric bills and cycles system constantly.  Maintains a perfect temp but not efficient or good for you equipment. I tried for 6 months and pulled them out and replaced with Lux. Also tried another honeywell first but it was the same poor performer. With lux you can set it to no cycle as often by setting the allowable drop in degreen from 1 to 9 before cycling. Also the lux allows you to aux heat gap, it if you require x den increase us aux otherwise use heatpump.

title: works but quality is horrible..
author: Esra, Burak and BABY melissa's reviews
info_3: first.. it was very easy to install. especially if you owned a similar one before and if you only have 2 wire heating system.. i installed it less then 10 minutes.. i think it took longer to find the screwdriver in the drawer..second. the product it self.. when i read the reviews everyone was complain that there was spotting on the lcd screen and i decided to get it anyway.. mine wasnt that bad but still there was spots on lcd.. kind of upsetting because the honeywell is a good company and for them to take out a product in this condition is unacceptable..finally.. would i recommend it.. it all depends if you need something cheap and works this is it..

title: Still love it.
author: Love 2 shop
info_3: It works great with my air conditioning. I have not used the heat portion yet. I'm very happy I bought this. I would buy again with no regrets. After reading the review I was expecting something cheaply made. I can compare it to the same products in Lowes and Home Depot at a much higher price. It is well made and doesn't look cheap at all. It is very easy to install and program. I had it replaced in just a few minutes. I read in the reviews that the fan keeps running. If it is properly installed it works like a charm. You may want to check the wireing or call the number on the instructions. Thanks so much for the sale.UpdateIt's been 1 year and 2 months that I bought this on Amazon. I can say I've not had any problems with this product. Nothing broken, no malfunctions what so ever. It has held up well. It is a great deal for the price. If this one ever stops working, I will buy from you again.

title: Simple, Affordable
author: Daniel
info_3: I've installed 7 of these. They're a great value. They're very simple. Complete disassembly down to the circuit board takes less than 30 seconds if you have a need. I like these for office settings where I want to set the programming and not allow others to change the programming. Remove rubber buttons and contacts from the board, nip the labels off until the buttons are flush with the exterior of the thermostat, reassembled all within 3 minutes.They've been working flawlessly and accomplishing my wallet's goal of fighting back against rising electricity rates.

title: Don't bother!
author: Louis
info_3: Horrible instructions. No labels on the terminals you figure it out and put them on yourself. Really Honeywell? What a joke! Don't buy this!

title: Works well, very convenient
author: Zack
info_3: Does exactly what I need and works perfectly with my floorboard radiators. I opted for this model over the slightly cheaper one that doesn't allow you to program in weekends. I like that I can program in different schedules for the weekends because I hardly ever go to work on Saturday or Sunday. Much better than the crappy old analog thermostat that was in my apartment!

title: Cheaply made piece of garbage. Works great for a while
author: Jay Holland
info_3: Cheaply made piece of garbage.  Works great for a while, then when the battery needs to be changed, it will never keep temperature after that. You set it to 72, and it will sit at 68 or 65 or whatever, until you turn it off and on again two or three times. Then it works well again for about a week or so.  I have a two story building with two thermostats, and in the past five years I have gone through seven of these between the two floor. They are basically disposibale thermostats.

title: Imprecise
author: RobMNJ2017
info_3: It normally engages the heat forty five minutes to one hour prior to when I want it warm.  I have a furnace; it doesn't take that long.  Thus it is warm far too early, and I have to reprogram it to start later and later.  I have the same issue, in reverse, when I want the house to cool.  I also find that it resets itself for no obvious reason.  I will be replacing this unit.

title: A home project that (for once) went off without a hitch!
author: M. Riston
info_3: I ordered this thermostat in hopes of replacing one of our old mercury Honeywell units that likely had been the original in our 1954 house. With my luck in the past, I've come to expect simple projects (such as this one) to actually end up taking 5 days over 2 weeks. I got this unit amazingly fast as always (Thanks Amazon Prime!), and began to read the users manuals that are included."Take the old unit off, mark the wires, replace with new unit."Yeah, sure, I thought - When pigs fly!Wouldn't you know it, the thing WORKED! This has been the most rewarding (and simplest) home project we've yet encountered, and I can only hope the rest will go as well.The only gripe I have about this unit is that it 'over-runs' our specified heat setting a little more than I'd prefer. For instance, we set it to 65 deg and the unit kicks on when it drops below, but runs until the rooms are around 68 or 69 deg. Not a huge deal, as I'm sure this is saving wear and tear on our furnace, but it's not exactly how I expected it to function.Still an A+ buy and will likely get another in the near future!

title: Great Little Thermostat.
author: Steve Coakley
info_3: These can be installed and programmed in less than 5 minutes then it holds the temp. to within 1 deg. of the setpoint. That's amazing when you consider it's even cheaper than the old dumb round ones. The only problem I can see with it is that the text on the LCD screen is really tiny and can be hard to read and I'm not crazy about using penlight cells to power it that can leak and damage the insides.

title: Shorted Out A/C system
author: moodiblues
info_3: This piece of junk stopped working and shorted out my a/c system resulting in hundreds of dollars for repair when I set it to heat. Cave emptor: Buyer beware!

title: Works great and easy to install
author: Koogan
info_3: This was reasonably priced and I found it easy to install.  I suggest watching the installation video on YouTube.  That's a little simpler than the instructions that come with the product.

title: Doesn't keep the temp I set
author: Brian Beffort
info_3: This is easy to set up and program, but it doesn't keep the temperature I set. Set at 68, I often come in to find its own screen reading 72 in the room and the heater chugging away. It seems this should be pretty easy to do: when the temperature it reads hits the temperature set, turn off. So why isn't it?

title: ... was no problem and it seems to be working fine. My only issues are with the display
author: Bamavic
info_3: Just installed this unit and installation was no problem and it seems to be working fine.  My only issues are with the display:  the set point is not displayed constantly on the control screen so you do not know what the set point is.  I think you can find out by just pressing the set button but I like to just look at the unit and know what the set point is.  Also, the day of week figures are very tiny and hard to read.

title: Money Saving Thermostat
author: WORKSTATION
info_3: Haven't got this yet but I am excited about this purchase. My apartment has this crappy non programmable thermostat. I cant wait to not have to remember to shut it off to save money when I'm not home. Having a separate weekdays vs weekends will save me lots of money. Although buyers should make sure they are not using a heat pump as this wont support that.

title: Honeywell works better than the Hunter I bought the first go around
author: Terry
info_3: I got this locally after the Hunter thermostat I bought was discovered to be defective.Make sure you turn off the power to your furnace before removing wires from your existing thermostat. Usually a switch off the left side of the furnace, mine it is on the top right directly under the fuse. If you don't turn the power off to the furnace you could cause damage to the furnace and will damage the thermostat.  It gives instructions in the easy install manual that comes with the thermostat.  Some I guess don't read that and lost their money having to buy another one for replacement.Had problem with the plastic screw holder, (forget their name) not wanting to fit into the hole I made for them so I just didn't use them. They aren't necessary to attach the back plate to the wall.The Honeywell's use a tiny screw to hold the wires in place where the Hunter's use a flip toggle.  I had some difficulty getting the wires into the hole in the top, they do not go in very far, just tighten the screw and gently tug on the wire. If it stays in you installed it correctly.The colors of the wires are not always correct so make sure you take note or label the wires with the included stickers before removing from the old thermostat.  In my case my Yellow wire is actually blue though the other wires were correctly colored.In the Hunters the power for the furnace is labeled RH but in the Honeywell it is R. Leave the jumper in place and put the wire into the R hole in the TOP of the connector where the jumper is. Technically you could put the wire in either one of the ports but the manual shows to put it into the R port which is what I did.Some units have a power wire, C or O coming off the furnace / compressor.  These thermostats do NOT use this as they are powered by batteries. If you try to hook that wire into the thermostat you will damage it so use electrical tape or a cap and cover it up and push it into the wall.My unit it seems there is a dark spot on the digital display, like something dirty got behind the display.  Nothing that causes any problems but it isn't a "clean" look when the back light is on.Mine seems to be off a few degrees from other parts of the house though there is a bit of a temperature dip in that part of the house so it is probably correct for where the thermostat is sitting on the wall. Just not on the other side of the house so I have to set the schedule a few degrees lower to get that right temperature.It uses AAA batteries instead of AA, would be nice if the industry chose a standard instead of one have one kind of battery and another a different kind.Everything seems to work though. The Hunter I bought the scheduling did not work, was ALWAYS set to Asleep mode no matter what. This Honeywell all that works well.  I had a 7 day programmable which was very annoying to have to set each day individually this thermostat you set once for week days then another round for weekends. You don't set each day individually which is what I thought this would allow. Actually glad it doesn't work that way because you have to go through ALL the settings no matter which one you wanted to check on.This does allow you to set the temperature manually and also make it a permanent temp for all time or just temporarily until the next schedule time happens. Which is nice.I mentioned this but the temp does seem to go past the temp you set it for by one degree, I guess this can be adjusted by changing the span in Advanced settings but they don't give any information about what each setting means.  It defaults at 5 but can be changed all the way down to 2.  No idea what that means for run times or temperature span, they didn't bother including that in the manuals that came with the thermostat.It's a nice thermostat, works. You shouldn't have to touch it once the settings are set to your liking, it comes preset from factory but your daily pattern may not be what the default is set to.

title: Didnt last as long as i would like
author: Jonny
info_3: Worked good for 3 years. And then completely died. Walked into 90 degree home on 30 degree day..

title: Garbage, don't bother.
author: SwampdonkeY
info_3: Garbage, spend a little more and get yourself a better thermostat, maybe a Nest. This thing is somewhat difficult to program because the controls are not intuitive. Easy to install but a pain in the ass to use. Why would it be so hard to just set a temp and put it on auto? Because depending on what day or time of the day it is, your pre programmed temp overrides all.

title: Inexpensive programmable thermostat! Great buy!!
author: Shopperct06
info_3: Easy to install and works great! This replaces an earlier model of this I had.
