It started working intermittently and after having the oil company replace a couple valves due to no heat they finally advised it is probably the thermostat not working properly. I removed a star because it displays the time in military time and I can?™t find anywhere on how to change it to normal AM and PM.

title: Ok, but some annoyances would keep me from repurchasing.
author: Mara
info_3: It's mostly functional. The biggest annoyance is when display says: "cool on", but it's not turning on or running at all. It can be like that 5-10 minutes. That's quite irritating on hot summer days when you're desperate for relief. The other issue is that it randomly says batteries are low, which is very confusing because I don't know if I should change them or not.

title: I only find out that it maintains a very narrow ...
author: Yu Zhen
info_3: I only find out that it maintains a very narrow range, i.e. 1 F degree, which it is not necessary. It makes too frequent on and off. It should allow me to set the range for 'off' too. For example, I should be allowed to press the 'Hold' key and make it 'on' when it comes to 56 F, and then set to somewhere 64 F to turn it off. I will cycle on and off between 56 F and 64 F.

title: Great, simple, programmable thermostat
author: Aaron Shorey
info_3: This thermostat shipped and arrived quickly, was the correct product (2300) and took maybe 20 minutes to install and program.  Super easy, just follow the instructions.  Turn off the power, mark your old wires, mount the back plate, connect your wires in the labelled spots, add batteries, connect faceplate, turn on power , and program!  The weekday and weekend programs are probably sufficient for most people who work a regular schedule.  Have only had it for a couple days now but if it holds up, I'd say you can do much better for the money!

title: I just installed it 2 years ago and am pretty disgusted as even though it is an inexpensive unit
author: ann
info_3: I just tried to turn on the heat for the first time this year and the unit is dead.  I changed the batteries and pressed all buttons in an effort to reset and restart, but it is basically bricked.  I just installed it 2 years ago and am pretty disgusted as even though it is an inexpensive unit, I do think that 2 years is a pretty short life-span for a thermostat.  I am going back to a mechanical thermostat.  I will not spend more money on an electronic one if I am expected to replace it every couple years like a cell phone.

title: Don't waste your time or money for this cheap, crappy product with horendous customer service
author: Michelle
info_3: This thermostat is cheap garbage. We originally purchased this to replace the manual thermostat. It worked well for 4 months and then died. We put in brand new batteries and it still won't work. Amazon told us to contact the manufacturer, the manufacturer told us to contact Amazon. After I said that we had tried to contact Amazon first and they told us to contact them they said I had to take a bunch of pictures and then email them over and then call to verify that they received my email. I don't feel like sitting on hold for another hour jumping thru hoops and listening to crappy music that is interrupted every 5 seconds, so this is where I am stopping and saying that the $24 is a loss and we will never be buying the brand again. The customer service is from India and barely speaks English. Save your frustrations and spend a little more for a better quality product. Had I known this would be the way it would have turned out, I would have ordered a new one a week ago when my AC (in Florida) went out instead of trying to catch them when the hold wasn't over an hour or they were open.

title: Nice
author: clifford sherman
info_3: Provides real-time accurate forecasts of temperature. Very reliable. The battery lasts long too!

title: Not goood...
author: Ann Barlow
info_3: Not many options for programming. One problem after the other.  Just stops working and then starts again days later.  Replaced with one that works all the time:)

title: it is working just fine. We like to keep the home at 65 ...
author: SONIK
info_3: Picked this up from local HomeDepot for 24.97 to replace my old dial non-programmable thermostat for oil heater against the advise of HomeDepot guy. He wasn't sure if it will work with oil heater. That was the reason I went cheap. After replacement, it is working just fine. We like to keep the home at 65 while sleeping but prefer it little toasty around 72 when we get up and start daily chores and that my first day of testing, it has worked. One less star due to tough task to remove the thermostat from the wall plate.

title: Hate it . . . I mean, REALLY hate it.
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: The pre-programed settings are terrible.  They kept coming back.  We got it to work, then it stopped.  We could just not get it to stay on 72 degrees for any length of time without it eventually going back to the awful programming.  Hate it.

title: I bought 3 of these and they are complicated to ...
author: tilcycat
info_3: I bought 3 of these and they are complicated to program and create a problem whenever you want to temporarily overide the system to increase the heat.  I do not reccommend this thermostat.

title: Five Stars
author: James A. Young
info_3: Easy install on a three wire hydronic system.

title: Easy, inexpensive solution
author: M. Miranda
info_3: I used one of these to replace an old circle thermostat that I found difficult to see at night and wanted programming features on. Easily connected to the R and W. Uses 2 AAA batteries. Lights up so it's easy to read, and easy to program.

title: Cheap is as cheap does
author: kdw61
info_3: Cheap is cheap.  Mine does not read temp accurately.  House will be 70 degrees with the ac running, but it reads 76 and keeps climbing until I manually turn the ac off. Then the temp reading finally comes down to what it actually is after about a half hour.  It never turns the ac off on its own.  Who knows what it will do in the winter with the furnace.  But basically a piece of junk.  Spend $40 more and get something that actually works.

title: Does a fantastic job of keeping a stable temp compared to mechanical ...
author: doympls
info_3: Does a fantastic job of keeping a stable temp compared to mechanical thermostat. I've bought 2 and going to buy a third

title: Dead on arrival
author: Steven E.
info_3: Display was blank.  I discarded the old thermostat before realizing the new one was dead.  Spent a few days without heat as a result.  Wasted some time on the phone with tech support who instructed me how to install aaa batteries.  Ordered a replacement hoping it would arrive sooner than another make/model, but it was a day late.  Replacement is working now but can I trust it to turn the furnace off before the house sets fire?

title: Good Basic Thermostat
author: Neil P.
info_3: I have two of these in my house, and they're easy to operate and program although most of the time I use it in manual mode.  Installing is pretty simple but requires a miniature flathead screwdriver and patience. The connections are simple and the placement of the little connection "cartridge" on the backside of the thermostat isn't fully diagrammed or explained. So it's kind of a mixed review- operation is 4 star but instructions and ease of installation a 3. Overall, a good value in a simple, programmable thermostat.  My application is regular AC and gas heat.

title: One Star
author: Drew Leach
info_3: Worked well for a year and then died.

title: Beware of this loser product
author: Eugene Roome
info_3: My townhouse was built in 2000, I bought it and put in a RiteTemp programmable.  Last summer bought this Honeywell unit.During the heating season the temp has stayed stuck at 61.  Very cold.  Called help line, they told me to CALL A FURNACE REPAIR MAN.  That would cost over $300 here in Minnesota on Christmas Eve day.  Fortunately I kept the RiteTemp  and hooked it back up.  Honeywell used to be a good brand.  Call a furnace repairman?  That's incompetent and costly customer support.  Ah, I hear the furnace kicking in ... 68 and perfect.

title: Works great
author: Keith
info_3: I have had great success with this unit. Easy to install. Easy to program. Ordered the 2300 unit and received the 2300, course, I always order from Amazon so I get what is advertised. Batteries need to be replaced every six months. Your sleep and wake time should be no less than 4 degrees apart, otherwise, furnace runs for 20 minutes each day, which seems like a waste of energy to me. The air conditioning settings work the same and are also very easy to program. Also has a run fan option as well, great for pushing burnt cooking smells through the air filter. Unit has a back light, making it very easy to read. I enjoy the hold button as well for over riding the programmed settings on hotter/colder days. If and when I replace this unit, it will be one that is direct wired and not needing batteries.

title: Junk!
author: Lola
info_3: Full disclosure: Honeywell warranties aren't worth the paper they're printed on!

title: I did not work for more than 3 days after ...
author: ColoradoClimber
info_3: I did not work for more than 3 days after installation.  Our heating guy that installed the one we had to buy to replace this one said he sees this Honeywell programmable thermostat not work more often than not.

title: Great thermostat
author: Ronald Manning
info_3: Great little thermostat. I've had this one for a couple of years now. The 5-2 programming is a nice feature to have. It has easily paid for itself many times over. The battery lasts forever, and the illuminated display is always good to have.

title: Simple to operate and cheap to buy
author: Kindle Customer
info_3: Simple to operate. Cheap price.

title: It works well when she read the directions.
author: d
info_3: This works well as a thermostat and heater control unit. Initially the program is a little confusing. Once you get used to it and it works fine.

title: Surprised at number of positive reviews. Purchased this product ...
author: D. Martin
info_3: Surprised at number of positive reviews.  Purchased this product locally and it fan does not work.  Will not go on when switched to "on" mode and will not go off even when A/C reached request degrees.  Customer Service was no help at all and kept suggesting I get a local contractor in to check it out.  If I could afford a local contractor I would not have purchased their cheapest mode.  Went back to Lux.

title: The thermostat took about fifteen minutes to install. it ...
author: Phillylocks
info_3: The thermostat took about fifteen minutes to install. it works perfectly. It is also attractive. I would highly reccomend this if you need a thermostat.

title: No Usage Counter
author: Cheesewiz
info_3: *This is not intended as a complete review but rather to point out items that other reviewers may not have noted *Depending on your needs/wants this can be a servicable thermostat; however, it does have a few shortcommings.  For one it doesn't include the ability to show how long the AC/Furnance has been running (Usage).  This is a very basic feature that should be on all digital thermostats (was included in my previous 13 yr old unit). Additionally, the way you program the unit is a bit annoying but not difficult.  If you need to adjust any program setting then you must go through the process for all programs about 12 steps as opposed to 2 or 3 steps.  This unit is just avg in terms of cost and doesn't provide any additional features that warrant a better rating.  On the plus side it only requires 2 AAA batteries.  If the unit provides the features you need then I would recommend.BTW- there support was a bit iffy called several times before I could get through (4 tries).  The automated service basically says they are busy at the moment and hangs up.  Didn't provide the opportunity to stay on hold.

title: Great thermostat! I had one in my previous house ...
author: Rikki
info_3: Great thermostat! I had one in my previous house that I installed no problem. We recently bought another Reno so of course I picked another one of these easy to install thermostats up right? Not cool that this new one has micro screws in it now so I have to drive back to the hard wear which is about 45 minutes from here to pick up a micro screwdriver. Wth seriously? How about some standard screws so a normal home owner can install this!

title: Time for a new one
author: scott altfeld
info_3: Programmable is the only way to go. My old one lasted more than 15 yrs. Hope this one lasts as long.

title: Great thermostat
author: David M.
info_3: Excellent quality thermostat. I like the soft touch buttons and the first-touch light-on feature.

title: good
author: Donald S.
info_3: good

title: works fine. a little pricey for what you
author: JensFam
info_3: works fine.  a little pricey for what you get

title: Five Stars
author: D. Doorn
info_3: Very good thermostats! Quite easy to install and easy to program.

title: Five Stars
author: amanda8760
info_3: Works well and fairly easy to install between my husband and I.

title: Good thermostat for the money
author: Mark Herron
info_3: Works just fine

title: Dangerous product
author: freeseek
info_3: I have had this thermostat for less than 18 months, and it has started a very dangerous behavior. When the temperature drops below its settings (which in my case is 72F) it sometimes would do nothing. The house would get increasingly colder to the point I would notice. I just came back home and the temperature was at 67F and the thermostat is still doing nothing. If I switch it from Heat to Off and then back to Heat it immediately realizes the temperature is below settings and the heat pump starts, which means something is wrong with the thermostat. It has happened more and more often lately. This is really dangerous and it is the very last thing a thermostat should do!

title: It's a shame Honeywell use to be the best of the best. These are junk read below!
author: Everyday Primer

title: One Star
author: consumer*
info_3: peice of junk keeps braking

title: PerfectId
author: BillM
info_3: It  does exactly what it says it will do and does it simply. Not much more to say, good product at a good price.

title: It m ight be ok but it did not fit ...
author: Donald Whalen
info_3: It m ight be ok  but it did not fit my requirement

title: Horrible Complicated Thermostat
author: Amazon Customer
info_3: Bought this thermostat and it started acting up. It would say that the heater is on and set to 72degrees but it would be 60 in the house. Contacted a friend who was an AC/HVAC installer and said that this thermostat was complicated for no reason and was the cause of my house always being freezing.
